loans.name: Enter

texts.es:
Enter es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; a Enter le hubiera gustado mucho poder ser una gran Maestra de Escuela, en sus ratos libres le gusta trabajar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Enter puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de cocina, tales como especerías, gaseosas y adicionalmente hielo, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Enter se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: aceite, golosinas, bolsas y otros artículos; de esta manera Enter tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su minimarket y ser una distribuidora de hielo, así ella desea poder cumplir su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 42 years old. She is married with 4 children. 

She has had a dairy farming business for 8 years. She will be using the loan to purchase more dairy feeds and acquire high breed services and hopes this will help her to expand her dairy farming.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children well through University.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy feeds and acquire high breed AI services.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is 32 years old, married with three school age children from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is enagaged in hog raising business for ten years already and is making good sales from it. She is happy because she had received financial support from Paglaum MPC. Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 6,000.00 to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is mother of three children, two of which are married and the youngest one is currently studying a professional career. Her husband works as a taxi driver, for which his income is very variable. For this reason two years ago she started to sell shoes by catalogue. Her primary goal is to see her son finish his university studies, it is for him that she has fought so hard to continue this project. Without this business she would have no resources to cover the cost of their son’s education.

To realize her dream, Felipa requires a loan of $475 that will be put towards the purchase of merchandise to increase her sales, but more importantly to be able to pay off some outstanding accounts, for if she does not pay them she will not be able to go on. You have the power to help her and contribute to the training of their children. Make your decision – they thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa es madre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos están casados y el más pequeño se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional. Su esposo trabaja en un taxi, por lo que sus ingresos son muy variables y eventuales, por esta razón hace 2 años ella comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo. Su principal objetivo es que su hijo culmine sus estudios universitarios, es por ello que ha luchado muchísimo para continuar con este proyecto, pues sin esta actividad no tendrían los recursos para costear la educación de su hijo.

Para poder cristalizar su sueño, Felipa requiere de un préstamo de $475 dólares, mismo que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas, pero más importante aún para poder pagar unas facturas que tiene pendientes, pues si no las cubre ya no podrá continuar. Tú tienes el poder de ayudarla y contribuir a la formación de sus hijos, decídete, ellos te lo agradecen

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is 42 and her husband is 52. They have three children between 16 and 23, and a grandchild. The eldest daughter was divorced when she was pregnant. Both Hoang's husband and son have heart problems. The youngest child is a student at secondary school.

Hoang's family has 2,000 square meters of land where they grow rice. However, the main source of income comes from selling handicraft products made from dry water hyacinths. Their income is about $9 per person/month. Hoang said, "If I have enough capital, I can choose and buy better dry water hyacinths, and purchase the dry water hyacinths before the rainy season". Hoang needs a loan of $75 in order to buy the materials for handicrafts. Hoang promises to repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase dry water hyacinths before rainy season. She wants to purchase better quality water hyacinths for handicraft products.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch C. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  C. is a farmer and can make about $2 per day in her work.  Her husband, meanwhile, is a construction worker and makes about $2.50 per day.  Of their six children, two of them work at a nearby garment factory, while the others are still students.  They hope to use this loan in order to purchase a motorcycle to reduce their transportation costs.  In the future, they hope that they will be able to continue to support their children's education so that they can finish high school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her transportation

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
I have run this small convenience store for three years. Now I need to purchase more products in order to sell common goods like bananas, beans, rice, tortillas, churros and bread. This business helps me purchase medicines and afford electricity, water and the like. It is my only source of income. I would like it if you helped me be able to purchase these products, give my customers a better service and increase my sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Yo tengo este pequña pulperia hace 3 años, ahora nesecito comprar mas productos para poder vender mas como: platanos, frijoles, arroz, tortilla en bolsas, churros, confites y pan. Con ete negocio me puedo comprar yo mis medicinas ya tambien pagar gastos como electricidad, agua y otros. Este es el unico sustento que tengo. me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder comprar estos productos y asi dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y tener mas ventas.

loans.use: Purchase churros, rice, beans, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
For a living, I add sequins on embroidered shirts that are ordered for a local boutique. My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) driver. Together, we have five children, of whom are studying.

Moreover, as my children are growing, so are their needs. The rickshaw is our major source of income, as I do not get sequins orders regularly. For sequined clothing, the number of orders really depend on the customer demand and season.

Currently, our rickshaw needs maintenance which will cost us up to $175 USD. However, we do not have the money to get it repaired. Therefore, we are asking for a loan of $175 USD which we will pay back over 12 months.

loans.use: To repair rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with a grown son. Her family lives in Nikopol. Nataliya sells terry robes and men’s and women’s undergarments in the central market of Nikopol. She has a wide variety of merchandise combined with reasonable prices. Nataliya has been in this trade for 9 years, and presently, her turnover capital is about $1000.

Nataliya is trying to do everything she can to provide for her family and give her son a decent education. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business and growing her trade by increasing the number of her vending locations. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1000 to sustain her business and help ensure it continues to provide enough income to live on.

loans.use: To open a new vending spot

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee is 22 years old and is a responsible father who is ready to work hard in order to make his family comfortable and to take care of them. He works as a chauffeur in a transportation company that covers the area in which he lives. Taking advantage of being able to move between different neighborhoods and departments, he also sells and distributes different herbal medicines. While he is working, his beloved wife Cipriana helps him in his business and also takes care of his 3 year old son, Adrian. This young husband, full of love, would like to build a little house for his family, giving them comfort, security and a better life. At the moment they live in his parents home, but knowing he would like to have a home of his own, pushes him to work even harder. He would like to take advantage of this opportunity to apply for a loan to invest in it's entirety in his business. Renee needs your collaboration in this project to make it a reality.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Renee de 22 años de edad, es un responsable padre que está dispuesto a esforzarse y a trabajar mucho más para brindarles comodidad y bienestar a su amada familia, él trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transportes que brinda servicios de movilidad departamental a la población, aprovechando su paso por los diferentes departamentos también se dedica a la venta y distribución al por mayor de diferentes hiervas medicinales, mientras realiza estos oficios su querida esposa Cipriana, se queda al pendiente de su negocio y sobre todo al cuidado de su hijo, Adrián, de tres,añitos. El deseo que tiene este amoroso padre es construir su propia casita, con el fin de ofrecerles comodidad, seguridad y bienestar a su familia, ya que por el momento viven en el domicilio de sus padres, con esa proyección trabaja y se esfuerza mucho más. En esta oportunidad recurre a tu solidario corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo para invertirlos completamente en su negocio. Renee requiere tu colaboración para concretar su proyecto.

loans.use: To stock his products.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.es:
Mirza is a 40 year old single mother. She has five children to whom she provides total support so that they can finish their studies successfully. She makes a living selling ice cream and the juice and nectar from local fruits (such as cocona and star fruit). In order to sell her products, Mirza has to rent a tricycle, paying s/.10.00 per day, a price that is very high for her. Nonetheless she continues to work for the benefit of her family; she tells us that nothing is impossible when someone has a desire to get ahead even when acting as both mother and father for the family. She is grateful to God for having given her wonderful and understanding children. Her intention to improve her business and ultimately rent a shop where she can show and sell her products inspires her a great deal. Her desire to start down this path is why she is reaching out to your for assistance. With your help, Señora Mirza will achieve her goals in no time at all.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Mirza, es madre soltera y tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos a los cuales les brinda el apoyo máximo para que culminen sus estudios con éxito y se dedica a la venta de helados y néctar de frutas regionales (cocona, carambola entre otros). Mirza para vender sus productos tiene que alquilar un triciclo por el cual paga s/.10.00, por día, precio que es muy elevado para su economía, sin embargo ella lucha por seguir adelante y continuar con su labor en beneficio de su familia; nos menciona que no hay nada imposible cuando se quiere salir adelante y mucho menos representando el papel de madre y padre a la vez, ella agradece a Dios por haberle dado unos hijos maravillosos y sobre todo comprensibles.El deseo de incrementar su negocio y muy posteriormente alquilar un local donde pueda exhibir y vender sus productos la animan mucho y desea iniciar su camino por esa razón recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda. Con tu ayuda la señora Mirza logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 29-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in a house they recently bought. From the time she was young, she helped her mother run a small family convenience store. Now that she is living with her husband, she too decided to open a similar store. While her husband works for the city, she works in the small convenience store.

Today she is seeking funds to buy more merchandise in bulk for her store. In particular, she feels that if she is can purchase goods in bulk (e.g., sugar, flour, and oil), then she would be able to sell her goods at more affordable prices.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise (e.g., sugar, meat, bread, and milk) for her convenience store

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mr. Kim S. is 30 years old, and he earns approximately $6 per day selling used goods. His wife, Chin Somphos, is a 23-year-old vegetable seller at the Boung Kok Market, where she is able to earn approximately $1.50 per day. They live in Thmor Korl Village in the Kampong Cham Province with their two children, one of whom is student, while the other child is only 4 years old. In order to help his wife support their family, S. seeks a loan in the amount of $800 to enlarge his used goods-selling business.

loans.use: To expand his business of selling used goods

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena belongs to Las Dalilas Community Bank, located in Jr. Las Gaviotas Mz. 44 Lt. 8, in the Yarina Cocha District in Ucayali, Peru. She is 60 years old, and is widowed. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to get into food sales.

Now she has a little store, which she built with the first loan that she received and the earnings from her business. She looks forward to improving the space and creating a restaurant, with flavorful juanes and parrilladas. She works at the store every day, and has many clients, who are very important for her and her business.

With this loan of $375, which she will repay in 4 months, she will use part to remodel the store, and another part to buy provisions such as: rice, sugar, meat, condiments, etc.

Milena, who is getting through a difficult time with the loss of her husband, keeps moving forward for herself and her children, who are now her greatest comfort and support and her reason for living.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Milena pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Las Gaviotas Mz. 44 Lt. 8, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años, es viuda. Milena con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comidas.

En la actualidad tiene una maloquita, que construyo con los préstamo recibidos y las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio, mas adelante espera seguir ampliándolo mas y así poder tener un restaurante, con los ricos juanes y las parrilladas. Atiende todos los días y goza de mucha clientela, por que para ella son muy importantes y la razón de ser de su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá una parte en remodelar su local y otra en la compra de víveres como: arroz, azúcar, carnes, condimentos, etc.

Milena, a pesar de estar pasando por un momento muy triste de su vida con la perdida de su esposo, sigue adelante por ella y sus hijos que ahora son su gran consuelo y apoyo y la razón de ser de su vida.

loans.use: Provisions for the preparation of food

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua N. prepares food for sale. She is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Akosua and her three children. Demand for her food is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business preparing food for sale.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon V. is a housewife in Andoung Russey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her family is currently grieving because Mrs. Khon V.’s mother has just died. Unfortunately, Mrs. Khon V. does not have enough money to provide a funeral for her mother. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to deal with this problem. Mrs. Khon V. is 46 and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other one is a firewood seller.

loans.use: to provide a funeral for her mother

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda Baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. Her daughters are married while her two sons help their father in his business. Her husband makes steel chains and sells them in various markets. Rasheeda Baji is a housewife and helps her husband during the making of steel chains. She successfully completed her three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). With the profit of those loans she bought a 3-Canals plot. Now she is applying for a loan to buy an automatic chain making machine worth Pk.Rs. 1,30,000.

loans.use: to buy an electric machine

loans.name: Yot

texts.en: This is the second loan Mr. Yot Youen has asked for to improve his business activity. He raises chickens and pigs in Kbal Thnol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since his second business is going well, Mr. Yot Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Sun Beang, helps her husband with his business. Mr. Yot Y. is 37 years old and the father of five children, who are all attending school. Previously, Mr. Yot Y. had obtained a loan to buy chickens for breeding. He has succeeded to pay off the loan. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.

Maximiliana es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Maximiliana tiene una casa de material rustico en una la asociación magisterial, Maximiliana viaja 4 diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa para grandes y pequeños, los días domingos vende en la feria de San Juan Bautista con la ayuda de sus hijos. La ropa los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y en algunas oportunidades compra de los mayoristas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, blusas, pantalones. Maximiliana sueña con brindar una mejor educación de sus hijos, surtir con más productos y construir su casa con material noble.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of La Kantuta Community Bank. She's 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in a house built of rustic materials in a magisterial association, and travels to four different regional markets to sell clothes of all sizes. On Sundays, she sells at the St. Jean the Baptist Market with the help of her kids. She acquires her clothing in Lima and sometimes buys from wholesalers in the city of Ayacucho.

Maximiliana is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of sweaters, blouses and pants. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education, stock her business with more products and build a home with quality materials.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweaters, blouses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap N. was born in 1967, and she is now living in the village of Reusey Srouk in Takeo province. She is a farmer, and she owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice in order to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Phan Ly, pictured on the left, is a construction worker. They have five children who attend the local school.

Unfortunately, she and her husband do not generate sufficient revenues from their respective occupations to support their family's living expenses. Thus, Mrs. Pheap N. decided to seek a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. In turn, she hopes to increase her income and to thereby improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
La señora Marlith, socia del BC “10 de Agosto II”,  vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Jr. Tarapoto C- 01, AA.HH. 10 de Agosto, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y otros productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Marlith tiene 24 años de edad y vive con 03 hijos y con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es implementar un nuevo negocio, más adelante desea invertir en ropa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marlith, memeber of the 10 de Agosto II (August 10th II) Village Bank lives in the city of Tarapoto in San Martin, Peru. She sells groceries out of her home on Tarapoto Street in the August 10th neighborhood where most of her customers live. With this $325 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase basic groceries like rice, sugar, various brands of detergents, canned goods, milk boxes, personal hygiene products, and other products she needs to stock her business and satisfy the needs of her customers. Marlith is 24 years old and lives with her three children and her husband who works in agriculture. She is grateful for the support she will receive that will help her to grow her business. Her goal is to start a new business in the future as she would like to invest in and sell clothing as well.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, detergent, canned goods, milk boxes, personal hygiene products, etc.

loans.name: Justice

texts.en: Justice A. is 45 years old. He is married and has five children. All his children are still schooling in Obuasi, where they stay. Justice runs two different types of business simultaneously in his community. He trades in cocoa beans and at the same time owns a bicycle shop. He buys the cocoa beans directly from the farmers in the surrounding villages and sells to the cocoa-marketing companies at a premium. Justice has a small kiosk at the market square where he sells spare bicycle parts. Justice says because of his limited working capital, he is unable to procure most of the parts the people need. He wants to use the loan to procure more of the spare parts to meet the demands of his customers. Justice belongs to a Trust Bank group called “Kingdom.” The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts and bags of cocoa beans.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreb K. is a farmer in Tuol Tonsong village in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Savoeurn, owns a loud speaker, which he hires out to the villagers when they have parties. To operate this business well, Mrs. Chreb K. decided to ask for a loan to buy an electricity machine for her husband's business.

Mrs. Chreb K. is 38 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study; that child is five years old. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy an electricity machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Raetchi's Group

texts.en: These 7 persons decided to take out a loan from MicroInvest to buy seeds to extend their farming business. All of them live in the same village and they are relatives. They inherited a good place for growing grain and vegetables from grandparents (50 hectares of arable land). For them, it is very beneficial to work together because someone is responsible for the processing of the land and others are responsible for the sales market.  The leader of this group is Raetchi I., who launched the loan idea, and all members of the group have agreed to take out the loan together.  Each member of the group supports the others and is responsible for paying back the loans. If someone is delinquent or defaults, the others will pay the loan. MicroInvest is sure they have a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to increase working capital

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Down a paddy road in a back-country village, in a house with five family members, lives N., 28, a widowed mother. She is a resident of Pursat Porvince, Cambodia. She has five children: the first two are married and live separately, two others help her with her work and live with her, and the last one is attending school. Orn, N.'s mother is 63 who lives with her.
This is the forth cycle of loan with HKL and the first cycle of loan with Kiva. N. earns living selling vegetables and fruits in the Psar Tmei Market, Pursat Province since 2004. She always gets up in the early morning to buy her goods from the farmers in bulk and hurries taking them to the market with the motor taxi driver. She earns a better income for her family for she is a manageable mother and a responsible neighbor. N. wants to reduce her family's expense and to help meet the family's demands. N. is looking for a loan of $ 500 to buy a motorbike for her business and her family. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.
This is a photo of her and her motor in her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business and her family

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita L. is engaged in fashion and in selling cosmetics. She is married and has four children. She sells Avon fashion products like moisturizers, creams, lipstick, eye shadows, perfumes, and other beauty products. She enjoys this business because she earns a reasonable profit and her products help people feel confident. 

Norlita is requesting a loan of Php 23,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. In this way, she believes she can reach out to more women of all ages and help them to become more confident and beautiful through the products she sells. Selling cosmetics is a very good business and has helped Norlita support her family.

CEVI provides people with the opportunity to start their own businesses. In addition to the credit assistance that they give, they also provide training and insurance coverage for all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda sells provisions and drinks. She has been an active member of LAPO microfinance for the past 4 years. She is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Mrs. Rem C., 50, and her husband, Mr. Thy Ouch, 53, married in 1991 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both are married and live outside the family home. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Rem has been selling fish that her husband catches for twenty-one years and she raises cows as well. Mr. Thy Ouch has been a fisherman for twenty-one years; he fishes from the lake faraway from his house. Unfortunately, his fishing materials are old and broken down, so Rem is applying for a loan of US$ 600 to purchase new ones.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and boat for her husband’s fishing business

loans.name: Reuon

texts.en:
Reuon R. is 31 years old and a resident of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He sells wood carvings that he carves using wood from the forest and transports the carvings to sell to villagers in his community. He currently earns around $3 per day.

He is married to Prean, who is a vegetable farmer, and who is also a good housewife and the mother of two children; both children are single and still under their care.

The family have been planning to have a motorbike to ride, but the family's finances are only just enough for daily expenses, Therefore, Reuon R. would like a $250 loan from Kiva in order to purchase a motorbike for his family's transportation needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his family's transportation

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Don Francisca nació en la localidad de Quinamaya, tiene 32 años de edad y trabaja haciendo envasando y vendiendo cocoa, el mismo que vende por popular  zona llamada Buenos Aires, ademas, viajando por el sud de Bolivia, Villazón, tupiza, Potosí, Oruro. Doña Francisca es soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente Doña Francisca vive en la casa que se encuentra en anticrítico con su hermana. 
Doña Francisca ha invertido su dinero en la compra de una selladora para envasar la cocoa en bolsas de 250 gr., además de comprar café por quintales y envasarlos para luego venderlos.
texts.en:
Francisca was born in Quinamaya, is 32 years old, and works packaging and selling cocoa; she sells this cocoa in a zone called Buenos Aires, in addition to traveling to the south of Bolivia to Villazón, tupiza, Potosí, and Oruro. Francisca is single and does not have children. Currently Francisca lives in a house with her sister on anticredito (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over). Francisca has invested her money in the purchase of a sealer to package the cocoa in 250 gr. bags, and she has also purchased coffee by quitanles (100 kg) and packaged them to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase four quintales (100 kg) of cocoa on occasion.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena P. has been dreaming of buying another hectare of rice farm. Like any other businessperson, she wants to be successful always in all her business endeavors to support her children's education like paying the books, school projects and tuition fees. Nena turns 49 this year. Her husband, Felix P., encourages her and always expresses support for their farm business.

A long time ago, she became an active member of Community Economic Ventures Inc., a KIVA partner in the Philippines. But the reason why she would like to apply for a loan is that she needs additional capital in her business. The loan will go far in buying the necessary urea fertilizer and insecticides. 

The weekly meetings at CEVI encourage her more to stick in the program. In CEVI, clients have an opportunity to meet other entrepreneurs and do some conversation about their businesses. They also learn in biblical reflections aside from the loans that they received in the program. CEVI provides not just credit. It also offers training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase urea and insecticide

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda S. D. L. D. 47 años D. edad vive en el departamento D. La Paz con su esposo y sus tres hijos Norma D. 17 años, José D. 13 años y Jorge D. 10 años D. edad, todos los niños se encuentran estudiando. Ermelinda posee un negocio donD. venD. variedad D. productos como carne, lácteos, verduras, tamales y pan fabricados por ella. Ermelinda ya ha manejado créditos los cuales le han ayudado a seguir creciendo en su negocio, y ha sido muy responsables es sus cuotas asignadas, y en esta ocasión Ermelinda solicita un crédito para la compra D. productos y materia prima, ya que tiene mucha demanda en la zona y desea aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ermelinda Santamaria D. L. is 47 years old and lives in the department of La Paz with her husband and 3 children. Norma who is 17 years old, Jose is 13 and Jorge is 10 years old, all her children are studying. Ermelinda has a business where she sells products like meat, milk, vegetables, tamales and bread she bakes. Ermelinda has experience managing credit, which had helped her grow her business, and she has been responsible paying her quotes, this time Ermelinda requests a loan to buy products and groceries for her business because there is high demand in the area and she wants to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and groceries for her business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina A. is engaged in a general store business. Her husband Roger is a farmer in their village of Catabban Burgos, Isabela. They have three children to whom they give their full support for a brighter future. Two of her children have already finished college and now have their own jobs. Truly, hard work and patience pays, said Divina. Divina is hoping that her youngest child, who is currently studying, will also finish his studies if she works hard and perseveres in her business development.

Divina is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP10,000 as additional business capital. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for her retail business, such as canned and bottled goods, soaps, shampoo, breads, biscuits, kitchen commodities, etc. She hope to further increase her daily income from the business.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is forty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children: four sons and a daughter. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for her family. Akosua lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the central region of Ghana.

Akosua is a trader, trading in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from the nearby communities and sells at the local market. She also supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 37 years old. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. For the past four years, she has been a local manufacturer of palm oil, which is produced from palm nuts that undergo several processes. She produces and supplies the oil to food vendors, who use it to prepare their meals, and she even treks to villages to purchase the finished product when demand becomes very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and barrels to store the oil, which will increase her efficiency by allowing her to produce in larger quantities.

In addition to her palm oil business, Abena also sells used clothing. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family, and to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more bags of palm nuts and barrels to store her oil

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en: D. Naranbaatar is 26 years old and lives with his parents in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. He  currently operates a wooden products and furniture production business in his town. He produces materials  and wooden furniture used in gers, traditional Mongolian nomadic tent homes. He designs and produces the furniture himself and has one assistant that helps him. He owns a shipping container at the local market where his mother works to sell his products. Naranbaatar started his ger material and furniture production business in 2004 with the support of his father. His father, an experienced craftsman, taught him all the techniques and skills needed to make wooden products. However, after suffering a stroke, his father had to give up the trade and currently doesn't work. When he started, they  produced furniture based on customer orders, but now take orders and produce furniture for sale at the shipping container. For the future, Naranbaatar hopes to continue to grow and expand his business. He says, "With the growth of my business, I hope to take care of my parents as long as I can.”. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to purchase wood and supplies for his ger and wooden furniture business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and supplies for his ger and wooden furniture business.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay K. is 39 years old. A married woman, she lives with her other family members in the city of Phnom Penh, about 5 kilometers from the river. She makes a living by selling a snack food from her home to her neighbors in the village. Her husband earns income by driving a motor taxi (he appears in the picture). This couple has two children who are secondary students. Lay K. will be using this loan to finish repairing her old house and to buy more essential ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To finish repairing her old house and to buy more essential ingredients for her business

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Samoeun K. lives in Kor village in Takeo province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Mom Bros, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple tried to work hard, they still earned less income to support the family living. Thus, Mrs. Samoeun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers, pesticides, and she would use the rest of money to buy more grocery goods to resell. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living. She is 33 years old who are enrolled the local school. Her husband is shown on the photo with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers, pesticides, and grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Ourn's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan request for two borrowers. The leader, Mr. Ourn A., age 33, is a basket seller. He sells baskets his wife makes or buys them from other basket weavers. Ourn A. currently lives with his two young children who attend school and help weave bamboo baskets for sale. Ourn A. sells his products very well because he sells at a reasonable price. Recently, part of his inventory has been sold. He hopes to acquire more stock to continue selling, but he doesn't have enough money. Therefore, he would like a loan to order baskets from other weavers to sell.

The other borrower, Mr. Van B., is a bamboo basket seller who is requesting a loan to buy more baskets to sell. Van B.'s wife is in the photo.

loans.use: To order baskets from other weavers to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia S., age 59, is a rice farmer. She started her business way back in June 2008.  She is now managing a 3-hectare rice field in Norala, South Cotabato.  She loves her work on the farm.  Lydia is the mother of three children.  She strives hard in order to provide the basic needs of her family.

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from one of Kiva's field partners, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to support in financing her farm.  With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.use: Seeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Frashiah

texts.en:
Frashiah M. is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still attending school. She runs a retail shop selling used mattresses and cushions. She has run this business for six years and is now requesting a loan for Kes. 30,000 to buy more mattresses of varying sizes.

She describes herself as strong and hardworking and says that she has become a better saver since joining Faulu. She hopes to expand her business and have a permanent location so that she can pay to educate her youngest child and buy a plot of land on which to build a home. 

Frashiah is the woman in the centre of the photo above.

loans.use: To buy stock of mattresses in various sizes.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her customers in Agbor, Delta state. She is 46 years old and married with four children. Her youngest child is 18 years old. Her husband is a commercial driver, and he also supports the home. She has been in this business for five years. She is a very focused businesswoman. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda H. sells firewood in Aduwawa in Edo State. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to become a major distributor of firewood in her community. She has been in this business for two years. 

Rhoda is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Her youngest child is 8 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more firewood. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Soda

texts.en: Ms. Soda F., aged 41, has been a member of her local Kiva partner UIMCEC branch since 2003.  She lives and works in the Cité Lamy neighborhood of Thies, a city about 50 miles from the sprawling capital, Dakar.  Ms. F. is now on her sixth loan from UIMCEC and she will use it to finance her activity: selling perfumes and a local incense, Thiouraye.  She has been a commercante (trader) for twenty years, and she says the revenue helps make ends meet in her household where she and her husband take care of their two children and two young nephews.

loans.use: To stock incense and perfumes.

loans.name: Kimsour

texts.en:
Miss Kimsour K. (shown in the photo) is 34 and single. She lives with her widowed mother and sister on an island in the Mekong River about 15kms from Phnom Penh.

Kimsour has been a silk weaver for almost 20 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who sells them in Phnom Penh market. The house where she lives needs some repairs.  It is difficult for her family to live there. 

Kimsour is, therefore, applying for a loan of 1,000USD to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. owns a small movie house. Unlike the cinemas we see in the malls, the  movie house that she manages in the island is very small with a TV set and an audio. People go the her small movie house everyday. She earns income in this business. 

She would like to apply a loan to buy audio speakers and chairs for her movie house.

loans.use: To buy  audio speakers and chairs  for her movie house.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El    Señor Rodolfo C. Sánchez, Labora como Carpintero de Banco A en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua, el tiene  tres hijos a su cargo,  y   se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado un créditos con CEPRODEL durante un años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido este créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, bloques y mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto en su casa de habitación para uno de sus hijos.

 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Rodolfo dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rodolfo C. S. is a carpenter for Banco A at the National University in Nicaragua. He has three school-aged children in his care. He is married and he has been working with loans from Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for the past year. During this last period of time he has invested the loan into inproving his home, all thanks to the loans granted by Ceprodel. The loan that is currently requested is to purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand, construction blocks and to pay for labor. He needs to build a room in his house for one of his children. Everything he does is with the objective of providing greater safety and security and a better quality of life for his children. Rodolfo said that the loans he has received have all been put towards the improved of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and add to his home.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila P. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos Bukidnon. She is 63 years old. Leonila is separated from her spouse and has two adult children. To make a living, Leonila owns a specialized retail business which sells mats, towels, blankets and other dry goods in the local community. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leonila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roukéya

texts.fr:
En 2003, cette dame a commencé le commerce de pagnes, elle exerce son commerce  dans une boutique  à  la devanture de sa maison, elle a déjà obtenu du crédit de chez WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé, sa clientèle grandit tous les jours, pour  les satisfaire convenablement elle doit rehausser son stock, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour l’achat de 2 pagnes hollandais,  3 pagnes de  qualité GTP et 10 pagnes de qualité Hi-Target.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
In 2003, this woman began her business of selling pagnes (printed cloth used for wrap clothing). She makes her sales at her home boutique through a walk-up window. She has already received a loan through WAGES that she has properly repaid. Her clientele is growing daily, and to better meet their demands she needs to increase her stock. She is therefore requesting from WAGES a second loan to buy two Dutch pagnes, three high quality GTP brand pagnes, and 10 high quality Hi-Target brand pagnes. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lenghts of cloth

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline V. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline sells seafood products such as fish and shrimp. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 14000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 78 años , vive con su esposa Yolanda (64). No tuvieron hijos , y es por eso que habitan solos su casa que es propia.Desde hace 16 años ,se dedica  a la venta de comestibles junto a su esposa , su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los mercados de la zona donde vive. El trabajo es tranquilo, pues la experiencia de tantos años ha hecho que conozcan las necesidades de la clientela abasteciendo su puesto de surtida mercadería. Lamentablemente no puede exhibir todos sus comestibles, pues los  ladrones que a veces ingresan por  las noches a este mercado sustraen lo que encuentran. Es por esta razón que guardan sus productos en su casa , y en el negocio solo tienen lo indispensable . En el futuro desean  seguir mejorando sus ingresos, además que quieren reforzar  la seguridad de su puesto y comprar más productos comestibles  para mejorar  la ventas.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con todos sus pagos y no defraudar a su grupo solidario.José tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito en comprar  mayor cantidad de productos comestibles para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jose, 78, lives with his wife, Yolanda, 64. They have no children and live together in the house that they own. For 16 years, along with Yolanda, Jose has made a living selling grocery products. The business is located in one of the markets in their neighborhood. The work is fairly easy because the experience of so many years has taught them what their customers want and what products they have to stock to satisfy demand. Unfortunately, they can't stock all of their products at the market because thieves sometimes break in there at night and steal whatever they find. Consequently, they keep most of their products at their house and only leave at the business what they have to. They hope to improve the security of their market stall in the future, as well as improve the incomes they pull from the business. This is Jose's second MFP loan and he is committed to repaying it on time so that his community group doesn't suffer a default. He plans to use the loan to buy larger supplies of products so that he can increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Susana Filomena

texts.es: Susana Filomena tiene 54 años y 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio.  Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica como es la venta de comida, por lo que sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de proporcionar a su familia el alimento diario, por lo que no tenía mucho apoyo de sus familiares, pus solamente ella tenía que realizar las compras, la elaboración y la venta de la comida. A pesar de las situaciones que enfrento ella ha salido adelante  con su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles, carne y frutas. Su deseo es seguir ampliando su negocio y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en:
Susana is 54 years old and has three children. This will not be her first business loan and she has been selling food for the past 11 years. She began because she needed to earn an income in order to support her family, because she did not have her extended family’s support. When she began she had to do all of the work herself. Despite these and other challenges, she has come out ahead and will use the money from this loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, meats, and fruit. She wants to continue to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena T., 34, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Erwin T., a vendor, they are blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She manages her own food stall where she sells rice porridge, which is a very popular snack here in the Philippines.

Rowena has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her food business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by paying for raw ingredients needed to continue the production of her rice porridge.

Rowena dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide well for her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to continue the production of her rice porridge

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la  zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de la Paz; Marcos trabaja en  una cooperativa y el crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora para su hijo mayor, y de esta manera pueda culminar sus estudios.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de  Impro y por el carácter social y el flujo de fondos analizado puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Marcos lives in his own home with his wife and children in La Paz’s Alto San Pedro neighborhood. He works for a cooperative and will use the requested funds to buy his oldest son a computer so that he can complete his studies. This is the first time he’s asked Impro for a loan. His social characteristics and cash flow analysis qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his oldest son a computer.

loans.name: God Willing Group

texts.en:
Foday B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Willing.  He is 32 years old, single and has two children who are 3 and 6 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.   

For 7 years, he has been selling vegetable oil, milk and rice in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more vegetable oil, milk and rice.

He describes himself as an easy-going person. His dream is to improve his business and go back to school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable oil, milk and rice.

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
D. Nghiêm Thị (20201020050) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong- tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, D. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. D. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007 D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. D. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower through SEDA. D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

D. Nghiêm Thị (20201020050) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, D. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người D. trong cộng đồng địa phương.  D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2007, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  D. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en: Jesselyn T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 35 years old. Jesselyn is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Jesselyn runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years now. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch to their community. She also hopes for her husband's fishing business to grow. Jesselyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesselyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to buy fishing equipment. This will be the first loan taken out by Jesselyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and the living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and fishing equipment

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en: H. Karomat is 48 years old and is a widow, caring for her family of three children. Karomat has been running her own business for more than thirteen years: a grocery store which she attends to herself. She began this business with financial support from her father, the reason for starting the business being to enable her to feed her children. The business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business Karomat requests a loan of 10,000 Somoni. She is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more stock, thus increasing the range of her goods. She thanks everybody who decides to support her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “BARRIO LINDO” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el centro focal de Panamericana. Esta conformada por 8 mujeres que han decidido unirse para solicitar un crédito. 

La asociación “Barrio Lindo” ha elegido a la señora Cecilia como presidenta, ella así como su asociación se ven muy animadas al emprender esta nueva experiencia.
El negocio que desarrolla la señora Cecilia es el de artesanías de acuerdo a la época, comenta que aprendió de una sobrina, desde hace dos años tiene su propio negocio.
Este primer crédito es de Bs. 500.- y piensa invertirlo en material de trabajo.  Para elaborar las artesanìas recibe el apoyo de su familia, es decir su pareja y sus dos hijos.

Las otras integrantes de la asociación también tienen sus propios negocios: venta de comida “rellenos de papa”, tejido en lana de vicuña, costura de enaguas, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, artesanìas.
texts.en:
The “BARRIO LINDO” (Lovely Neighborhood) communal bank is starting its first cycle in Panamericana Focal Center. It is composed of 8 women who have decided to unite to request a loan. “Barrio Lindo” has elected Cecilia as President. She, as well as the association, is enthusiastic about starting this new experience. The business that Cecilia is in consists of seasonal crafts. She states that she learned from a niece. She has had her own business for two years. This initial loan is for Bs.500 and she intends to invest it in work materials. Her family, partner and two children, help her make the crafts. The other group members also have their own businesses: sale of “rellenos de papa” (stuffed potatoes), vicuña wool weavings, skirt making, blanket weaving, neighborhood grocery store and crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For various materials, for example: wool.

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Suwitri  is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Wayan Suwitri is the group treasurer of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Kertha Bakti (PK-10332).

Ni Wayan Suwitri is married and has 1 adult son. Her son now works at a hotel in Denpasar. Ni Wayan Suwitri owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily pigs. She raises the pigs for two to three months and then sells them to a buyer; the pigs are used for pig barbecue. When she sells a pig, the price is approximately 200,000 - 250,000 IDR above her initial cost for the piglet (excluding food costs). Ni Wayan Suwitri has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 100,000 IDR a month from these activities. In addition to this pig breeding business, Ni Wayan Suwitri also operates a small kiosk where she sells food, snacks, and other items for daily use. She has a dream to build a larger kiosk, perhaps funded in part by the profits from her pig business.  

In 2010, Ni Wayan Suwitri joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Wayan Suwitri has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  



About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Wayan Suwitri 0 (0) merupakan 40 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Wayan Suwitri adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kertha Bakti (PK-10332).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Wayan Suwitri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 20 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Suwitri menghasilkan sekitar 0,100 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Wayan Suwitri bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Wayan Suwitri telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.500.000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is a widow. She takes care of seven dependents. She has not been formally educated. Abena is into the sale of charcoal and cassava at Elmina.  The charcoal is usually measured and bagged in a black polythene bag. Abena will add her loan to her initial capital to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.  Abena plans to educate her dependents with the added income which will be generated from the loan.

To the left of A. are some bags of charcoal. In her hand also is a sample of how the charcoal is bagged.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en: Nyoka P. is currently in the business of selling local brew at home  and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeasts, sugar etc.  Nyoka is 50 years old and is widowed.   She has 1 child and her child do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials like yeasts, sugar etc

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 72 years old, widowed and mother of seven aged between 32-52 yrs. She has been practising mixed farming for over 30 years. She produces maize, tea, coffee, sugarcane, and milk, which she sells locally. She has one employee. 

She has requested this loan of Kshs. 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. This loan will earn the family extra income and thus they will be able to make some investments. In five years she aspires to have four dairy cows.

The challenge she faces is unreliable employees and lack of enough finance to continue farming practices in both dairy and crop production.  She is thankful to Juhudi and hopes for more loans.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
El señor Elvis es casado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres y colabora con los gastos y pago de servicios; la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Chamaco Chico de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es chofer propietario, trabaja en una línea de microbuses en la ciudad de La Paz además realiza tejido de mantas las cuales vende en las ferias.
El crédito lo utilizara para la reparación del motor de su movilidad. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Elvis is married and has one school-age child.  He lives in his parents' house and helps with household expenses and paying the bills.  The house is located in Chamaco Chico district, in the city of La Paz.

Elvis is an owner-driver.  He works a minibus route in the city of La Paz and also weaves blankets which he sells in markets.

Elvis will use his loan to repair his vehicle's engine as this is how he makes income for his household.

This is his first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have carried out qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To have his vehicle serviced and its engine repaired

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 27 years old and is married. He has been selling bags for three years.  His business is open from 6 am to 6 pm except on Saturday. He currently employs one other person in his business.

Samuel will use this loan to expand his business by purchasing bags in his village.  With these additional goods, Samuel hopes to earn more profits which will allow him to start saving for further reinvestment in his business.

loans.use: To buy bags to sell

loans.name: Graciela Judith

texts.es:
Graciela de 33 años, ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación durante años para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Viviendo en una zona  periurbana llamada Paraíso comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y ayudarle a su esposo. 

En la actualidad su principal actividad económica es la tienda ya que desde su inicio tuvo que mudarse de zona para tener un mejor ingreso porque antes tenía mucha competencia. Vende azúcar, snack, arroz, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros víveres para surtirla. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su tienda para tener más clientela.
texts.en:
Graciela is 33 years old. She has worked with effort and dedication for years to help her husband with the family expenses. Living in the suburban area called Paraíso, she began with the store in order to be able to support her family and help her husband.

Today her primary work is the store as since it opened she had to relocate in order to have better income because previously she had a lot of competition. She sells sugar, snacks, rice, beverages, etc. She works from 7:00 AM until 7:00 PM every day.

She wants to continue with her business therefore she wants a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil and other goods to stock the store. In the future she wants to stock more in her store in order to have more customers.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, oil

loans.name: Yankey Elizabeth Mena

texts.en: Yankey Elizabeth Mena A. is married and has four children. She has received senior high education.  Yankey operates a provision shop at Takoradi. She has been doing this for five years. Her husband is a driver. Yankey assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. The loan will help to increase her capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yankey plans to buy a land.

loans.use: The loan will help to increase her capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married woman with four children, all of whom had graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

She has been operating a food stall business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Zubeda faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators in the area. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal, beans, Irish potatoes and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, beans, potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia V. is from the village of Sumasap,Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old and married and with five adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns a retail store selling clothing and shoe products. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pay Quick Group

texts.en:
Mariama K. is the leader of this group, and for the past seven years, she has made a business out of creating traditional tie-dyed “gara” cloth. Mariama is 37 years old and has one child in primary school. Mariama will use the loan to purchase ink, caustic soda, and firewood for her business. 

This is the second loan that Mariama and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

(Also included on the right of the photo is loan officer Zainab Bangura handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: Purchase ink, caustic soda, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Marlene Jeanett

texts.es:
La joven Marlene  de 24 años  de edad tiene un niño, su esposo trabaja para una empresa de raices y tuberculos el cual  devenga un salario mensual ambos se ayudan con los gastos familiares y del  hogar ya que son bien unidos, ella labora como docente de primaria en la Colonia el Serrano desde hace 5 años, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, humilde y de buanas costumbres, es una persona esforzada que lucha para que brindar lo mejor a su familia. 
Solicita el apoyo de Kiva en su segundo credito para comprar materiales de construcciòn y asi poco a poco ir  acumulando el material para posterior  mejorar su vivienda,a que sus ingresos no le permiten ralizar este proyecto de un solo tiene que ir poco a poco.  
Su sueño es que que no le falte trabajo para el pan de cada dia y que su familia permanezca siempre unida.
texts.en:
Marlene is a young woman who is 24 years old and has a son.  Her husband works for a roots and tubers company that provides him with a monthly income.  They are a close family and help each other cover household expenses.  She has worked as a teacher at the primary school in Serrano Colony for five years.  She is a hard worker, modest and from a good background.  She strives to give her family the best she can.
