Warlita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Warlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean K. is an older woman and the married mother of four children, three of whom are married and live separately and the other one attends school.

Mean K. has been engaged in a business weaving fishnets for more than ten years. She saves many pieces of net before selling them. Most of her clients come to buy her finished nets directly at her house.

Mean K. is 53 years old and married to Em Phear who assists her in making nets. Mean K. requests a loan to purchase more raw materials to continue weaving nets.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for weaving nets

loans.name: Mary Nyaboke

texts.en:
Mary Nyaboke M. is 32 years old and has a home bakery business. She offers cakes, porridge and mandasi (a donut-like pastry). She sells to rural residents and casual laborers in her area. She has been in this business for seven years and struggles with not having a permanent spot to bake and sell her goods. She is using the proceeds from this loan to buy an oven and open a shop. She would ultimately like to open a general store offering fish from Tanzania and clothes from Uganda. 

Mary is married and her husband works at Akamba bus services. They have four children, ages 5 to 14 years old. Mary dreams of educating all her children to the university level and buying her own home.

loans.use: To purchase an oven and open a shop

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City. She is 36 years old. Ruth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from the buying and selling of herbal food supplements in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat M. is a villager who lives in Boeng Tranh village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Neang Khorn, is a garment factory worker who makes a small salary to support the family.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less money than needed to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Socheat M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and he hopes to improve their standard of living with this loan.

Mr. Socheat M. is a father with two children who are both enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 50 years old and married with seven children. She is a focused, hard worker. She is very determined to lift her business above poverty level. She sells bunches of plantain at retail prices to her customers.

She is a LAPO client. The Kiva field partner, LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. Roseline is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bunches of plantain to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantain to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca D. L. D. R. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Santiago Nonualco, departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella junto a su esposo poseen una venta D. productos lácteos en su propia casa, lo cual les generan buenas ganancias lo cual les permite solventar todos los gastos del hogar, a pesar D. esto, ellos desean poder construir un  garaje, lo cual no les es posible hasta la fecha, ya que las ganancias generadas no les ajusta para poder realizar este tipo D. trabajo en su casa. Es por esto que ellos solicitan un préstamo a través del cual puedan contar con el capital necesario para construirlo, esto con el fin D. tener más seguro el automóvil que posee, el cual lo utilizan para distribuir el queso con los diferentes clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca D. L. D. R. is 39 years old and lives in Santiago Nonualco, in the Department of La Paz. She lives with her husband and their two children, who are still young and attending school. Francisca and her husband operate a shop selling dairy products in their own home. The business generates a good income, allowing them to cover all of their household expenses. Nevertheless, they would like to build a garage, and this has not been possible until now, since the income from the business has not been sufficient to carry out this type of work in their home. For this reason, they are requesting a loan which will proviD. them with enough capital to construct the garage. Their aim is to proviD. better security for the car they own, which they use to distribute cheese to various customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a garage

location.town: Santiago Nonualco, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Máximo Primitivo

texts.es:
Máximo R. de 49 años, vive en la zona Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa trabaja con el con ella tiene 2 hijos uno de 17 años, y 10 años estudian en una escuela particular. 

Máximo empezó trabajando en un almacén de artículos varios años, con la liquidación que le dieron comenzó vendiendo arroz y verduras en su casa, poco a poco pudo poner una tienda. Ahora gracias a los buenos ingresos que a obtenido pudo poner unas cabinas telefónicas y artículos de bazar el trabaja todos de lunes a domingo vendiendo arroz, atún, aceites, servicio de telefonía etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zapatos, ropa, maquillajes para poder surtir mejor su negocio. En el futuro quiere poner sucursales y poder así comprarse un auto para su familia.
texts.en:
Máximo R., age 49, lives in the Paraíso de Guayaquil neighborhood. His wife works with him. The pair have 2 children, ages 17 and 10, who attend a private school. Máximo began working in a wholesale grocer's shop. With the discount they gave him he began selling rice and vegetables from home. Little by little, he was able to set up a store. Now, thanks to the good income he has earned, he was able to install telephone booths and stock general goods. He works everyday, Monday to Sunday, selling rice, tuna, oils, telephone services, etc. With this loan he wants to buy shoes, clothing, and make-up to better stock his business. In the future he wants to start other branches of his business and thus be able to buy a car for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes, clothing, rice

loans.name: Money Tree Group

texts.en: Marie C. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Money Tree Group. She is 36 years old and is married with two children, ages 3 and 4. Both of them are in the nursery educational level. Marie and her family live in Gbange Town, but work around the V.O.A. gas station community in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. She was never able to go to school herself due to lack of financial support from her parents. Marie’s business is the sale of food such as cassava, fufu, coconut and plantain. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail to residents of the V.O.A. community in Monrovia. She has been running this business for five years and hopes to become both an importer and exporter of goods in the near future. Marie started selling with 500.00 Liberian Dollars in working capital, but now operates with about 8500.00 Liberian Dollars. She sells good products and also has a good working relationship with her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Marie will use this loan as working capital to improve her business. She dreams of getting her children educated and getting a house of her own. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marie is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy cassava, fufu, coconut and plantain for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock his retail shop and pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Ekuah

texts.en: Ekuah F. sells foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, palm oil and others at Abura.  Ekuah has received no educational background.  She is a widow and has five dependants. Ekuah has been selling foodstuffs for some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita M. is from the village of Seti near Jimenez Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Rita provides mechanical services to local community members. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita is requesting her first GDMPC loan, for 3000 PHP, to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Mrs. Phy N. is 36 years old, and she is a villager in Dei Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from being a farmer, she is a pig breeder who can earn a small income to support her family. Although she tries to work hard with both her businesses, she still earns too little income to support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to breed. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living. Mrs. Phy N. is a widow with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the other two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mujeres Inteligentes 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Inteligentes (Intelligent Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the DR, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her mother and two children.

Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and excited at the opportunity to take loans at low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado or small general store by purchasing sugar, rice, cooking oil and sauces to stock her store. She will use the profits to provide for the basic daily needs of her children and her mother. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil and sauces

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
A sus 38 años, Eusebia continúa luchando por sacar a delante a su familia. Está casada con Andrés de 35 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos; todos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona turística de la selva peruana central.   

Lleva 17 años dedicada a la fabricación de artesanía; como bolsos, collares y pulseras a base de semillas de los diferentes frutos oriundos de su zona. Adicionalmente, junto a su esposo, prepara y vende bebidas de yerbas que son medicina natural. Su puesto de venta está ubicado en la comunidad nativa “Pampa Michi”, donde aún se conserva las costumbres y tradiciones de un pueblo nativo selvático.
Lo que más le gusta es viajar a otras ciudades llevando sus artesanías y medicinas que elabora, pero para disfrutar más de su familia, para más adelante quiere alquilar su stand para ella poder instalar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que cuida muy bien su historial crediticio para no perder la confianza que se ganó con la entidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará telas especiales para fabricar bolsas, además de yerbas, tallos y hojas para preparar sus medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
At 38 years old, Eusebia continues to fight to get her family ahead. She is married to Andrés, 35, with whom she has 3 children. They all live in their own home, located in the tourist area of the central Peruvian jungle. She has been working in artisanal craft production for 17 years. She makes things such as: bags, necklaces and bracelets made from the seeds of different plants from the area. With her husband, she also makes and sells herbal drinks that are natural medicine. Her stall is located in the native community "Pampa Michi", where the customs and traditions of the native rainforest people is still conserved. What she likes the most is travelling to other cities bringing the artisanal crafts and medicines that she makes. But in order to enjoy her family more, in the future she wants to rent a stand in order to start a food store in her house. This is the third loan that she has had with MFP and she makes sure to take care of her credit history so that she doesn't lose the trust that she has gained with the organization. With the money that she is asking for she will buy special fabrics to make bags with, as well as herbs, stalks and leaves to prepare her natural medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her artisanal crafts

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz, a resident of Lahore, famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods, is the wife of W. and the mother of two kids: one daughter and one son. Both are enrolled in school and are getting an education. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 20 years.

A very talented lady, Kaniz operates a quilt-selling business. She sells the quilts in her community and in the market. She purchases the quilts from different cities (Islamabad and Peshawar) in bulk. Her business increases in the winter season especially. She uses her income to pay off the utilities and to manage the education expenses of her kids.

Her husband is a mechanic by profession and runs his own motor workshop in the market. He is very talented and can repair every type of vehicle from motorbike to four-wheeled car. He started learning this skill at the age of 12. Earlier he worked for someone else but he started his own motor workshop four years ago.
 
Kaniz is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase repair tools and improve the quality of the workshop.

loans.use: To purchase repair tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase Brazilian clothing for the season

loans.name: Merceditha

texts.en:
Merceditha G., a married woman living in Sta. Catalina Municipality, Negros Oriental, earns her living by buying and selling dry goods and operating a photocopier business. Her husband, Edgardo G., 54, works as the owner of the photocopier business to earn for their family. They have six children ranging in age from 12 to 34 years old.

Merceditha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merceditha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a profit of PHP 200/ day, thereby uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to use for household expenses and to continue to save up for her children's future education. Merceditha G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Household expenses and children's education

loans.name: God Is There For Us. Group

texts.en:
Moses N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is There For Us. He is 60 years old, married, and has five children who range from 12 to 35 years old. He also cares for five siblings. He was able to attend school only through first grade due to poverty.
  
For three years, he has been selling red palm oil in Kollie-Wolla Town, Bong County, central Liberia. 

He plans to use his 7,000 LRD portion of this 35,000 LRD group loan to buy more red palm oil.

He describes himself as an earnest man. His dream is to expand his business and become an exporter of red palm oil.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is inset at lower right because she absent during loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more red palm oil.

loans.name: Basilia Cruz

texts.es:
Basilia Cruz C. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada, emprendedora y luchadora quien inicio hace dos años vendiendo chiverías y gaseosas actualmente tiene una pequeña pulpería donde comercializa granos básico, huevos, jabones, detergentes etc. 
Ella con el crédito piensa mejorar su negocio surtiéndolo con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Basilia Cruz C. is a hard-working, dedicated, entrepreneurial, and tenacious woman who started selling snacks and soft drinks two years ago. She currently has a small store where sells basic grains, eggs, soap, and detergent, etc. She plans to use the loan to improve her business by stocking it with a greater quantity and variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, snacks, and cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en: H. Nghiêm Thị (20201020049) is a 27 year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,600,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase feed and other supplies. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by her from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. H. Nghiêm Thị (20201020020) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Otgonbat

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbat is 30 years old and lives with wife and two kids in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent in Ulaanbaatar city. His son, Tengis, 7, attends a secondary school and his daughter, Temuulen, 2, goes to kindergarten. Otgonbat’s wife Narantuya works in local kindergarten number 87 as a teacher. Otgonbat has been running his taxi business for eight years and his profit is quite stable.

In 2005 they obtained a license for their piece of land on which they are living at the moment. Their plan is to build a house on their land. The reason they asking for this loan is that they want to buy some building materials and start the building project.

loans.use: To buy some building materials to start his building project

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora M. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Leonora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing pedicure and manicure services to local community members. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and livestock sales. She lives in Brgy. Dakit, Bogo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5000 PHP. Nenita is now borrowing 18000 PHP so that she can purchase raw materials for food vending. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nenita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and assure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new carpet-weaving frame

loans.name: Jessenia America

texts.es:
Jessenia es comerciante informal de ropa y electrodomésticos, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Empezó hace tres años atrás invirtiendo sus ahorros compro mercadería como electrodomésticos y comenzó a vender a sus amigos y conocidos. Trabaja solo desde muy temprano recorriendo las calles para vender la ropa y los electrodomésticos. Una de las dificultades es que no tiene un vehiculo disponible y tiene que recorrer lugares peligrosos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar electrodomésticos y sabanas para poder surtir mas sus ventas y que sus clientes tengan mas variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere tener mas rutas de ventas para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Jessenia is an informal seller of clothing and home electronics appliances.  She lives in the Guasmo of Guayaquil (a place characterized by residents that are mostly informal merchants).  

She started out three years ago, investing her savings and buying merchandise such as electronic appliances that she began selling to friends and acquaintances.  She works alone, from very early in the morning, to sell her clothing and appliances.  Some of the difficulties she faces are not having a vehicle available, and having to travel through dangerous areas.  

She wants to use the loan to buy appliances and bed sheets, in order to make more sales and so her customers have a greater variety to choose from.  In the future, she would like to have additional sales routes in order to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase electronic appliances and clothing.

loans.name: Procy

texts.en:
Procy C. is a widow who lives in Prk. Malipayon, Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a buy & sell livestock business. She has three children who are 16 to 20 years old. Procy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Procy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future family expenses & the education of her children.  Procy C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Helen is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods, and also vegetables like string beans, in the local community. She also deals in NATASHA personal products. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell.

loans.name: Karla Elisa

texts.es: Karla es una mujer muy alegre y a demás responsable ella tiene1 hijo y está a su cargo. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general dicha actividad la realiza de una manera permanente porque cuando comenzó a trabajar fue por razón que como madre comprometida y responsable decidió ayuda a los ingresos de la familia ya que tenía que sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que por las mañanas realizaba la lo quehaceres del hogar y por las tardes sale a vender sus diferentes productos. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para la compra de sabanas, toallas, perfumes y calzado. Su deseo es seguir esforzándose para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Karla is a very cheerful, responsible woman.  She has a son in her care.  For three years she has sold general merchandise.  This is now her permanent occupation because she started to work, like all committed mothers, to contribute to household income because she wanted to provide for her son.  During the mornings she could do the household chores and then in the afternoon she could sell her various products.

She is asking for this current loan to buy sheets, towels, perfumes and footwear.  Her wish is to continue to strengthen so that her children will not lack their daily food.

loans.use: To buy sheets, towels, perfume and footwear.

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 47 ans, vendeuse de friperie depuis plus de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 14 et 24 ans. A l'arrêt de ses études ,Elle se lance dans la vente des serviettes,draps, peignoirs non utilises.
A l'octroi de son premier prêt, elle renforce son activité en achetant des ballots de draps, serviettes, peignoirs non portes, dans les grands magasins de la place.Ses recettes ont augmentes de 25.000frs a 125.000 fr par jour, elle a rembourse avec succès et a fait des bénéfices  considérables. 
 Avec le second prêt , elle tient a renforcer et élargir son activité en refaisant les mêmes achats, acheter des ballots de serviettes, séries de draps non utilises, des peignoirs non utilises pour satisfaire sa clientèle.
Tres dynamique , elle tient très ferme dans ses ambitions , elle pense pour ce deuxième prêt, épargner plus qu'avant, faire des grandes bénéfices pour pouvoir atteindre ses objectifs, devenir une grossiste et ouvrir une boutique  de habits de second main .Avec fierté , elle contribue a l'épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
This lady is a merchant. She is 47 years old and has been selling second hand clothing for over thirty years. She is married and the mother of four children whose ages range from 14 to 24. After her studies, she started selling unused towels, bed sheets and robes.

She used her first loan to strengthen her activity by buying bundles of unused sheets, towels and robes from the large stores of the area. Her revenue increased from 25,000 to 125,000 francs per day. She fully repaid the loan and earned substantial profits.

With the second loan, she wants to strengthen and expand her activity with similar purchases. She will buy bundles of unused towels, sheets and robes to meet customer demand.

A very dynamic person, she is highly focused on her objectives. She hopes that this second loan will help boost her savings and increase her profits so that she can achieve her goal of becoming a wholesaler and opening a second hand clothing store. She is proud to be able to provide for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: Purchase bundles of unused towels, robes, and bed sheets

loans.name: María Paulina

texts.es:
María Paulina tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito D. Cayaltí, una zona agrícola D. regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. tres años a la venta D. productos D. belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo D. clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos D. parte D. la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo María se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

María desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo D. cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin D. mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
María Paulina is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayaltí, an agricultural zone with a lot of commercial activity. They live an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than three years she has worked selling beauty products and cosmetics through a catalog. She depends on a group of customers who frequently buy her products. The more orders she fills, the more business points she earns from the beauty company and this leads to higher earnings. For this reason, María always works to get more customers.

María desires to have a stable capital to buy more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics so that her customers can quickly purchase what they need and not have to wait until the end of the month when she delivers their orders. This is why she has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles that will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To stock more cosmetics so that her customers can quickly buy what they need.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. is married and has three children. Adwoa sells cassava, palm fruits and green garden eggs (tiny eggs normally used when preparing palm nut soup) in Takoradi. Her husband is a carpenter. Her sales are used to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Adwoa will use this loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide a meaningful education to her children.

On the table, at Adwoa's left-hand side, are some cassavas and the green tiny garden eggs. Behind her on the table is a bowl of palm fruit.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Gloria Amelia

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 48 años y tiene nueve hijos. Gloria se dedica a la venta de café, cacao y miel, ella trae sus productos de la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Gloria requiere el préstamo para comprar miel. Gloria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).
texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and has nine children. She sells coffee, cacao, and honey that are brought in from the city of Quillabamba in the Department of Cusco. Gloria has been in this business for 15 years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to buy honey. Gloria is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

Gloria belongs to the Communal Bank “Inti” which is part of Asociación Araiwa in Cusco, Peru. (“Inti” is a Quechua word that means “Sun”.)

loans.use: Purchase honey to sell

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina B. is 48 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. She lives in the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. Ursulina is an artist; she owns and operates a business doing painting. She also prints t-shirts. Ursulina has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns a monthly net income of 2,800 PHP from it.

In 2010, Ursulina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ursulina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Ursulina is requesting her 3rd loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase art materials.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase art materials

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is a 20-year-old young lady who lives with her mother and sister in a ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her mother is 53 years old, and her sister is 18 years old and attends the local high school. She has two older brothers who live with their own families. 

Her mother has been operating a clothing retail stall for almost 10 years at the local outdoor market called Khar Khorin. She started her business with working capital of 500,000 MNT. Her business has since expanded and now her working capital is 5,000,000 MNT. She sells clothes imported from Ereen, a border city of China. Today, mom and daughter operate their business at two stalls, one run by Erdenetsetseg and the other by her mother. Her mother managed to buy gers and material goods for her brothers with the profits she made as both of them were getting married.

Erdenetsetseg is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more clothes before March 8th, International Women’s Day, plus for spring as well. She is an accomplished young lady who wants to help and support her mother by running this store successfully.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Lujan” ubicado en el distrito D. Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 50 años D. edad.  Está casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos independientes.  La señora estudio solo hasta 3º D. educación primaria. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 8 años, su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio venta D. abarrotes.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará productos como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, leche, aceites, conservas y otros.  En esta actividad la ayuda su hija; su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.	
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana su ahorro.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the community bank "Virgen D. Lujan" [Virgin of Lujan], located in the Tinicachi district in the province of Yunguyo and department of Puno.  She is 50 years old, married, and has five grown children.  She went to school only until the third year of primary school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used it to invest in her grocery store.  

With this loan for 3000 nuevos soles, she will purchase products like sugar, rice, pasta, milk, oils, canned goods, and more.  Her daughter helps her with her business and her husband is a teacher.

Her dream is to improve her business and have a larger income.  

She likes the community bank because it makes it easy to get a loan and she earns money on her savings.

loans.use: to purchase products like sugar, rice, pasta, milk, oils, canned food, and more.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 39 years old and married with three children ages 2, 5, and 9. Her spouse is a bursar, and they have no other dependents. Her family of five lives in their own home, which is in Hoima, Uganda, and her family goal is to educate her children up to university. She saved her salary and bought her first motorcycle, and her desire is to own five of them, although she still has challenges with motorcycle riders who fail to remit their weekly earnings on time. Harriet needs the money to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.es:
María  tiene 39 años  de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive con su cónyuge y sus 03 hijos en una casa propia, la cual está ubicada en San Luis, el cual es un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, en la provincia de Chiclayo. Sus actividades principales en dicho caserío son lla agricultura ,  crianza de animales de engorde y actividades artesanales.

La actividad que realiza es la crianza y venta de patos, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia. Cliente cría los patos en su corral, además cría pollos, pavos entre otros animales. Su cónyuge trabaja en la venta de helados. Ambos con los ingresos que perciben aportan a la economía familiar.

María necesita comprar calaminas para arreglar sus corrales, y tener más seguro a sus animales. .  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María, 39, lives with her spouse and three children in her own house located in San Luis which is a small, rural hamlet belonging to La Victoria District in Chiclayo Province.  Its main activities are farming, raising livestock and handicrafts.

Her activity is raising ducks for sale; she has 10 years experience.  She raises the ducks in a corral and also raises chickens and turkeys, among other animals.  Her spouse works as an ice-cream vendor.  With their two incomes they support their family.

María needs to buy sheets of plywood to repair the corrals and provide more security for the animals.  Because of this she’s deemed it convenient to obtain a 500 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy sheets of plywood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one sibling. He has been working as a part-time salesman in a library since 2008. In parallel, this young man is pursuing his education at the university. He is studying computer programming and accounting and he is about to finish his third year. This young man knows how to manage his time between his job and his education. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university education fees. In the future, he is planning to start his career in a computer company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income. In the long term, he is planning to open a computer shop in his town.

loans.use: to pay his university education fees.

loans.name: Juan Edilberto

texts.es:
Juan, vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él tiene un taller de sistemas de escapes y radiadores, desde hace 11 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de escapes y radiadores, empaques, aditivos y productos relacionados con el sistema de escape, este préstamo le ayudara a ofrecer a los clientes una variedad de productos.
Su aspiración es ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios, al mismo tiempo invertir en el negocio para que este crezca.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and four children.  He has had an exhaust and radiator repair shop for 11 years.

He is asking for a loan to buy tail pipes, radiators, seals, additives and other products related to the exhaust system.  This loan will help him offer variety of products to his customers.

His goal is to help his children with their schooling while still investing in his business so that it will grow.

loans.use: to buy tail pipes, radiators, seals and additives.

loans.name: Anathalia

texts.en:
Anathalia is a 47-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who runs a hardware store with her husband.  The store sells many goods such as hoes, construction materials, paint, and tents and has been operating successfully since 2004. Anathalia and her husband have five children ranging in age from 9 to 22 years old.

With the loan, she plans to buy more tents and paint so that she can continue to meet the demands of her customers. With the extra money generated thus far from this business, Anathalia has been able to buy a house and car and support her children through school. This loan will help her continue to be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy tents and paint for sale.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Mrs. Duk is a 42-year-old widow who work from home making baskets out of bamboo. Occasionally, she also buys baskets from other weavers in order to resell them to people in her community. She has two children, both of whom attend school and help her make bamboo baskets. In order to increase her income, Mrs. Duk has applied for a loan to buy more baskets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia  is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children.  Lucia  has a shop that sells snacks, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads to resell. Lucia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Lucia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Johny Alexander

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de estabilizarse económicamente y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia conformada por su esposa y sus 2 hijos, desde hace tres años Johny Alexander decidió crear su propio negocio, comenzó vendiendo helados en un espacio que adecuó en la casa de su padre, y poco a poco a logrado comprar mas variedad de productos, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante su negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo brindado por su esposa, esperan ir progresando día a día para finalmente tener una estabilidad económica con la cual darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

A sus 33 años de edad, el sueño de este emprendedor es llegar a tener su propio local en el que pueda ubicar su negocio, Johny trabaja diariamente de 8:00 a.m. a 9:30 p.m. con la motivación de tener un mejor futuro. 

Por ahora y para caminar hacia la materialización de su sueño, Johny necesita de un préstamo para comprar gran cantidad de surtido que le permita generar más utilidades y así mejorar la apariencia del negocio frente a la competencia.
texts.en:
Three years ago, in the hope of stabilizing his financial situation and improving his family's quality of life (his family consists of his wife and two children), Johny Alexander decided to set up his own business.  He started out selling frozen treats in a space that he created in his father's home.  He gradually managed to buy a wider range of products.  He has been able to get ahead in his business thanks to his efforts and the support provided by his wife.  The couple hope to make progress every day so that they can eventually achieve financial stability.  This will enable them to provide their children with a better quality of life.

At 33 years old, this entrepreneur's dream is to own his own premises in which he can locate his business.  Johny works every day, from 8.00am to 9.30pm, with the goal of enjoying a better future.

Right now, and with the goal of achieving his dream, Johny needs a loan to buy a large quantity of stock which will allow him to make more profits and thereby improve the appearance of his business with respect to the competition.

loans.use: to stock his business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has two children, ages two and five. For the past three years, she has run a tailoring shop in a residential area where she sells her services wholesale and to individuals. Asha describes herself as open-minded.

Asha is requesting a loan to expand and open another tailoring shop. This will be Asha’s first loan with SMEP. She plans to use the profits from her loan to keep expanding her business by purchasing clothing material to sell.

loans.use: to open another tailoring shop

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, vive con sus cuatro hijos D. 18, 17, 15 y 13 años D. edad, todos dependen D. ella, su oficio es la crianza D. cerdos, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia hace 5 años, compra los cerdos pequeños y los comercializa cuando están gordos, D. esta manera ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante, D. una forma humilD. y con escasos recursos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. concentrado, este le servirá para mantener la suficiente alimentación para los cerdos, engordándolos para poder venderlos a un mejor precio.
El propósito D. María es tener una fuente D. ingresos, que le ayuD. a solventar todo lo necesario en el hogar, manteniendo para sus hijos la alimentación diaria.
texts.en:
María, who has four dependent children ages 13, 15, 17, and 18, raises pigs. She began this business on her own five years ago. She buys young pigs and then sells them after she has fattened them. This business has allowed her to proviD. for her children albeit in a humble manner. 

She is currently seeking a loan to purchase pig feed concentrate, which will help her fatten the pigs so that she can sell them at a higher price.

Maria's goal is to have a steady source of income, so that she can proviD. for her household and fulfill her children's daily nuitritional needs.

loans.use: Purchase of pig feed concentrate

loans.name: Maisa'a

texts.en:
Maisa'a is from Al Hashmi, Jordan. She is a 46-year-old woman and a mother of three children.

Maisa'a is making pastries from home, and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase raw materials and to start training courses for the neighbor women related to baking and doing pastries.

Maisa'a aspires to open a shop for her products and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and make training courses.

loans.name: Mohamed Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present teachers of a primary school in Allen Town, an outskirt of Freetown. This group of teachers has come to SMT to request a loan of 4,400,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repays on their behalf. 

Mohamed is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Kambia district, in northern Sierra Leone, Mohamed is 33 years old, married, and has one child. Mohamed has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with 10 children. She is 59 years old and lives in the province of Isabela. For the past 10 years, she has been raising pigs to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase more pigs.

Viloeta is well-known in their community as a responsible and very patient mother.

In the future, she hopes to increase her earnings from pig raising so that her total net income is 50,000 PHP.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva integrante del Banco comunal “Los Jardines” perteneciente a la comuna de Peñalolén.
Se dedica al rubro de los servicios y comercio, ya que atiende un ciber, bazar y paquetería, desde hace tres años.
Comenta que en su local cuenta con 8 computadores, carga de celulares, tarjetas para el transporte vehicular (Transantiago), por lo que también entrega diferentes servicios. Su local está ubicado en el ante jardín de la casa de su suegra.    
Sus productos los compra directamente en las distribuidoras y a los proveedores, ya que necesita insumos como CD, para fotos y música. 
Con el crédito comprará una maquina fotocopiadora, ya que tenía una en mal estado.
Sus metas son ampliar su local o arrendar uno más grande, para acrecentarlo con mas computadores, espera contar con 15 PC. 
Eva vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad. Sus sueños en el ámbito personal son recorrer el país en un viaje.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha dado la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio y crecer como persona.
El grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece, es unido, solidario y responsable. Respecto a las capacitaciones, ha aprendido de contabilidad para administrar mejor su negocio. 
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the “Los Jardines” (The Gardens) communal bank belonging to Peñalolén commune.  She provides services and is a merchant.  She runs an Internet café, variety store and packaging service; she’s been in business for three years.

She comments that in her location she has 8 computers, she sells cell phone recharge time, vehicle transportation cards (Transantiago) and she also provides other services.  Her store is located in the front yard of her mother-in-law’s house.

She buys her products directly from distributors and suppliers since she needs supplies like CDs for photos and for music.

She will use the loan to buy a photocopier since the one she had was in pretty bad shape.  Her goals are to expand her locale or rent a bigger one to add more computers; she hopes to have 15 PCs.

She lives with her husband and two children who are 11 and 7 years old.  Her dream on a personal level is to take a trip around her country.

She is very happy with and grateful for the services provided by Fondo Esperanza because it’s provided her with the opportunity to invest in her business and to grow as a person.

The group of the communal bank she’s a member of is very united, mutually supportive and responsible.  With respect to the training, she’s learned bookkeeping to better manage her business.

Peñalolén is located to the east of the metropolitan region.  It has several attractions like vineyards, buildings considered to be national relics and natural exploration areas, elements that are turning this commune into a new tourism destination within the metropolitan region.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 45 years old and married with three children.

Mercedita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (local convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Mercedita has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling of rice grains & corn.

Mercedita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Khenh

texts.en:
Khenh is 48 years old and married with four children. Khenh and her husband run a general store, as they have for the last five years. 

Khenh plans to use the loan to stock her store with a greater range and quantity of products (in particular food and basic household goods) in preparation for the increased demand that occurs at the end of the year.

Khenh hopes that through this loan her income will increase and help her to improve her family's living conditions and send all her children to school.

loans.use: to stock her general store with a greater range and quantity of products.

loans.name: Zurelly  Antonia

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Zurelly compró un lavacabezas y tambien productos para surtir su negocio. Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha y espera hacer una nueva inversión en insumos para su salon de belleza infantil, porque vienen las fiestas decembrinas y su volumen de ventas aumentará y debe estar preparada; en la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo credikiva y con el comprará insumsos como gel, laca, tintes, adornos para peinados en mayor volumen, asi ganará descuentos y tendra en existencia todo lo necesario para responder con calidad a sus clientes infantes y a sus madres que desean verlo elegantes para las fiestas que se avecinan.
texts.en: Zuelly used her previous Kiva loan to buy a hair washing sink and also products to stock her salon.  She is very satisfied and hopes to make a new investment in her children’s beauty salon because the December festivities are approaching and her volume of sales will increase and she must be prepared.  She is applying for her second Kiva loan to buy supplies like gel, lacquer, coloring and hair decorations in larger amounts so that she’ll qualify for discounts and to have on hand everything she needs to respond to the demand of her children customers and their mothers who want to see them elegant for the approaching festivities.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies in larger amounts.

loans.name: Tohid

texts.en: Tohid is a 22 year-old vendor who sell food products in a small shop. He is married and has one child. He has three years of experience in this field. He sells rice, sugar, pickles, beverages and candies. His monthly income is 300 AZN. He is a good client of Kiva partner AqroInvest and has already completed two loans. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase more merchandise to increase his income. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more food to increase his profit.

loans.name: Clemenia

texts.en:
Clemenia is 49 years old, married, and has 4 children. Clemenia is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Clemenia operates a business venture selling a variety of fruit and vegetable in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and she earns 8,600 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Clemenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 42 years old and has three children, all of whom attend school. Valentina's family members are happy despite poverty. To generate an income, Valentina and her spouse grow rice. After working for five years in this business, they now earn at least 20,000 PHP each harvest season. 

Valentina is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to be used for farming. Profits earned from the last crop were used for tuition fees and electric bills, so this planting season she now lacks the necessary funds to maintain her rice field. Valentina also prays that no calamities such as a typhoon will come to their area. This would highly affect her ability to produce crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to be used for farming.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura, 40, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also owns rental houses, which provide her with another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her rental houses to accommodate more tenants in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cement and colored paint to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and colored paint to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 31-years-old. She is married to Stephen. They are blessed with one child but still assist her siblings. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with the monthly income of Kes 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first  loan  with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Dorcas will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to add to her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her siblings. Her hopes and dreams are to open a whole sale shop which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to add to her shop.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha madre soltera trabajadora, emprendedora e inteligente anteriormente invirtió el préstamo en su venta ambulante. Tiene planes de construir su casa. Se le ha presentado dificultades en la realización de las mejoras ya que los costos de materiales y mano de obra son altos. 
 Analizando que con el apoyo de la financiera y con los ingresos del negocio y su trabajo podría ir mejorándola poco a poco para obtener una vivienda sencilla. Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, piedras cantera, piedrín, arena, hierro, perlines, golosa, laminas de zinc entre otros materiales para la construcción de una pared y cambio del techo de una parte de la casa. 
Agradece a la financiera ya que mediante ella lograra ofrecerle a su familia protección y seguridad.
texts.en:
Martha, a hard-working, enterprising and intelligent single mother, invested her previous loan in her business. She plans to build her home. She has encountered difficulties making improvements because the cost of materials and labour is high.
She has figured out that the support of this financial institution, along with her income from her business, will allow her to make improvements bit by bit in order to have a simple home. With this new loan cycle she will buy construction materials such as: cement, blocks, stone, gravel, sand, iron, purlines, dividers, zinc laminate, and other materials for building a wall and changing the roof for part of her home.
She thanks the financial institution, because through this  loan she will be able to offer her family protection and security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Alodo Alome Group

texts.fr: ALODO ALOME est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Parfaite (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 30 ans. Parfaite n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Parfaite Claudine est mariée à un conducteur du nom de David. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Parfaite et son mari. Pour cette raison, Parfaite vend des plastiques, des bassines et des habits de façon ambulante, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Parfaite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Parfaite sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ALODO ALOME, un troisème crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des habits et des chaussures.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Ana Belen

texts.en:
Ana Belen started her office supply store two years ago and the business has done well, she has plans in increase the variety of products so that she can offer better service to her clients, satisfy their needs, and increase their number. For this she is requesting a loan of $1500.00 to purchase merchandise, she plans to repay her loan in one year.

(translated from Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ana Belen inicio su negocio de papeleria hace 2 años y el negocio ha marchado bien, ella tine planes de incrementar la variedad de productos para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, satisfacer sus requerimientos y poder incrementar el numero de ellos, por lo cual solicita un credito de $1500.00 para la compra de mercancía, ella piensa liquidar su credito en un año.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en: Chinh is 35. Her husband, Khoi, is 32. They have a one year-old daughter. Chinh’s family has 3,000 square meters where they have just begun growing cajupU. trees. It will take three years for the trees to mature and be ready for sale.  In the meantime, Chinh’s husband is a labourer in his village. Chinh has a small grocery store at the gate of Luong Tam primary school where she sells food and school supplies for students. Their total income is $13 per person/month. Chinh needs a loan of $75 so that she will be able to continue selling school supplies for primary students. Chinh will repay monthly.

loans.use: To buy and sell various goods for primary school students.

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
M. Begum of 30 years old (ID-579 – M), wife of M. K. Ahmed 35 years of age, is a member of Chetona Mohila Somity. She has a daughters – one 8 and another 1 year old. Her husband’s income is very low so she is passing her days in a hardship situation. She realizes that she must be a earning source for the family and be self-sufficient. She got a 7-day training on Poultry. She purchases 400 one-day old chicks @ Tk. Tk. 30 each. For one month she spents Tk. 10,000 for their food. After one month she sells them @ Tk. 85/ per kg. So her investment is Tk. 22,000 (400 x Tk. 30 = Tk. 12,000) + food cost Tk. 10,000) and she earns Tk. 34,000 (400 x Tk. 85/). So her profit is Tk. 34,000 – Tk. 22,000) = Tk. 12,000. If the growth is more than one kg. each,  she gets more amount of profit.  Of course, she has not calculated her own labor cost.

The firm is in her own land she does not have to pay any rent. She is earning good profit and she is interested to extend her farm. She wants to purchase more layers. She requires US$ 900.

loans.use: Purchase of layers and boilers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his grocery business

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
I am 39 years old and the mother of six children - five sons and one daughter. To earn a living, I knit sweaters and socks and then stitch them on my sewing machine. My husband takes these sweaters and socks to the market and sells them to various shops at a good profit.

We both have managed some how to enroll our three elder kids to school. But now I fear we will not be able to send all of our children to school. This is due to the already difficult circumstance we are in to meet our expenses and now we feel the need for additional income.

I am requesting $300 USD as a loan to invest in my knitting business so that I can produce a greater number of sweaters and socks to increase my profits.

loans.use: To expand her arts weaving business

loans.name: Arelis

texts.en:
Arelis is an optimistic and assiduous woman who is doing her best for the sake of her family.  She is a living example of a persistent and successful businesswoman for the other women of her community.  She is unable to speak, but doesn’t let that disability prevent her from fulfilling her dreams. She has three children that go to the public school of the zone.  Her husband works as a blacksmith.
For more than five years, Arelis has been selling clothes for women.  She started the business with credits she got from FSMA.  She sells the clothes in her house and has a lot of customers.  When she really has difficulties being understood by the clients, she uses a little blackboard and a piece of chalk to convince people to buy her products.  That strategy has had goods results.
Now the entrepreneur wants to augment profits from her business.  She is requesting funds to buy more women’s clothes and introduce men’s clothes in the business in an attempt to satisfy her customers' needs and have new clients.  With the loan, she will keep on teaching people that anyone can succeed in life if she works hard.

loans.use: The entrepreneur, who is unable to speak, will use the funds to buy more women's clothes and introduce men's clothes in the business.

loans.name: Enjun

texts.en: Enjun is 47-year-old woman who has a small food stall which sells snacks, candies, fruit, flavoured ice sticks, etc., and  usually earns US$5.50 per day. Her husband, N., has no fixed income. Enjun requests a loan to expand her business. She is a member and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Its strategic location combined with the friendliness with which she tends her customers are the greatest strengths of Olinda's little grocery store. She is a young mother, just 24 years old, who decided last year to open her business with the unconditional support of her husband, José, who works in an auto mechanic's shop. She began offering a little merchandise, but as her earnings increased, she was able to expand, and currently this little shop is becoming one of the most shopped at stores. She is very proud to have achieved this in so short a time. This business is becoming the main income source of the family, and her dream is to expand it even more so that she can offer well being, security and comfort to her two small daughters and her hard-working husband. Olinda is waiting for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El lugar estratégico en el que está ubicado sumado a la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, son las principales fortalezas con las que cuenta la bodeguita de Olinda madre joven de 24 años de edad, que decidió abrir este negocio hace un año con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo, José, quien trabaja en un taller de mecánica automotriz. Inició ofreciendo poca mercadería, pero conforme iba obteniendo ganancias poco a poco la implementó, actualmente ésta bodeguita está convirtiéndose en una de las más concurridas, sintiéndose muy orgullosa por lo que esta logrando en corto tiempo. Este negocio está convirtiéndose en el ingreso económico principal de su familia y su deseo ti es implementarlo mucho más para ofrecerles bienestar, seguridad y comodidad a sus dos pequeñas niñas y a su laborioso esposo. Olinda espera tu ayuda.

loans.use:
Inyección de capital para la implementación de su pequeña bodega.
Cash for the expansion of her small grocery store.

loans.name: Nakhayat

texts.en: Nakhayat is 29 years old. She is a local resident of Saatli town. She is single and lives with her people. She breeds cattle with her brother (he is shown in the picture). They have been engaged in this business for 13 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other dairy products. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $700.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede T. buys fish on the docks of Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast) and sells them to local villagers. She is married and has four children. She is requesting a loan of $525.00 to have enough capital to buy fish in bulk. Fishmongers often have to use credit to buy fish, which really hurts their profits.

Dede is also the leader of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders” that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 25 years old and is single with 1 child, age 10. Rosemary is a soap seller; she started her business in 2001. Every day she works from 7:30 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soap for her business.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Victoria, Maria and Gregoria are partners at the Banco Comunal Seccelambras. The are from the community with the same name which is 2 hours away from the city of Ayacucho.

Victoria is a widow. She is 48 years old and has 5 children. She sells food at the community's street market twice a week. She is also involved is agriculture.

Maria, on the other hand, is 28 years old, married and has 4 children. Maria runs a convenience store from her home and she also sells food daily.

Gregoria lives with a companion and is 28 years old. She has 2 children. Gregoria sells food at the community's street market.

Victoria, Maria and Gregoria need loans in the amounts of 600 soles, 900 soles and 1000 soles, respectively. This money will be used to purchase beef, pigs, rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and vegetables.

Victoria's, Maria's and Gregoria's dreams are improvements to their business, to build capital and help their children become professionals.
