Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Victoria, Maria y Gregoria son socias del Banco Comunal Seccelambras, ellas son D. la comunidad que lleva el misma el mismo nombre, que se ubica a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Victoria es viuda tiene, 48 años y 5 hijos, Victoria venD. comida en la feria D. su comunidad, actividad que realiza una vez por semana. Además Victoria se dedica a la agricultura.

Por otro lado Maria es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, además venD. comida diariamente.

Mientras que Gregoria es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Gregoria venD. comida en la feria D. su comunidad.

Victoria, Maria y Gregoria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. carne, cerdo, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y verduras.

Los sueños D. Victoria, Maria y Gregoria son mejorar sus negocios, tener capital propio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Victoria, Maria and Gregoria need loans in the amounts of 600 soles, 900 soles and 1000 soles, respectively. This money will be used to purchase beef, pigs, rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and vegetables.

loans.name: Kwamina

texts.en: Kwamina A. sells shoes, ladies wear, and sandals. He is married, but his wife's income from selling goods is not sufficient for Kwamina and his two children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business selling shoes, ladies wear, and sandals.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the Sonrisa Village Bank.

Genveva is a 48-year-old mother of three children. Genoveva has a restaurant on “January 26” Avenue in a rented location with three employees. Additionally, she runs a boarding house where she sells Creole buffets on the weekends. Genoveva also has stands in the local market.

Genoveva needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($375 USD) to invest in rice, sugar, oil and noodles.

Genoveva´s dream is to expand her business, have a business with display cases and obtain her own land.

loans.use: Genoveva needs a loan to invest in rice, sugar, oil and noodles.

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en: Hilal is 35 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. He lives with his family in the South of Lebanon, close to Tyre. Hilal is a carpenter. He is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase new carpentry tools and hence to expand his business. Hilal has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years and has always repaid his debts on time.

loans.use: Purchase new carpentry tools

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Дододжонов Абдусамад житель района Курган-Тюбе .Возраст 41 год, женат, имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Клиент имеет на месном рынке небольшую торговую точку,на которой торгует зеленью и овощами. В данный момент клиент хочет расширить свой бизнес.Абдусамад хочет реализовать крышки и банки для консервирования.Теперь клиенты будут покупать не только  овощи и зелень,а так же все необходимое для консервирования. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Abdusamad D. is a resident of Kurgan-Tube. He is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has secondary education. He owns a space in a food market that he uses to sell veggies. At this point in time, he would like to expand his business by purchasing additional supplies for preservation of fruits and vegetables. Then, his customers will be able to purchase not only vegetables, but also other supplies. He plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jars and lids for food preservation

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura, gracias a los toros que posee  para el arado de sus terrenos, su trabajo se hace mas liviano, por eso cuida y pastea a estos animales con mucho cariño, con el fin de no perderlos.  Todas las mañanas se dirige con sus toros a sus terrenos de cultivo para abonarlos, fertilizarlos y fumigarlos, con la finalidad de que en la cosecha pueda obtener mejores productos que sean rentables en los diversos mercados de la ciudad.  Las dificultades de Mariluz es por la compra de  los  abonos y los diversos  materiales a utilizar en el cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, además de movilizar su carga a los diversos mercados para su venta, por ello solicita un préstamo que usará en la solución de estos inconvenientes.
texts.en:
For many years Mariluz has been an agriculturalist, and her work has been made lighter thanks to the bulls she has to plow her land, and this is why she looks after her animals and puts them to pasture with a lot of love, so that she won't lose them. Each morning she goes with her bulls to the fields to fertilize and fumigate them so that her harvest will achieve better produce that is more profitable in the various markets in the city. Mariluz' difficulties are in buying the fertilizers and different materials used in looking after her agricultural land as well as taking her produce to the different markets to sell, and this is why she would like a loan that she will use to solve these inconveniences.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her produce and pay for the journey to take her products to the markets to sell/Compra de abonos y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, además de pagar el traslado de sus productos a los mercados para su comercialización.

loans.name: Mussarat Taj Din Butt Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji is the wife of T. D. B. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. She is the mother of eight children: six sons and two daughters. Her oldest three sons work in a factory while the remaining children are still enrolled in a neighborhood school. Mussarat baji’s husband is a daily wage laborer. For the past 10 years, Mussarat baji has been selling milk.

Mussarat baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more milk for resale. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bilquis baji is requesting a loan to buy medicines and equipment for her midwife business. Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to buy items (chairs and tables) for her school. Suraiya baji is requesting a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Razia baji is requesting a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in theirown business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Sadiqa

texts.en:
Sadiqa who is very talented and a hard worker. She works in a beauty parlor and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Before this she worked in Pakistan, but after the collapse of the Taliban, she came back and started working in Kabul. This talented woman said, "When I found out about this loan process, I was really happy and I completed all the documents and want to take a loan."

Now she has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans in the term of 18 months to complete some of necessary materials to further her working and have more success and help her family better.

Sadiqa wants to say, "I am very happy to see this process grow in Afghanistan because every worker can use it and can further their business using this loan process. She wants to thank all the lenders who support this process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete some of necessary materials

loans.name: Yobana

texts.en:
Yobana is a member of the Bonanza Village Bank. Yobana is 26 years old and lives with her partner; they do not yet have any children. Yobana runs a tavern, which is located in a rented space on a central street in the city of Ayacucho. She works seven days a week, with the help of one employee.

Yobana and her partner also have a store where they sell computers and offer computer repair services. Yobana needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she will use to buy beer. Yobana’s dreams are to have her own clothing store and to expand her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Yobana es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza. Yobana es conviviente, tiene 26 años y aun no tiene hijos, Yobana tiene una taberna en un local alquilado ubicado en una calle céntrica, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 1 personal.

Además Yobana junto a su pareja tienen una tienda de venta de computadoras y mantenimiento. Yovana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza. Los sueños de Yovana son tener una tienda de venta de ropas y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Buy beer for re-sale

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.en:
Fathullo runs a computer center where he offers various services. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. At his center, customers can print out, type, fax, copy and scan documents, among many many other things. As his work is of very high quality, he has a lot of clients. Unfortunately in wintertime they have limited access to electricity so he can work only for 1-3 hours per day. That’s why he decided to buy a generator so he can have electricity all day long.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have a solid business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. is 40 years old and married with four children. Esther sells foodstuffs like fish, garri, rice, and plantain. She hopes to expand this business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old. He is single and lives in Khudat town. This man has been in the auto-repair business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy spare parts and things necessary for repairing cars.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Bakhtiryar

texts.en:
Bakhtiryar Q. is 36 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of goods such as shampoos, detergents, and other items in his grocery store. Bakhtiryar is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Bakhtiryar has run this business for more than 15 years. With savings, he could grow and expand his business. Currently Bakhtiryar is requesting a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to increase his stock

loans.name: Loik

texts.ru: Разоков Лоик житель района Шахринау.Возрат 36 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает слесарем на станции технического обслуживания. Работает уже пять лет. Его еятельность единственный источник дохода его семьи. Работает очень много. кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы купить инструменты и запчасти для автомобилей.
texts.en:
Loik R. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 36 years old, married and has two children. He works as a technician at an auto service station. He has been in this business for five years. His business is the only source of income for his family. Loik works a lot. He plans to obtain this loan in order to purchase tools and auto parts. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts and tools

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Confiance sont toutes des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur huitième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de cartes de crédit pour téléphones,  de gingembre (pour la fabrication  de boissons locales non alcoolisées), de  condiments alimentaires et des brochettes de viande grillées.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter  25 cartes de crédit pour téléphones, 1 sac de sucre, 2 sacs de 100kg de gingembre, 3 colis de condiments alimentaires, 10 litres d’huile alimentaire, 5kg de viande , 5 sacs de charbon de bois.
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Confiance ambitionnent d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Confiance are all married women who average 37 years of age and 4 children each. They live mainly in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a district in Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their 8th solidarity loan. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid. The group members do a diversity of work, including selling mobile phone cards, ginger (for making local soft drinks), condiments, and grilled meat kebobs.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 25 mobile phone cards, one sack of sugar, two 100-kg sacks of ginger, three packages of condiments, ten liters of cooking oil, five kilos of meat, and five sacks of charcoal. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold, in mostly cash transaction, to customers composed of men and women at different marketplaces in the city and in the area.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 12,500 franc CFA. A portion of the profits will put into savings, and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to increase their turnover, so as to satisfy their customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is a tomato seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Mapatano group loan (Group code 2070). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mwanahamis is 36 years old, married, and has a 16-year-old child. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo
Candelaria es casada tiene 51 años, cinco hijos de 28, 24,22,14 y 11 años que esta  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Candelaria trabajaba llevando desayuno al municipio a los trabajadores, pero le empezaron a deber y dejo el negocio, se puso a vender en su casa tamales y ha repartir casa por casa. Y los fines de semana prepara comida para vender. 
Desde que Candelaria esta en Finca aprendió como trabajar mejor en su negocio.
Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de maíz, azúcar, aceite para preparar tamales.
El sueño de Candelaria es abrir un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member the communal bank San Judas Tadeo. Candelaria is married and she is 51 years old. She has five children ages 28, 24, 22 14 and 11 years old. The 11-year-old and 14-year-old children are students at a public school. Candelaria used to make a living by selling breakfast to city workers, but they started to owe her too much and she left this business. Then she started to sell tamales out of her house. She make home deliveries to her costumers and on the weekends she prepares a variety of foods to sell. Candelaria needs a loan of $425 to purchase corn, sugar and oil to prepare tamales. Candelaria's dream is to open a restaurant in her home.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, sugar and oil to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila S. is a resident of Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and the majority of people living in this region are Newars. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Sarmila has four members including herself in her family. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 4 and her daughter is in primary school.

Sarmila’s husband Mr. Dev Krishna opened his furniture shop a few years ago. He makes different types of furniture such as beds, racks, chairs, tables, doors, and windows, etc. He makes all this furniture according to orders from his customers. Nowadays he is receives lots of orders from his customers to make different types of furniture. But due to lack of money he cannot fulfill the orders of the customers.

So Mrs. Sarmila S. is requesting Rs 30,000 as a loan to help her husband to buy wood and other various raw materials to fulfill the orders for furniture from the customers.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture-making

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el Centro Poblado de Rosa Cani Sector Mamani Allachaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado mayor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor (ovinos) ella los compra en las comunidades de la zonas, para luego venderlos en las ferias del lugar.

Su deseo es poder comprar mayor cantidad de ganado y poder vender al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa belongs to the "Manuela de Hoy" Village Bank, located in Ilave District of El Collao, Puno Department. She is 20 years old and single; she doesn't have any children. She has a high school education, and currently lives in Mamani Allachaya Sector of the Rosa Cani Community. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to buy livestock. She is currently requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy sheep in her local area, which she will later sell at area markets. She likes her savings accounts and her village bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married to Angelito A. and they are fortunately blessed with an only child named Owen Angelo. He is now 8 years old and is currently attending the elementary level of education. Her husband is operating a passenger transport business where most of the passengers are students going to and from their village to school in their town proper. Rowena is engaged in a typical village store business. She provides most of their daily basic necessities at home while some of her income was used to send her children to school. She is thankful for having her business beneficial to her family needs, and she hopes to sustain the business for their growing needs, especially when her two children go to college. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman and give her children a better future someday. 

She is requesting additional business capital for her store from Kiva. She hopes to improve her business and sustain it for the future welfare of her children. She knows that being patient and working hard are the keys to a successful enterprise, thus Rowena keeps doing her best to able meet the standards in managing business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ayaba Viako

texts.fr: Cette dame est veuve et a à sa charge 03 enfants. Depuis la mort de son mari, il lui est difficile de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Pour cette raison elle s’est lancée en 2008 dans la vente de serviettes, de draps et d’habits à Lomé dans le quartier d’Agoè Sokpossito. Elle n’a plus de stock ; pour cela elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 paires de serviettes, 10 paires de drap et 10 bals d’habits de seconde main de toute sorte.

loans.use: Achat de serviettes, de draps et d'habits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Mugoma Kweterana Joyce Baguma Kyawera Group

texts.en:
Joyce B. K. is a 50-year-old widow. She has four children, of which two are in school. She also has three dependents, all of whom attend school. Joyce sells fresh and dry beans. She has run this business, which shifts with the season, for over 10 years. 

Joyce wants to use this loan to increase the stock of beans she offers. Among other things, she wants to purchase three additional sacks of dry beans. She also hopes to purchase iron sheets for her house. Joyce is very hardworking and is a creative asset for her community. Her dream is to see prosperity come her way.

loans.use: To increase the stock of beans she offers.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Oeun T., age 43, and his wife, Mrs. Onn Bou, age 46, were married in 1988 and have five children: one daughter and four sons. Two of their children are in school and the other three are wooden-house builders. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Oeun's wife is pictured in the photo. 

Oeun has been a wooden-house constructor for five years, while his wife stays at home to take care of their children and do housework. Their main source of income is only from his business. Oeun doesn’t have enough materials and wants to purchase more crane materials for operating the business, which is why he is asking for his first loan of $300. 

For their future plans, the couple hopes to support their children’s further education.

loans.use: To purchase crane materials for his wooden-house construction business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn L. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Emelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and snacks such as coconut jelly and rice cakes in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Emelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to improve her current business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan L., 28, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers; additionally, they make cow bells to sell at the local market. They typically make about US $2 each day. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have made this a tough economic year for many Cambodians, Chan L. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase materials and tools to make more cow bells. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: purchasing materials and tools to make more cow bells

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en: H. Nasim is married with 4 children. Given the lack of jobs and the difficulty of earning enough to support his family, ten years ago Nasim and his wife started their own business selling groceries. The quality of their service and daily efforts helped them retain customers. Nasim wants to boost his sales and therefore he is requesting a loan for 4000 Somoni to purchase merchandise. This is his fourth loan with IMON International. We look forward to more opportunities to assist him with his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuff for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Ferdinand's Group

texts.en: Ferdinand V. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City. He is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ferdinand is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. He owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 20,000 every harvesting season. In 2008, Ferdinand joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his fourth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Valente Arrone

texts.pt:
Valente Arrone M. nasceu no Distrito de Bilene, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 23, 21, 18, 13 e 11 anos de idade, destes o mais velho já não estuda. Licenciado em psicologia e pedagogia pela Universidade pedagógica no ano de 2008. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um neto que vive com ele.

Saiu de Bilene para a cidade de Maputo, afim de continuar com os seus estudos, mais tarde começa a trabalhar no Distrito de Marracuene ainda na mesma província como docente. Exerce esta actividade a mais de 33 anos, faz um horário único das 7h as 12 horas e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Foi transferido para Boane onde veio a fixar a sua residência e vive neste local ate hoje. Tem um salário mensal de 12.900.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku quando passava em frente do escritório onde decidiu aproximar e se informar das condições de acesso a crédito. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tintas, cimento, lava loiça, e portas interiores) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 25.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
 Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para construir uma dependência no terreno da sua terra natal em Bilene Macia.
texts.en:
Valente Arrone M. was born in Bilene District, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 50 years old, a married father of five children who are 23,21,18, 13 and 11 years old. The oldest child is no longer studying. Valente graduated from the teaching University with a degree in psychology and education in 2008. He lives with his family in his own house, and supports a grandson who lives with him.

He left Bilene for Maputo in order to continue his studies, and later started working as a teacher in Marracuene District. He performed this work for over 33 years and worked from 7am to 12 noon, following the Ministry of Education schedule. He was transferred to Boane where established his residence, and where he lives today. He earns a monthly salary of 12,900 MZN that he uses for household expenses while still saving some in his bank account.

He has never taken out a loan with another bank, and he learned about Hluvuku when he walked by their office and decided to learn more about the requirements for getting credit. This is his second loan in the amount of 25,000 MZN, with which he intends to buy construction materials (paint, cement, sink and interior doors) to complete his house. The previous loan was for 25,000 to do the same work.

In the future he would like to apply for additional loans in order to build a cottage on land in his home town in Bilene Macia.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Divinas está integrado por Maribel P., Ría C. García, Orlando S. y Jenny del Carmen. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que desde temprana edad han tenido que salir adelante por sus familias.

Maribel P. inicio a vender ropa interior gracias a la ayuda económica que le dio su madre y luego con el tiempo empezó a trabajar en ADIM  lo que le ha permitido crecer. Mientras sus compañeros de grupo tienen comercializan otros productos Ría C. García tiene una fritanga un pequeño restaurante popular, Orlando S.  vende fresco y gaseosa y por último se encuentra Jenny del Carmen quien vende repuestos de bicicleta.
texts.en:
The Las Divinas group is comprised of Maribel P., Ría C. García, Orlando S., and Jenny del Carmen. They are hardworking women who, from an early age, have had to provide for their families. Maribel P. began selling underwear thanks to the economic help of her mother. Later, she began to work with ADIM, which has allowed the business to grow. Other group members have various businesses. Ría C. García has a “fritanga,” a small, popular restaurant. Orlando S. sells juice and soft drinks. And finally, Jenny del Carmen sells bicycle parts.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita F. is a 57-year old widow who lives in Brgy, Utod Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by traveling to local markets to sell spices. She has six adult children and six grandchildren. Some of her children help her run the business.

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in the hope of improving her family's quality of life. Before her husband passed away she saw her family gradually raised from poverty. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD for her spice business, she now earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000. She is a member of good standing and is now borrowing Php 29,500 (her 18th loan) for her traveling spice business. Teresita is working hard to achieve her dream for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"— a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: additional capital for business

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar has owned a poultry shop in his town since 2008 and has five years of experience in this occupation. He's 20 years old and engaged. He works hard to make a good income and to be able to finalize the preparation of his house and the marriage. His shop is well known in the whole region, and he distributes chicken to the nearby restaurants. Today, Omar is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy additional chickens to expand his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens

loans.name: Mrs. Sarom Lous Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom L. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Ruos Sarin, is a fisherman. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are attending the local school. 

Although they work hard, they do not earn enough income. Mrs. Sarom L. decided to ask for a loan to buy baby fish for breeding. She hopes to increase her household income to support the family. 

This village bank consists of 16 members located in Preak Treng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarom L. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

loans.use: To buy baby fish for breeding

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna (pictured in the blue jacket) is a small entrepreneur who sells sports goods and footwear in local markets in the Uzhgorod region. She owns three vending kiosks and has her own loyal clientele. Ganna has been in this business for five years and, currently, her net profit amounts to 5,000 UAH per month.
Ganna is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH to open a new vending location. She has perfect credit history, having repaid all previous loans without any delinquencies. Ganna is very determined and hardworking. She invests much energy into her business venture and seeks to see it grow and flourish. We believe this financial assistance will benefit Ganna’s business and help it develop further.

loans.use: To open a new vending location

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is a positive and hopeful mother who knows that she will overcome all challenges and achieve her dreams. Marisol makes and sells food. She has been in business for more than 10 years. She believes that her proposed loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She will use all of the loan funds to buy rice, sugar and other supplies for her business. Marisol believes that having a greater variety of inventory will help her retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood. 

In 2000, Marisol joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) a microfinance institution and Kiva field partner in the Philippines. A loyal member of ASHI, Marisol has been a dedicated member with a solid performance in her previous credit rating – the basis of loans. Her long-term goal is building a concrete and durable home. With her hard work, focus and determination, Marisol is hopeful that support from ASHI and Kiva will continue to grow and improve the overall quality of living for her family: “Life that is far away from under the umbrella of poverty”.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye G. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Depuis 4 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE et a eu 08 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a eu aucune fois de problème de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de bétail, son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter un bœuf qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 5 mois. Et les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permetrront de participer financièrement à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye G. is 43 year old, she is married and the mother of six children. For the last six years she has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” Dankh Sene. She has received 8 consecutive loans and never had a problem repaying. She sells livestock. Her new loan will allow her to buy an ox that she will fatten up and resell after 5 months. The profit engendered by her activity will enable her to participate financially in providing for the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her cattle fattening activity

loans.name: Shokirdjon

texts.en:
S. Shokirdjon is 30 years old and married with two children. Shokirdjon runs his own café where he cooks shish kebab. His café is located in the market. He has been in this business for six years. On average he serves 30-40 clients a day. He tries to use only the best ingredients in his café. The business is stable and brings considerable income for the family. 

Shokirdjon is planning to expand his business to earn more money. He is requesting a loan of $2000 to purchase meat and coal for his café. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Shokirdjon wants to thank everyone who is supporting him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy meat and coal for his shish kebab café

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Exito Con Cristo 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Casimira, 54, is the coordinator of her group, Exito Con Cristo (Success with Christ), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Casimira’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure.

Casimira is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a cafeteria by purchasing cups, flour, bread and a toaster.

Casimira will use her profits to save toward her dream of opening a small general store in her home, which would give her two stable incomes. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bread, cups, flour, and a toaster

loans.name: Shahida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Shahida perveen lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari Pakistan with her family. Her family consists of four persons: her husband, two sons and herself as well.  

Her husband is a loader by profession. He uses a donkey cart to deliver items such as fruits & vegetables to designated places. He has been doing this work for over five years.  Shahida also operates an animal food selling business. She prepares animal food by receiving orders from her neighbors because her community people are involved in livestock businesses. She and her husband both use their income to meet the expenses of the family and to improve their financial situation. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) for her husband. With the loan he will buy a new donkey cart because the old cart has become rough and rotted in different areas, causing its cargo to fall out. She is hopeful that the new donkey cart will help her husband do his work better and make better profits.

Note: she shows her cutter in this picture which helps her prepare animal food.

loans.use: buying a new donkey cart for hauling business

loans.name: Dorys Jacqueling

texts.es: Dorys Jacqueling de 43 años, Ella tiene una pulpería, Para poder solventar los gastos familiares ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros porque su esposo no ganaba lo suficiente por esta razón ella tuvo que buscar la forma de ganar algo para sus hijos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido surtir mas su negocio, Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite golosinas, refrescos naturales para su local. En el futuro quiere surtir más su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Dorys Jacqueling, 43, operates a corner store. She started the business to pay household expenses because her husband's earnings didn't stretch far enough to cover everything the family needed. She wanted to earn money for her children so she started the business with her savings. Little by liitle, with great effort, she was able to stock her business. She works every day from 8 in the morning to 10 at night. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, cookies and natural drinks for her business. In the future, she wants to stock the store with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bumbury (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Bumbury es un grupo conformado por cuatro amas de casa que se esfuerzan por ser mejores cada día. Rosalía se entero de Fundación Realidad por una vecina y le intereso tanto que se dio a la tarea de buscar a gente responsable para poder trabajar. Actualmente radican en la Comunidad de Chalco, Estado de México. Las integrantes del grupo son: Rosalía López Hernández (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), María Esther V. Martínez (Venta de Pescado), Olga Lidia González Sánchez (Venta de Ropa) y Josefina López Hernández (Venta de Ropa).
 
Rosalía  de 28 años de edad es la representante del grupo (la de blusa morada), su familia la integran su esposo José y sus dos hijos quienes están en edad escolar. Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catalogo ya que para ella lo primordial es tener una estabilidad económica para darles un buen futuro a su hijos. Rosalía ofrece su mercancía con sus vecinos y así ellos la recomiendan con sus amigos y familiares, se surte cada 15 días y dice que la mayoría de sus clientes son hombres, algo raro pero cierto. Sus fechas de mayor venta es cuando los niños regresan a clases y fechas especiales durante el año. El crédito solicitado lo ocupara para la compra de zapatos y con las ganancias que obtenga comprara útiles escolares y uniformes de sus hijos, ya que para ella es una buena inversión. Sus planes son poder construir su casa y así tener el espacio necesario para su familia.

Así como Rosalía las demás integrantes están muy contentas de haber formado su grupo y recibir el apoyo de Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad ya que así podrán comenzar a trabajar y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Bumbury is a group made up of 4 housewives who make an effort to improve themselves every day. Rosalia became aware of the Fundación Realidad through a neighbor, and it interested her so much that she dedicated herself to the task of looking for responsible people that she could work with. This group is located in the community of Chalco, in the state of Mexico. The members of the group are: Rosalía López Hernández (who sells shoes through a catalog), María Esther V. Martínez (who sells fish), Olga Lidia González Sánchez (who sells clothing) y Josefina López Hernández (who also sells clothing). Rosalia, 28, is the representative of the group (in the photo she is wearing the purple blouse.) Her family consists of her husband Jose and their 2 children who are school-aged. For 6 years she has been selling clothing and shoes through a catalog, since for her what is essential is to have economic stability so she can provide a good future to her children. Rosalia offers her merchandise to her neighbors, and they also recommend her to their friends and acquaintances. She gets her products every 15 days, and she says that the majority of her customers are men, which is unusual, but true. The times of the year she sells the most are when the children return to school and during holidays. The loan she requests will be used to buy shoes, and with the earning she obtains she will buy school supplies and school uniforms for her children, since for her this is a good investment. She plans to build her own house and in this way have the space she needs for her family. Rosalia and the other members are very happy to have formed their group and to receive support from Kiva through the Fundación Realidad, because this way they can start to work to accomplish their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing in general, and to buy fish and seafood

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora B. is from the town of Gomez San Isidro. She is 40 years old. Nora is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nora raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs to maturity and selling them at the market. Nora has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
Mrs. Yum S., 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Tres Ter, 44 years old, have been married since 1983 and have seven children. They live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yum's family is Cham Muslim, an ethnic minority in Cambodia. Their main source of income is from their fishing business, as Yum and her husband fish from the river and lake near their house and sell to the market. Some of her fishing materials break so she is requesting a loan of US$1,200 to make the repairs and buy more fishing nets for the business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and repair fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia G. is from the town of Banga. She is 51 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been farming for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She has also started raising pigs for fattening, and sells them at the market.

Letecia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and feed. This will be Letecia’s third loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Norjana

texts.en:
Norjana P. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 61 years old. Norjana is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Norjana owns & operates a business buying, selling and renting digital video disc products in the local community. Norjana has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Norjana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norjana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norjana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. is from Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. She is 35 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Rosita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Llankasunchis De Lares Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LLANKASUNCHIS DE LARES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Lares, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina ;   La socia  es conviviente y tiene 2 menores hijas ellas son gemelas de 4 años, La socia se dedica  a la atención de su restaurante, ella trabaja cocinando en su restaurante y tiene una prima que le ayuda con la atención al público en cuanto a llevar los platos y otras labores. La socia desea a futuro ampliar su pequeño negocio e implementar mas mesas, sillas y utensilios, La socia comprara algunos insumos como es el caso de aceite, papas al por mayor y otros para poder abastecerse. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos y víveres de primera necesidad para su negocio.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos venden maíz, papa, morralla, chuño entre otros productos agrícolas, también tienen tienda abarrotes, venta de animales menores y venta de pasto para cuyes.

Los socios Gregorio H. y Felipe S., aparecen juntos aparte de sus compañeros de banco porque estaban con permiso por motivos de trabajo, ellos trabajan algunas veces como porteadores en el camino inka; aquí los socios terminaban de firmar los documentos que les entregó el asesor de grupo y se añadió la foto al grupo para completar el ochenta por ciento de los socios.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Paulina is a member of the communal bank “LLANKASUNCHIS DE LARES”, which is located in the Lares district, Calca province, in the Cusco region.

Señora Paulina lives with her partner and their two young daughters, who are 4 year old twins. She dedicates her to running her restaurant: she cooks in the restaurant and she has a cousin who helps her with serving the customers, clearing plates and other tasks. She would like in future to expand her little business and put in more tables, seats and utensils. She will buy some ingredients in bulk, such as cooking oil and potatoes among others, so that she has a good stock. She is seeking the loan to buy ingredients and food staples that she needs for her business. 

The other members of the communal bank combine running their households with their small businesses: they sell maize, potatoes, small fish, dried potatoes, among other agricultural produce. Among the members there is also a grocery store, animal sales, and the sale of feed for guinea-pigs.

The group members Gregorio H. and Felipe S. are shown in a separate photo because they were given permission to miss the group meeting for work reasons. They work as porters on the Inka Trail. In the photo, the group members had just finished signing the loan documentation given to them by their loan officer, and the photo of Gregorio and Felipe was added to the group photo in order to have at least 80% of the group members pictured [which is a requirement of Kiva].

Señora Paulina is grateful and values the loan offered through this channel, and promises to complete her repayments on time in the established place.

loans.use: The member is seeking the loan to buy ingredients and food staples for her business.

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn C. is a single woman who lives in Sitio Bugnay, Brgy. Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a general store, a food vending business, and a pig fattening business. 

 Emmalyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emmalyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements. 

Emmalyn C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi K. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  

Mayi has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Mayi sells her products from home, by means of retail.   

Mayi has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through cooked food vending.

The main business challenges for Mayi include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van. 

Mayi lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
José  de 47 años,  es maestro albañil desde hace 7 años atrás. Vive con su esposa e hijo de 16 años en el Paraíso zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas. 

Aprendió hacer maestro albañil para poder mantener a su familia hace 7 años atrás trabaja con la ayuda de su hermano. Para tener más ingresos el también vende pescados. Trabaja desde las 03h00 de la madrugada en el mercado vendiendo pescados hasta las 06h00am que comienza a trabajar como maestro albañil en diferentes construcciones según lo contraten. 

Con el préstamo quiere arreglar su casa comprando con el préstamo cemento, pinturas, bloques. En el futuro quiere tener un local para ubicar un negocio.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old.  He has been a master builder for 7 years.  He lives with his wife and 16 year-old son in El Paraíso, a district which is noted for its dirt roads and hills.

José learned his trade seven years ago so that he could support his family.  His brother helps him in his work.  To make more income for his family he also sells fish.  He works from 3.00am in the market selling fish until 6.00am when he starts his building work on different building sites as and when he is hired.

He will use his loan to fix up his house.  He will buy cement, paint and blocks. In the future he would like to have premises to set up a business.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally O. is a 45-year-old married woman from the town of Banga. She is into farming, hog-raising, and selling food. She and her husband maintain their farm where they plant and harvest rice, corn, and papaya. They also have a small piggery in their backyard. Sally cooks the food that she sells at her eatery. She makes sure to manage her time well between family and businesses. She says she does this all to provide for her family.

Sally joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sally is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs and raw ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and raw ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Dorotea, tiene 53 años D. edad, resiD. en Santiago D. María departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. ropa y tienda, ella vive con sus dos hijos D. 16 y 6 años D. edad, es V., su negocio surgió por iniciativa propia has 4 años, lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, ropa D. bebe, entre otros productos que son necesarios para los clientes, con este préstamo fortalecerá el negocio y mantendrá un buen nivel D. inventario.
Sus aspiraciones con respecto al negocio son crecer y atender bien a su clientela, con su familia su propósito es velar por el bienestar D. sus hijos para que no les falte nada ya que dependen únicamente D. ella.
texts.en:
Dorotea is 53 years old.  She lives in Santiago D. Maria, in Usulutan department.

Dorotea's business is selling clothes.  She is a widow and lives with her two children aged 16 and 6.  She started her business on her own initiative four years ago.  It is located in the town market and she works there from 6.00am to 5.00pm.

Dorotea is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, skirts, underwear, baby clothes and other products that her customers need.  This loan will help her to strengthen her business and keep a good level of inventory.  Her aspirations with respect to her business are to grow and to serve her customers well.  As regards her family, her goal is to look out for the well-being of her children so that they don't want for anything since they depend on her alone.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio es transportista propietario de un radio taxi, el vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en la zona el Kenko, con mucho esfuerzo lograron comprar un terreno en el cual construyeron su casa,  ahora el quiere invertir el dinero solicitado para el pago al albañil, puesto que  el piensa mucho en dar comodidad a su familia. El espera que con el tiempo sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener un mejor futuro, don Antonio es un buen cliente y es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito en la institución y lo solicita para hacer construir su casita, faltan algunos detalles pero ya esta su familia instalada y se sienten felices de estar juntos en su casa, es una persona muy responsable y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Antonio is works in transport and is the owner of a radio taxi. He lives with his wife and his three children in the area of Kenko. With a lot of effort, they managed to buy the land on which they built their home. Now he wants to invest the money requested in paying the bricklayer. He thinks a lot about providing comforts to his family. He hopes that with time his children can study and have a better future. Mr. Antonio is a good customer. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan with the institution. He requests the loan to construct his small house. There are some small things missing but his family has now moved in. They are happy to be together in the house. He is a very responsible person. He feels grateful to the institution for the support it gives.

loans.use: Labor Costs for Construction

loans.name: Cesar Ulises

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ulises; el tiene 55 años de edad, separado y tiene 5 hijos; el socio se dedica a su negocio de imprenta el lleva años en este negocio siendo esta su única actividad que realiza por el momento, el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir así, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad el cual le es muy bueno ya que esta a lado de un Instituto Superior  y eso le trae más clientela ya que  también cuenta con una fotocopiadora y eso hace que tenga más clientes, el socio de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio de imprenta.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ulises belongs to the "PACHAPACCARI" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ulises is 55 years old, separated, and has 5 children.  He has been in the printing business for years and this is his only business activity.  Ulises is a very happy man and has a great desire to remain so.  His business is located in the city center and does very well as it is located next to an institute of higher education which provides him with a lot of customers.  He has a photocopier which brings him even more customers.  Through his business, Ulises manages to get his family ahead in life.

Ulises is requesting this loan to keep his printing business running.  He is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep his printing business running

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 37-year-old married man, father of four kids, living in Bint Jbeil and working in construction for18 years. Mahdi is specialized in painting walls in addition to decorative plates. In order to improve his work and make it more professional, Mahdi is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, to buy a special generator used in painting that helps in spreading the paint equally on the walls and the decorative plates.

 Mahdi is a talented, hard worker, who looks at his work from a professional point of view. Most of his clients are relatives, neighbors, and general contractors. He assures good client service because he believes it's his future investment. Mahdi hopes he can keep on providing secure and healthy living for his family, in addition to providing good education for his kids.

loans.use: To buy a special generator that helps in spreading the paint

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco L. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 60 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns and operates a business venture operating tricycle transport services. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Francisco joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to offer a better service. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. Francisco plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle in order to offer better services

loans.name: Brenda Aracely

texts.es: Brenda Aracely C.: es de 25 años tiene un hijo es casada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica y a la elavoracion de prendas de vestir para Dama Y Caballero, ella lleva 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, nos cuenta que le ha hido bien en su nogocio porque le a generado buena ganancia ella solicita este credito para la compra de 3 cortes tipicos,y compra de telas para elavorar prendas de vestir, ella espera que con este credito pueda aumentar mas sus ganancias y asi poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Brenda Aracely C., is 25 years old and married with one child. Her work is selling traditional garments and making clothing for men and women. She has worked in this area for 8 years, and she reports that her business has gone well for her, because it has generated a good income. She is requesting this loan to buy 3 pieces of traditional woven cloth and to buy fabrics to make clothing. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to further increase her earnings and thus help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing and to buy 3 traditional woven cloth pieces

loans.name: Jaqueline Elisa

texts.es: Jaqueline Elisa se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio. Es una persona muy trabajadora, dedicada a su familia y muy orgullosa de sus raíces. Ella es una ama de casa, por lo que tiene que preparar todo en su hogar, pues tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, por lo que siempre esta preocupándose por brindarle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, tratamientos, sabanas, toallas y ropa en general.  Desea poder seguir adelante con su medio de vida que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
Jacqueline sells general merchandise. She has had her business for more than 7 years. Jacqueline is a hard-working person, dedicated to her family and very proud of her roots. She is a head of household who has to prepare everything in her home, and she has 2 minor children in her charge. Jacqueline is always preoccupied to offer them what is necessary.

The loan she solicits is to buy bags, shoes, cosmetics, treatments, sheets, towels and clothes in general. Jacqueline wishes to be able to continue advancing in her standard of living, which is the most important thing.

loans.use: TO BUY BAGS, SHOES, COSMETICS, TREATMENTS, SHEETS, TOWELS, AND CLOTHING IN GENERAL TO SELL

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is 44 years old and married with three adult children. She is from the town of Baligatan, Ilagan, Isabela. For the past 15 years, Carmelita has been selling fish at the market. She earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. 

Carmelita joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. This will be her first loan with ASKI. Carmelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en: Cleophas is a 49-year-old single mother of four children. She is living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She lives in a rented house and her desire is to educate her children and build a house. For ten years she has been operating a retail shop and with the income generated by the shop she has been able to pay school fees for her children despite challenges in high prices of goods. Her desire is to become a wholesale trader. Cleophas needs the loan funds to complete building her house.

loans.use: To complete building her house.

loans.name: Obidio

texts.es: Obidio, de 29 años, es un hombre carismático y trabajador, convive con María, de 20 años; ambos tienen un hijo; Ángelo de un año y 7 meses de nacido. Los tres viven en casa de su madre ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Hace algunos años atrás se dedica al arado de la tierra; con ayuda de dos toros que tiene y le facilitan en este trabajo; por ello procura darles una buena alimentación para que estén saludables y fuerte. Al ver la rentabilidad que le genera la agricultura, ha decidido tener dos toros más, de esa manera puede dinamizar su trabajo. Obidio desde que era muy pequeño le enseñaron trabajar la tierra y desde entonces le apasiona su trabajo; todos los días le dedica un poco de su tiempo al cultivo de papa, arveja y habas; los que después vende en el mercado central de su ciudad y en temporadas de mayor cosecha vienen los mismos comerciantes a su terreno de cultivo para negociar los frutos que le brindan la tierra. Pero lo que le disgusta son las temporadas de sequía; donde tiene pérdidas de sus sembríos. Dentro de un año construirá su propia casa, ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Progresistas de Chiras”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde  le gusta mucho compartir experiencias con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprará 3 toros, con los cuales trabajará en el arado de la tierra.
texts.en: Obidio is 29 years old and his is a charismatic and hardworking man who lives with his common-law wife, Maria, who is 20 years old. They each have a son together, Angelo, and he is 1 year and 7 months old. The three of them life in his mother's house located in the community of Chiras. For a few years he has been plowing land with the help of two bulls that he owns. He makes sure he provides them with good food, to keep them healthy and strong. Seeing the profitability in agriculture, he has decided to get two more bulls in order to revitalize his business. Obidio was taught how to work the land since he was very young and since then he is passionate about the work. He dedicates some time every day to work in his potato, pea and fava bean cultivations. He later sells the products in the central market and during the high times of the harvest the merchants themselves come to the fields to negotiate for the products from his land.
