He doesn't like the dry seasons because he sees losses in his plantations. Within the next year he will build a house to provide a better quality of life for his family. He is a member of the communal bank "Progresistas de Chiras" and it is his fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He very much enjoys sharing experiences with the other members of the communal bank. With the loan which he requests he will purchase 3 bulls which he will use in plowing the land.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bulls.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz, vive en la meseta D. Achumani y vive con sus dos hijos ya profesionales, uno D. ellos viaja constantemente, ella se dedica a la repostería, elaboración D. galletas, donas tortas, hace mas D. 20 años, elabora queques, tortas y humintas, que reparte en las confiterías D. la zona central y zona sur, es una cliente que trabaja con Emprender desD. el año 2002 , es una cliente muy responsable, y trabajadora, ya que al margen D. esa actividad se dedica a la venta D. refrescos y abarrotes, con el dinero del crédito comprara harina, levadura, etc. para la elaboración D. sus galletas, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Beatriz lives on the Achumani plateau. She lives with her two children who are already professionals, one of whom is constantly traveling. Her work is making baked goods. For more than 20 years, she has maD. cookies, cakes, donuts, tortes and humitas [corn cakes], which she delivers to the pastry shops in the central and southern zones. She has been a client of Emprender since 2002, and she is a very responsible and hard-working client, since in addition to this activity she also works selling soft drinks and groceries. With the funds from the loan she will buy flour, yeast, etc. to prepare her cookies. She is grateful to the institution for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast and other supplies.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria  is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children.  She  has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing, T-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses for sale.

Gregoria  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gregoria  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses for sale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Marina has a retail shop that sells frozen food such as hot dogs & sausages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional frozen food to sell.

Marina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy additional frozen food to sell

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila radica en Chupaca desde hace más de 12 años, es separada  y está en  compañía de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 6 años trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes, negocio que lo tiene instalado en su misma casa,  pues vio la necesidad de abrir una tienda en su localidad como una buena oportunidad de negocio en la que puede abastecer a sus vecinos con productos de primera necesidad. De manera paralela vende animales, que luego de haberlos alimentado y alcanzado y peso adecuado, son vendidos en la feria comercial de su localidad. Actualmente su hija mayor la ayuda en la atención a los clientes, cuando ellos recurren a su tienda, así no deja de vender, pues ella se ha comprometido a trabajar como cobradora de pasajes en una empresa de transporte. Todas estas fuentes de ingreso son necesarias para cubrir las necesidades familiares ya que Luzmila es el único sostén familiar para sus hijos. Con el tiempo este negocio le ha resultado bueno en sus ganancias por lo que aumentará y renovará  la mercadería que normalmente ofrece. Tiene mucho tiempo trabajando con MFP mediante grupos solidarios y considera que es una aliada para  el progreso de su negocio porque siempre ha sabido invertir adecuadamente cada crédito que ha recibido. En la actualidad tiene 10 experiencias  de trabajo grupales anteriores de las cuales esta satisfecha de su permanencia en su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Luzmila has lived in Chupaca for more than 12 years.  She is separated and lives with her three children in her own home.  She has worked in her grocery store for six years, a business that she has put in her house as she saw the need to open a store in her area as a good business opportunity as she can supply her neighbors with staple products.  Alongside this she also sells animals, which after they have been fed and have reached an adequate weight are sold in the commercial market in her area.  Currently her oldest daughter helps her attend to customers when they come to her store, thus she doesn’t stop selling.  She has also committed to work selling tickets in a transport company.  All of these sources of income are necessary to cover the family necessities as Luzmila is the sole breadwinner for her children.  Over time this business has had good results for her profits and she would like to expand and renew the merchandise she normally offers.  She has worked with MFP for a long time through solidarity groups and considers it an ally for the progress of her business because she has always known to invest appropriately each loan that she has received.  Currently she has 10 previous experiences with group work and she is satisfied to stay in the group.  With the money she will invest in more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, and soups.

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Kheang, 49, and her husband, 50, have been farming since 1980. Both of them have skill and experience in the farming business. They have been married a long time and have four children. 

Her family is living in happiness because Kheang and her husband are able to gain enough cash each day, and two of their children are working in Phnom Penh for a suitable salary that they give to their parents every month. 

To raise the living standard of the family, Kheang wishes to ask $700 to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La señora  Isidora, estudio hasta  la primaria terminada , y tiene un total de  tres hijos  una mujer y dos varones  .Ella  se dedica  a  la  venta de pan  desde  hace  cuatro años atrás   se  ha dedicado a la venta de  pan .  
Tiene que reunirse con sus compañeras cada semana para realizar sus pagos.
Cuando las personas tienen compromisos la contratan para que les vaya preparar el pan, es una  persona muy amable con sus clientes ya que hay señoras que le compran pan por mayoreo para vender en sus  negocios.
Sus hijos le ayudan en lo que pedan, a su hija  Martha le gusta  preparar  la masa y abrochar,  Isidora  esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que le da muy buenas ganancias.
Ella pidió el préstamo   para  compara  mas  ingredientes  ya que en ocasiones  tiene  mucho trabajo  y por falta de dinero se atrasa en sus pedidos y a ella le pagan hasta que entrega el pan.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Isidora completed her primary school education. She has a total of three children, a girl and two boys. She sells bread and she has been selling bread for the past four years.

She meets every week with her colleagues to make her payments.

When people have commitments they contract her to make bread. She is a very kind person with her clients. There are women who buy form her in wholesale to sell in their businesses.

Her children help her as much as they can. Her daughter Martha enjoys preparing the dough and glazing. Isidora is very happy with her business because it gives her good profits.

She requests a loan to purchase more ingredients because when she has a lot of work she falls behind because she doesn't have enough capital funds. She only gets paid when she delivers her bread.

She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) in supporting her to move forward and to attain her dreams.

loans.use: to sell bread.

loans.name: Minalona

texts.en:
Minalona is 44 years old and blessed with six children. She is sending four children to school. Minalona's eldest daughter did not continue her studies because she suffers from acute dysmenorrhoea. She can’t stay any longer in school; this is the primary reason why she stopped. Secondly, Minalona can’t afford to send them all to school because of the continuous medication of her child. Aside from raising hogs, she also accepts laundry for additional income.

She stated that there are nights she can’t sleep well due to her problems. She thinks about how and when they will end the difficulties in life. She tried to find for a better job, but unfortunately, she wasn't employed. She never experienced going to college and having a degree. She regrets that, but she can’t turn back time anymore. Right now, she is working hard in maintaining her business to sustain the needs of her children. 

She is requesting a loan amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy hog feed, and she is planning to buy another piglet to raise. Minalona almost gave up but with God's guidance, she keeps going. 

She hopes that she can surpass all these trials so that she can provide a successful life for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 36 years old and widowed. She runs a retail shop and it has been in operation for the last five years, making a monthly profit of KES 10,000. This will be her third loan. She has been loaned KES 30,000. She plans to purchase stock such as maize flour, sugar, matchboxes, salt, cooking fat, etc.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to support her family. In the near future, she hopes to have a well-established business that serves her entire community.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as maize flour, sugar, matchboxes, salt, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is married and is the loving mother of her children. She is a well-mannered and conscientious person. She has been involved in fattening pigs for over three years. Her husband helps her with this business, and looks after and feeds the livestock when she goes to the market to buy more livestock. 

She wants to expand her business and maximize her profits in order to provide for her family and place her children into schools. Rosalia wants to obtain a loan in the sum of P10,000 for the purchase of feed and vitamins and increasing turnover. She is grateful to all creditors for their help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel vive en la comunidad conocida como Esquilan Chico en la privincia de Quillacollo en el departamento de Cochabamba, Angel es una persona muy trabajadora. No está casado ni tiene hijos y solo termino colegio hasta primaria desde entonces se dedica al 100 % al cuidado de su ganado lechero.  Angel se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y su posterior venta a la empresa Pil Andina y también se dedica a la elaboración de quesillo y su posterior venta en el mercado de Colcapirhua. Actualmente cuenta con 9 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y obtiene de las mismas un aproximado de 90 litros diarios.
El siguiente crédito que solicita es para la compra de un tanque de leche enfriamiento (el tanque de enfriamiento es un deposito de leche cruda que se mantiene en buen estado, es de este tanque de donde recoge la Empresa Pil la leche todas las mañanas y todas las tardes) el cual en primer lugar tiene un costo aproximado de 13.000$us a 16.000$us, es por esta razón que la compra la están haciendo conjunta con otras 15 personas de la misma comunidad poniendo 1000$us cada uno. Angel al tener el tanque de enfriamiento cerca de casa podrá colocar más leche en el mismo y tal vez dejar de vender quesillo el cual le toma mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Ángel lives in a community known as “Esquilan Chico” in Quillacollo Province, Cochabamba Department.  Ángel is a very hardworking man.  He’s not married and has no children. He only completed elementary school and since then has been 100% dedicated to work caring for his dairy cattle.   Ángel is a raw milk dairy farmer.  The milk is sold to the Pil Andina firm.  He also makes cheese that he then sells at the Colcapirhua market.   He currently has nine head of dairy cattle that he gets about 90 liters of daily production from.

The loan he’s asking for is to buy a milk cooling tank (The cooling tank is a storage unit to keep raw milk in good condition.  This is the tank that the Pil firm collects the milk from every morning and afternoon).  Its price is between US$13,000 to US$16,000 and this is why the purchase is being made together with 15 other people from the same community; each one is putting in US$1,000.  By having a cooling tank closer to home, Ángel will be able to store more of his milk in it and perhaps be able to stop selling cheese which takes up a lot of his time.

loans.use: to pay his share in a milk cooling tank.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 42 years old and married with four children.

Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Daisy has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice, charcoal and ready-to-wear.

Daisy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Chung is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For three years she has operated a general store to sell household appliances, children's toys, confectionery and personal use items.

She would like a loan to purchase more of these products in bulk to stock in her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances, children's toys, confectionery and personal use items to stock in her general store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (a sister).She sells second-hand clothes at the market. In addition, she does part-time tailoring. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works six days a week .She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. Her major business challenges are defaulters, transportation and the increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 57 years old and widowed with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

Perla has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: 01.03.09 Đông Sơn-Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hường is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has a manufacturing business making charcoal. Hường has been involved in this business for five years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase material to maintain her charcoal factory. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 01.03.09 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 

This is Hường’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hường faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase material to maintain her charcoal factory.

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en:
Tauva is 40 years old, married and has 3 children.

Tauva owns & operates a business, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has many years experience in this business. Tauva needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Tauva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tauva's 1st loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Chryzl

texts.en:
Chryzl is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 
Chryzl has a pigpen that sells grown & mature pigs. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.
Chryzl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Chryzl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.es:
Floridalma, tiene 42 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijas de 5, 11 y 18 años de edad, vive en las Brisas del Negrito, Yoro junto a su esposo quien es comerciante también.

Doña Floridalma hace 3 años decidió establecer una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser maíz, arroz, manteca, café, pan, especies, refrescos, churros, verduras y otros. Es una señora muy trabajadora atiende a sus clientes todo el día. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como niñera en un Kínder y  con el fin de obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir gastos de educación de sus hijas, decidió este negocio.
Ha solicitado este préstamo de L.10,000 para surtir mas sus negocio en productos alimenticios como granos básicos, pan, café, churros, manteca y verduras.
Su gran motivación es generar ingresos para educar a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Floridalma, 42, is married and has three daughters who are 5, 11 and 18 years old.  She lives in Brisas del Negrito, Yoro with her husband who is also a merchant.

Floridalma opened a grocery store three years ago where she sells basic staple items like corn, rice, lard, coffee, bread, spices, soft-drinks, snacks, vegetables and others.  She is a very hardworking woman who tends to her customers all day.  She used to work as a nanny at a Kindergarten and in order to earn better income for her daughters’ education costs she decided on this business.

She has requested a L.10,000 loan to better stock her store with foodstuffs like basic grains, bread, coffee, snacks, lard and vegetables.  Her great motivation is to generate income to educate her daughters.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kulmurat

texts.en: Kulmurat is hardworking man from southern Tajikistan. He is 40 years old. Kulmurat is married and has 5 children. Two of them are adults and three of them are non adults. Kulmurat 10 years ago began his business deal with animal husbandry because he needed to money. He feeds sheep and cows. Kulmurat feeds 9 sheep and 6 cows now. He feeds cattle in his house where he has a big cowshed. He is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. He is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy 5 sheep. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy 5 sheep for increasing working capital

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Sari-sari stores in the Philippines are commonly found in every neighborhoods, Barangays and barrios, without spending for fair going to cities just to buy items. “sari-sari” is a Filipino word which means “variant” where items are cheap since products can be purchased on wholesale but being sold by piece, kilos or by volume to consumers.

Charlotte, is one of the members of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), a housewife and a Sari-sari store owner. She enjoys managing the store since she can take care of her family while running the business. Indeed, this became a medium for her in supporting the needs of her family. However, not all the time she earns good profit, she still needs capital to buy additional products so that her variety store will become a one-stop-shop someday which is one of her dreams. 

Charlotte applied for a Php 10, 000 loan as an added capital since she aims to expand the business by adding products like can goods, Sugar, Oil. Bottled drinks and other grocery items.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Charlotte spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items like can goods, Sugar, Oil. Bottled drinks and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her pharmacy business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Two are in Primary school and other two in are in secondary school. Zainabu owns a small stall at Tandika market, a famous market in Dar es Salaam for selling used clothes. She sells used clothes for men and women.

Zainabu thanks all the lenders for her first loan with Kiva. With the loan she was able to increase the size of her stall and stock of clothes.

Zainabu is now requesting a second loan with Kiva. With this loan she is planning to add a stock of clothes, improve display facilities and add a new line of locally made “batik” clothes. She is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mehpara

texts.en: This 32-year-old woman has her own store. She is married and has a child. Mehpara is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, in the Fizuli region. 5 years ago, she decided to open this store. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy foodstuffs and to improve her business. This is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Mrs. Feliciana C. D. G. is 51 years old, is married, and has 6 sons. The sons are of ages 32, 30, 23, 21, 20, and 14 and they all still live with her in the house. Even though she was not able to finish her studies and attain a high school diploma, she opened her own convenience store from her residence where she serves everybody in the neighborhood, selling goods of prime need. In the store, she works with her husband and the two youngest who go out and sell their goods to those who can’t go to their store. The eldest sons all work independently.

She confronted several hardships along the way since nobody wanted to hire her or give her any loans and so she started from nothing. She started out by cleaning clothes for families and did some fishing. In time, she was able to save enough money to start her convenience store. Now she can proudly say that she has been able to refurbish her entire residence as well as proviD. all her children with a stable living.

In addition to all these problems, her location next to the Paraguay River has brought about some hardships. Floods are sometimes common which not only make her work extra hard, but also limit the clientele that visit her on those days.

She requires the loan to be able to expand her business and make a salon for customers to sit down and eat, since she not only prepares food to go, but she also prepares lunches and dinners seven days a week. She also wants to buy more merchandise to proviD. a greater variety of goods for her demanding clientele.

loans.use: Construct a dining room to serve lunches and dinners

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia, 30, a very laborious woman, is married, with four children.  Her husband helped her start a grocery store to sell basic foodstuff to the people of the community.  Otherwise, they’d have to walk more than one hour to buy any goods in other zone.  Currently, she is in need of US $325.00 to purchase a larger stock of products and be able to give the clients more variety.   She also wants to increase her income to continue providing her four children with a good education.  The loan will be completely repaid in six months.
(The picture shows Basilia's husband working in the grocery store, as she was not present when our personal visited her house for the Kiva report).

loans.use: To purchase a larger stock of products

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.es:
Rolanda is 54 years old and lives in the the Morales district in the province of San Martín and the Department of San Martín. She is a member of the Community Bank "Sargento Lores".

For 10 years Rolanda has owned her own stall in the Market No. 2 in Tarapoto. She sells groceries, personal hygiene items, cleaning products (such as soaps, detergents, disinfectants and brooms), beauty products, and general merchandise, including bags with closures and lanterns. The business has prospered considerably. Still she feels the business could be more prosperous if she offered a wider variety of products. With this loan of S/ 1000 (Peruvian Sols, equivalent to about $333) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 4 months, Rolanda will buy 2 dozen bags with closures for the market, 2 dozen bottles of shoe polish, shampoos, soaps in boxes, 2 dozen packages of toothpaste, dozens of needles for sewing and needlework, 5 packages of sanitary pads of various brands, 1 dozen pencil cases, 1 dozen money purses, 3 dozen combs of various models, small mirrors, deoderants and 10 packages of toilet paper. She is also thinking about selling shoes and sandals in the near future.

Rolanda lives with her husband and her son, who is finishing his studies. The earnings from the business help to pay for her son's studies. Her husband always helps her around the house and, when needed, in the business. Her wish is that her small stall grows into larger store with a variety of products; she works tirelessly every day to make that wish a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Rolanda tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín y es socia del Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”.

Desde hace 10 años tiene su puesto en el mercado Nº 2 de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, artículos de limpieza como, jabones, detergentes, desinfectantes, escobillas, productos de belleza, artículos de higiene personal, artículos de mercería en general, bolsas con cierres, linternas. El negocio ha prosperado bastante y todavía le falta más, ya que cuando tiene variedad de productos siente que vende más.

Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 ($ 333.00), que pagará en 4 meses, comprará 2 docenas de bolsas con cierre para el mercado, 2 docenas de betunes, champúes, jabones en cajas,2 docenas de cremas dentales, docenas de hilos de coser y tejer, 5 paquetes de toallas higiénicas de diversas marcas,1 docena de cartuchera, 1 docena de monederos, 3 docenas de peines de varios modelos, espejitos, cajitas de mentoles, desodorantes, 10 paquetes de papel higiénico y más adelante piensa vender zapatos y sandalias en cantidad.

Rolanda vive con su esposo y un hijo que está estudiando y con las ganancias del negocio ayuda a pagar sus estudios. Su esposo siempre le ayuda en la casa y a veces en el negocio. Su deseo es que su pequeño puesto se convierta en una tienda más grande con variedad de productos, por lo que día a día lucha incansablemente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise: grocery items, cleaning items and personal hygiene items

loans.name: Miguel Crispin

texts.es:
Miguel is 47 years old and he lives in his house with his two children. This house is located in the Antonio SAAD St., North of Warnes. His wife doesn’t live with them because she is working abroad.

He works as an equipment operator in the dairy plant PIL Andina and supplements his income by renting out part of his house.

His job is reliable, so there is not much risk of being unemployed and his rental income it’s also reliable due to a continuous renting demand in the area.

With this loan the client will purchase all the material he needs to build the bathroom he needs for his house. This would give him an inside bathroom for his family and the current outside bathroom would be used by his renters.

This would be the third loan for Miguel with Agrocapital, he had an excellent repayment history on his previous two loans, and he currently has two loans with other financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel tiene 47 años de edad y vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la calle Antonio SAAD zona norte de Warnes, su esposa no vive con ellos ya que se encuentra trabajando en el exterior.

Miguel trabaja como operador de equipo II en la planta de leche PIL Andina y paralelamente recibe ingresos por concepto de alquiler de parte de su casa.

En cuanto al trabajo como operario es trabajador dependiente y no existe mucho riesgo, por otra parte en cuanto al alquiler de su casa tampoco ya que la demanda de alquileres es continua.

Con la presente solicitud el cliente construirá y comprará todos los equipos de baño que necesita para su casa, mismo que será trasladado ya que actualmente se encuentra fuera de la misma, y el baño de afuera será para uso de sus inquilinos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Miguel en Agrocapital, los cuales pagó excelentemente, también tiene dos créditos en otras financieras que también los mantiene vigentes.

loans.use: Building a bathroom for his house

loans.name: Nícida

texts.es:
Every day beginning at 5 in the evening Nicida goes out to sell her delicious kebabs (meat skewers) in the main square or other places where people gather, as she take good advantage of every opportunity that come her way. Like all mothers, she wishes to provide her family with a comfortable and dignified life and the efforts of her work are dedicated to the members of her home.

Now she has new projects in mind: with the sale of fuel being the nearest to realization, as she only needs a sum of money to complete her establishment of this business. But for this to happen needs people like you, who can offer her a friendly hand and make her dream into reality.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Todos los días a partir de las cinco de la tarde Nícida sale a vender sus riquísimos anticuchos a la plaza de su comunidad o a los lugares donde se conglomeran las personas ya que cada oportunidad es muy bien aprovechada por ella. Ella al igual que todas las madres desea ofrecer a su familia una vida cómoda y digna y el esfuerzo de su desempeño se lo debe a los miembros de su hogar.

Ahora tiene nuevos proyectos por realizar y la venta de combustible es el que más próximo a concretarse, sólo requiere de una suma de dinero para terminar de establecer su negocio pero sin duda necesita de personas como usted que le puedan tender una mano amiga y hacer realidad su deseo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to establish a small sales space in her home from which to sell fuel.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: K. Nazira is 34 years old, lives in Khujand, and is married with 3 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  Mrs. K. has eight years of experience in the business of selling food products. She has a good assortment of such products (meat products, milk-sour products, sweets, vegetable oil, etc).  By working in the bazaar, Mrs. K. often meets strong competition, so she has asked Kiva for a business development loan of 3500 TJS ($1,025) for 8 months to import new goods.

loans.use: Importing new goods.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mercedes M. devotes herself to being a homemaker for her two children and her husband. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young, and he is currently in the city of León, municipality of Sauce.

It's important to note that since she lives in this rural area, she does not have electricity. Since having electricity is very useful, she decided to get a solar panel on credit so that she could have access to two lamps and a television. On taking on this debt, Mercedes turned to Ceprodel to gain credit that would cancel this debt. The credit will make sure her children are able to take advantage of this energy for their studies at night after their chores are done.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad a la que se dedica la señora Mercedes M. es a ser ama de casa teniendo dos hijos y su esposo que trabaja en la agricultura desde muy joven en la ciudad de León específicamente en el municipio de el Sauce.

Es de mucho interés destacar que desde que vive en esta localidad por estar ubicada en zonas rurales no posee energía eléctrica y por ser tan útil este servicio, decide adquirir un panel solar al crédito para lograr tener acceso a dos lámparas y un televisor. Al contraer la deuda, la señora Mercedes acude a Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita cancelar esta deuda y lograr que sus hijos aprovechen la energía para sus estudios por las noches además para realizar los quehaceres del hogar.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel to provide her household with electricity

loans.name: Fatuma's Mandingo Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 27 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 6 to 11. Fatuma owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2001. Every day she works from 6:15 AM to 9:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items (alcohol and soft drinks) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Fatuma, Pili, and Sera, who have businesses dealing in food vending and cloth and shoes sales.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items (alcohol and soft drinks) for her business

loans.name: Hasanova

texts.ru:
G. is a 30-year-old divorced mother of three. She sells vegetables at the market in Khujand. Right now, G. lives with her parents and brothers. They help her out, since her turnover isn't high and she isn't making a very big profit. In order to expand her business, G. has applied for a loan from Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Гульнора возрост 30 лет имеет 3 детей с мужем разведена , сама торгует на рынке Худжанда . В данное время Гульнора живет вместе с родителями и братьями , которые помогают ей по жизни , т.к. ее оборот пока не велик и прыбыль конечно она имеет не большую. Поэтому для того чтобы увеличит свой бизнес она решила обратится в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Selling vegetables

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1968 in Sokodé, a town situated 350 km from Lomé, Mrs. Bintou Allassani is a widow with four children, two of whom are at school and the other two married. She has been selling charcoal and firewood in Lomé's Agoè neighborhood since 1998. She has a supplier from whom she obtains supplies on credit. It is therefore after she has made her sales that she pays her supplier. The amount she pays her supplier means that she does not make a decent profit. To this end, she is requesting a loan to buy 4 bags of charcoal and 5 bundles of firewood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 31 décembre 1968 à Sokodé, ville située à 350 Km de Lomé, Dame ALLASSANI Bintou est une veuve ayant quatre enfants dont deux scolarisés et deux autres mariés. Elle a commencé l’activité de vente de charbons de bois et de bois de chauffe dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé depuis 1998. Elle a un fournisseur auprès de qui elle s’approvisionne à crédit. Donc c’est après avoir vendu qu’elle fait le remboursement à son fournisseur. La somme qu’elle paie à son fournisseur fait qu’elle ne gagne pas un bénéfice sensible. A cet effet, elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’acheter au comptant 04 sacs de charbon de bois et 5 tas de bois de chauffe.

loans.use: To buy 4 bags of charcoal and 5 bundles of firewood

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.es:
Ciriaca has a cart and works in the Pil Andina factory, selling her products. She has a monthly salary and is a natural healer. She thus combines her incomes and uses them to support her 12 year-old daughter and adopted 6 year-old daughter. They live in the Villa Bolivar zone of El Alto.

The loan will be used to upkeep her cart: her work equipment and source of income.

This is the fifth Impro loan. Her good loan behavior has allowed her to request another. She has been working with Impro since 2003.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva Volunteer

Ciriaca tiene un carro que trabaja para en la fabrica Pil Andina, comercializando sus productos. Percibe un sueldo mensual; ella también es curandera naturista, de esta manera combina sus ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de su hija de 12 años y una niña que adopto de 6 años; vive en la zona Villa Bolivar de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su carro que es su herramienta de trabajo y su fuente de ingreso.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2003.

loans.use:
Cost of maintaining her cart for the PIL Andina Milk Plant

Costo de mantenimiento de su carro que trabaja para la Planta Industrializadora de leche PIL Andina.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, a 40-year-old married man, lives with his wife and 2 children in a small village close to Tyre, in the South of Lebanon. Hassan is an auto repairman. He needs an amount of USD 700 to cover the administrative expenses of applying for Lebanese citizenship. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To pay administrative expenses of applying for Lebanese citizenship

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena S. is 38 years old. She is married and has two children. Two of her kids are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, pastries which she prepares herself, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. to people from her neighborhood.

With the loan, Abena wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Abena S. belongs to the Trust group called Lydia Mma Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan. (Her picture was taken when she was visited at her shop.)

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Ayenor

texts.en:
Ayenor T., 38 years old and the mother of four children, is a local manufacturer of soaps, combining such materials as palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to make her products. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds, so she is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise her income in order to support her children’s education.

Ayenor belongs to the community group called Good Shepherd Trust Group, whose members support one another and guarantee repayment of their loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials including palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to produce soap.

loans.name: Kobil

texts.en: A. Kobil is 32 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff and detergents in his store. His store is very famous in his community thus allowing him to have a good clientele. Currently Kobil has about 7000 Somoni (2050 USD) in inventory and his monthly net profit is about $ 300-400. Today Kobil is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 5 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Kobil’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Foodstuff and detergents for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mrs. Ra P. is a villager in Ang Konh Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small rice field to cultivate rice to earn a living. In the cultivation, she usually gathers the revenue every January. Her husband, Mr. Lam Pov, helps her in the plantation. They have five children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Although they have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Ra decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband to start as a motorbike taxi driver. She hopes to increase their income with this loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Ra would like to buy a new motorbike for her husband to start as a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Acuario Rsr Group

texts.es: El Grupo  ACUARIO RSR esta representado por la señora Luzmila. Este Banco tiene doce componentes que en su mayoría radican en la Zona Villa Caluyo D. la ciudad del Alto, el grupo tiene un nivel D. vida regular, estas señoras son en su mayoría comerciantes D. diferentes productos como la venta venta D. comida, abarrotes, chompas, mantas y prendas D. vestir tejidas a mano y macramé. Ellas necesitan el crédito para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y Stoker sus mercaderías, viendo la posibilidad D. crecimiento por las fechas naviD.ñas en la cual existe mayor demanda del mercado, siempre existe la competencia pero no tienen importancia cuando se tiene la lealtad D. sus compradores y la fuerza del trabajo del grupo. Los miembros del grupo ingresan al tercer ciclo por lo que gozan D. experiencia en grupos solidarios prevaleciendo la responsabilidad y el cumplimiento en los pagos D. anteriores ciclos.
texts.en:
The ACUARIO RSR group is represented by Luzmila. This bank is maD. up of 12 additional people who are mainly from the Zona Villa Caluyo area of the town of Alto. The group has an average standard of living. These women are for the most part traders of various products such as food sales, groceries, sweaters, blankets, hand-woven clothing and macrame. They need a loan in order to increase their working capital and increase their stock of merchandise as they see an opportunity for growth with the holiday season when demand is greatest. There is always competitition but they are not concerned as they have loyal clients and each other's strength. The members of this group are beginning their third cycle. They have experienced group solidarity and payment compliance in previous loan cycles.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Morekegi

texts.en: Morekegi sells drinks, bottled water, and sachet water. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 35 years old and married with a child. She hopes to expand her business through this Kiva loan. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bùi Thị Xuân năm nay 44 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại hàng tháng nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị  là từ việc chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu, lương thợ xây của chồng  và sự hỗ trợ của hai con với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 7.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm nguyên vật liệu phụcvụ cho công việc dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Xuân is 44 years old. She has been participating in the TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, she has a monthly income of 4,000,000 VND from raising livestock, weaving mats, her husband's salary as a construction worker and the support of their two children. For this loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 7,000,000 VND to buy more raw materials to support her mat weaving business and further improve the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials for weaving mats

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene F. is a Tanzanian entrepreneurial married woman with two school children. She runs a clothing shop and Kiosk at Kisiwani in Bugruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells traditional clothing (Vitenge and Kanga) to customers in her shop. She purchases the clothing from Mnazi mmoja traditional clothing wholesale shops and sells at retail to customers in her shop. She has been in the business for four years, and she has also managed to open a soft drink business selling a variety of soft drinks. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Monsieur Balla D. est un chauffeur marié qui habite au quartier Médina FALL de Thiès. Il est chauffeur depuis trés longtemps et a une grande expérience professionnel. Avec ce prêt il compte répérer son véhicule de taxi-urbain qui est en panne d'où il travaille pour entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Balla D. is a married taxi driver who lives in the Médina Fall neighborhood of Thiès. He has been a driver for a very long time and has a great deal of professional experience. He plans to use this loan to repair his taxi, which has broken down. He uses the vehicle for work in order to support his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: Joyce S. is the treasurer of Nsagu akugoba group in Nakawuka. She is a married lady and a mother of 7 children who are all in school. She is a farmer of various plantations of matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes, tomatoes and so on. She also has a poultry business of both broilers and layers, as well as 4 dairy cows that give her milk mostly for sale. She says that this is her 28th loan that she is seeking from Pearl Microfinance and her plan is to ensure that she buys chicken feed and fertilizers for her farm. She is grateful that the loans have helped her family, especially helping her husband to pay school fees for their children, and also increasing the number of cows that she has now.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and fertilizers for her chicks and farm respectively.

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede is 35 years old and married with two children. She is a fashion designer and makes lovely designs for her customers.  Bosede is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase one industrial weaving machine.  She promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase industrial weaving machine.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Mrs. Erlinda B., of legal age, is married and the mother of seven children. She is a resident of Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. Her primary source of income is backyard gardening of corn, different root crops and vegetables. She also has a sari-sari store in her home and she sells fish. She is now requesting her sixth loan from Paglaum intended to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Las Kantutas Group

texts.es: El grupo las “Kantutas” esta conformado por 3 hombres y 12 mujeres este banco es  bueno ya que esta dirigido y bien organizado a la cabeza del señor Bernardino quien es su presidente, la señora Seneida Tesorera y la señora Rinia Susana secretaria, todos pertenecientes al barrio Mineritos. Responsables del sustento D. sus familias los miembros D. este grupo realizan diferentes actividades como   la venta D. bebidas, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, ropa, pan, comida y al servicio D. transporte en motocicletas.  El crédito solicitado esta destinado a la compra D. mercadería, materia prima y a la reparación D. sus maquinarias D. trabajo que ayuden a generar mayores ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida. Los miembros D. este grupo van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que cuentan con la confianza D. nuevos financiamientos.
texts.en:
The "Kantutas" group is maD. up of 3 males and 12 females. This well organized bank is highly regarded and is managed by the minds of señor Bernardino, the president, señora Seneida, the treasurer, and señora Rinia Susana, the secretary. They all live in the Mineritos neighborhood. All of the group members are responsible for supporting their families and engage is different activities such as selling drinks, groceries, clothing, bread, and food in the neighborhood stores and providing transportation via motorcycle. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise and raw materials and to repair machinery used in their lines of work. The loan will help to increase their incomes and allow them to proviD. their families with a better quality of life. The members of this group have repeatedly demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making the payments of their second loan and are confident they will do so with their new financing.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ram Maiya

texts.en:
Ram Maiya D. lives in a nuclear family in Chapagaun. Chapagaun is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with her husband, Mr. Surya Bahadur D., and two sons. Both of her sons are now studying.

Both Mrs. D. and Mr. D. are farmers and they prefer to grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Especially they grow green vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily.

Now Mrs. D. is requesting Rs 25,000 as a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Victor Hernan

texts.es:
el sr. VICTOR HERNAN D. S. se dedica a dar el servicio de transporte de personas de un lugar a otro en la ciudad de Danli, el tiene un TAXI urbano que opera bajo el nombre de "TRANSPORTE SAUCEDA" con el Nº 247 de su legítima propiedad.
Es notable el desarrollo que el Sr. D. ha tenido, ya que anteriormente el circulaba en un carro marca TOYOTA TERCEL, Año 1983 y ahora con las ganancias que ha generado este rubro cambio de unidad de transpote por un vehiculo marca KIA Rio, año 2001 con el cual puede brindarle al publico un mejor servicio.
El Sr. D. tiene 7 años de estar laborando como taxista de esta ciudad, con los ingresos que le genera esta actividad ha podido mantener su vivienda,  su familia y gracias a eso los hijos de el estan saliendo adelante en sus estudios. El Sr. D. ha podido salir adelante gracias al
esfuerzo diario que el hace transportando personas de un lugar a otro, para poder llevar a su hogar lo mas necesario como ser la alimentacion diaria, cubrir los gastos de vivienda y la salud de cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Mr. VICTOR HERNAN D. S. transports passengers from one place to another in the city of Danli. He owns a legitimate taxi which operates under the name "TRANSPORTE SAUCEDA" under No. 247. Mr. D.'s business development has been remarkable.He used to drive a 1983 Toyota Tercel and now with the profits generated from his business, he was able to change to a 2001 KIA Rio, with which he is able to provide a better service for his customers. Mr. D. has been working as a taxi driver in this city for 7 years, with the revenue he generates from his business, he has been able to maintain his home and family.Due to his business, his children are moving forward in their studies. Mr. D. has been able to move ahead thanks to the daily effort of transporting people from place to place, in order to bring home the necessary income to cover his family's living expenses such as food, household expenses and health care for each one of them.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the registration of his vehicle and purchasing  5 tires and seat covers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
HELEN B. of Purok Tisa, Hacienda Libertad, Brgy. Mailum, Bago City, Negros Occidental is 31 years old, married with 3 school-age children.

When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 5 years ago, she invested the capital she borrowed by setting up as store that sells plastic wares, Ready-to-Wear Clothes, Shoes and accessories, and this earns a profit of approximately PHP 4,000.00 per month.

Now with all her 3 children going to school (Grade 1, 2 & 6) she needs to supplement her income from her retail business to pay for the additional expenses that this development entails. This is the reason why Helen thought of purchasing livestock to raise and sell to augment the income she earns from her main business.

Borrowing PHP 19,500.00 from NWTF-Project Dungganon for her 10th loan cycle, Helen intends to set aside the money she earns from the livestock venture for the educational needs of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: PURCHASE LIVESTOCK TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Camelia Group

texts.es:
El grupo camelia es originario de la comunidad “Colonia Guadalupe” de la ciudad de Masaya; Las integrantes son Carolina R., Bertha E. y Flor G.. Las tres se dedican a la venta de Verduras y otros productos.

La coordinadora del grupo es Carolina, quien a sus 20 años, trabaja en la venta de Repollos, además elabora platanitos (Plátano frito, empacado en pequeñas bolsas), y elaboran tortillas. 

Este es el trabajo que realiza su familia en conjunto para poder subsistir. Iniciaron su negocio hace 7 años, cuando su mamá movida por la necesidad, decidió empezar la venta de platanitos en su casa. Actualmente elaboran mayores cantidades y los venden en los colegios, y otros centros de la comunidad. Además iniciaron la venta de repollos. Carolina dice que como familia han tenido que enfrentar situaciones difíciles, como lo es el hecho de que su hermano está muy enfermo. Pero que siguen adelante, y todos trabajan unidos.

Bertha trabaja en la venta de frutas en el mercado de Masaya; Flor trabaja vendiendo Verduras de manera ambulante en la ciudad de Masaya.
texts.en:
The Camelia group is originally from the Colonia Guadalupe neighborhood in the city of Masaya. The members are Carolina R., Bertha E. and Flor G.. The three of them work selling vegetables and other products. The coordinator of the group is Carolina, who at 20 years of age, works selling cabbage. She also makes platanitos (fried plantains, packaged in small bags) as well as tortillas. This is the work that her family does to be able to get by. They started the business 7 years ago when her mother, out of necessity, decided to start selling platanitos in her house. Currently, they make them in larger quantities that are sold in schools and other places in the neighborhood. In addition, they started selling cabbages. Carolina says that they have had to face difficult situations as a family, such as the fact that her brother is very sick. But they continue ahead and all of them work together. Bertha works selling fruit in the Masaya market. Flor works selling vegetables as a street vendor in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials for businesses

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr: Atsu A. est un homme de 49 ans  marié et père d’un enfant. C’est un cultivateur demeurant à WOME, un village situé à environ 112 kilomètres de Kpalimé, Il fait la culture du maïs et du manioc  etc … en vue de revendre à la population. Ces céréales et ces tubercules sont utilisés dans la préparation des aliments stables. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il souhaite multiplier sa production  pour subvenir aux besoins de la population à la saison prochaine. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Atsu A. is 49 years old, married and father to one child. He lives as a farmer in Wome, a village situated around 112 kilometres from Kpaliné. He grows corn and manioc (cassava), etc which he then sells to the local people. These cereals and tubers are used to prepare food that does not need to be refrigerated. With this first loan from FECECAV, he would like to increase his production to be able to meet the needs of his customers next season. This will allow him to earn more money with which to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing corn and manioc (cassava)

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie louise D. is 32 years old ,married with two children with the following years old : 8 and 6 .
She lives in Gasabo district Kigali province capital of Rwanda where she owns a small shop for 10 years .
Marie louise starts her business everyday from 7h00 AM to 9h00PM.
Before this business Marie Louise was a full time hous wife;and she could not find all needs for her family.
With this new loan from Vision Finance Company she hopes to get more profit which will help her to feed her children to pay school fees for them and also to expand her business

loans.use: Purchasing more products for selling

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette dame est spécialisée dans la vente de boisson alcoolisée locale dénommée « sodabi » ; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1999 dans le quartier d’Agoè Démakpoè à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer. Elle s’approvisionne à Tsévié, ville située à quelques kilomètres de Lomé, ville qui possède l’une des meilleures boissons locales du pays. Beaucoup de ses clients apprécient énormément la qualité de sa boisson. Actuellement elle souhaite lancer une nouvelle commande ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 bidons de 25 litres de sodabi.
texts.en:
This woman is specialized in the sale of the local alcoholic drink called "sodabi". She started her business in 1999 in the neighborhood of Agoè Démakpoè in Lomé. She is married and the mother of 2 children. This business enables her to contribute ot her family's financial needs.

She supplies herself in Tsévié, a city located some kilometers from Lomé, which has one of the best local drinks in the country. Many of her customers appreciate enormously the quality of her drink. Currently, she wants to order more supplies; for this reason, she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES in order to buy 20 twenty-five liter cans of "sodabi".

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar A. is separated and the father of Aisha Anwar, who is three years old. He is employed as a truck driver with one of the leading truck companies in East and Central Africa. He is also a businessman dealing with food cereals. He purchases cereals from Uganda and transports them to Mombasa, where he sells them at a wholesale price to various cereal stores in the city. He has been in the business for nine years now.

Anwar A. was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by a friend. This is his first loan. With the loan, he intends to purchase cereals in Uganda to sell at wholesale prices to cereal stores in Mombasa.

His dream is to one day own his own truck.
 
About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase cereals from Uganda to sell in Mombasa

loans.name: Baasai

texts.en:
Baasai G. is 45 years old, and he lives with his wife and son in Hovd province in western Mongolia. His son, Enhbat, is 11 years old and attends a local secondary school. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.

With his wife's help, G. operates a coal-selling business in his town. Specifically, he purchases coal directly from local mines, and he transports the purchased coal (by using his large Russian truck) back to his town. His wife then helps him sell the coal to various local businesses and individuals for use in heating. G. has operated this business since 2000; by doing so, he has gained a great deal of experience over the years. He explains that he has a large customer base, including many loyal clients, and that he hopes to purchase a larger truck in the future to keep up with growing demand. In fact, he notes that his old Russian truck is outdated, and that individuals with newer, larger, more fuel-efficient trucks are able to generate higher earnings than he can, which is why he would like a new truck. In the meantime, though, G. is simply requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 tugrug (~$725 USD) to make necessary repairs to his truck and to purchase petrol so that he can transport more coal.

XacBank was founded in 2001 and listed its first Kiva loan in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but it also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale, and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the maturity of their loans. This practice not only allows borrowers to realize a financial gain, but also encourages them to save money

loans.use: To expand and improve his coal-selling business by making necessary repairs to his truck and by purchasing petrol

loans.name: Nouha

texts.en:
Nouha is a 41-year-old unmarried woman living with her mother and sister. Since 1995, she has owned a mini-market in her town where she sells items to people from her own village as well as from neighboring villages. She and her sister work hard, hoping to improve living conditions for themselves and their parents.

Today, Nouha is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to buy more merchandise for sale. With the increased sales, she expects to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 32 years old. He is married and has two children ages 1 and 17 years old. He also cares for two dependents from another family. Maurice's wife works, as well, selling clothing at a local store. She earns 30,000 RWF/month (approximately $US 60.00). The K. family lives in the Gasabo District, a region of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.  

Maurice opened a music studio and recording business just last year. He also sells musical instruments. Maurice is proud to be a self-employed businessman. The hours of his business require that he works from 8 AM to 6 PM every day except Sunday. He employs one person in his business as a helper.

Maurice is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by buying musical instruments to sell and buying a computer to compose and record music. Maurice hopes his customers will be pleased with these new offerings. With this loan, Maurice hopes he will be able to expand his young business into a thriving enterprise and continue to support his family and build a secure future for them.

loans.use: Musical instruments and a computer for producing/recording music.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Yankadi sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47ans, 4enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames  à Médine, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur sixième  prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles font la vente  du  bois de chauffe, des concentrées de tomates, des tomates fraîches,  des pagnes wax, real, des  condiments alimentaires etc.   
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, un chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, une dizaine de paniers de tomates, 15 pièces de pagnes wax – real et 5 paquets de divers condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché de Médine, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les  activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkadi group of the Yankadi association are essentially married women, with in average 4 children and 47 years of age. Most of them live in polygamous families in Médine, a city area of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Yiriwaso in order to be able satisfy their customers' demand. This is their sixth group loan and they fully repaid the previous ones. They sell wood for heating, concentrated tomato paste, fresh tomatoes, wax- and real-type pagnes (west African traditional clothes), condiments, etc. With this new loan they plan to buy a van load of wood for heating, a dozen baskets of tomatoes, 15 pieces of wax and real pagnes and 5 boxes of different condiments. They buy their supplies at the market of the city of Sikasso and in other neighbor villages. They sell to men and women at the market place in Médine, on the streets and door-to-door, for cash and often for credit. They plan to achieve an average individual monthly revenue of 30.500FCFA, and they will use a part for the family needs and the rest will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of different items to sell.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Rosmery es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Rosmery junto a su esposo tienen una vidrieria llamada Ross, que esta ubicada en la casa de su mama, cuenta con 2 personas que ayudan en la venta de los productos.
Rosmery necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de transporte de sus productos.
Los sueños de Rosmery son comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a member of the communal bank Amauta Huamanga. She is married, 32 years old, and has 2 children. She and her husband have a glass workshop called Ross that is located in her mother's house. They have 2 people who help with the sale of their products. Rosmery needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles that she will use to pay for the transportation of their products. Rosmery dreams of being able to buy land to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the transportation of their products

loans.name: Oumou

texts.en:
Ms. Oumou S., aged 57, has been a commercante (trader or vendor) for thirty years.  Since joining U-IMCEC in 2008, she has financed her small business with three loans.

In her thirty years of business she has sold a diverse array of products, traveling to neighboring Gambia and Mali to procure fabrics and other wares.  With her fourth loan, she will purchase a special incense produced in the holy city of Mecca.  As 95% of Senegalese are Muslims, the incense is in high demand.  She will cut the large blocks of incense into smaller pieces to sell for religious ceremonies.

Ms. S. is married and has four adult children.  She takes care of a grandchild while her mother works abroad.

loans.use: Buying incense

loans.name: Badiha

texts.en:
Badiha is a 37-year-old married woman with eight children of whom three are still going to school.

In 2005, Badiha decided to open a new business to help her husband to raise her eight children. She started working in clothing sales after seeing a need for such services in the region. She prepared a special room in her house for this purpose and started receiving clients.

Today, Badiha is grateful for her business and she needs to borrow $1,000 to expand her work by buying more clothes to make a bigger profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, tiene por actividad su salón de belleza muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma Ciudad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 40 años y no tiene hijos.

Irma viene dedicándose al negocio hace 15 años, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día se siente una mujer realizada. Nos cuenta que tiene clientela ya fidelizada que acuden diariamente a su salón de belleza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará productos para surtir su salón de belleza cómo: tinte, oxigente, shampoo, cremas, gorros térmicos, tijera, navajas, ganchos, entre otros y así brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Irma, supo salir adelante gracias su espíritu emprendedor que siempre lo caracterizo. Esta muy agradecida y feliz con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que lo desean.
texts.en:
Irma, tiene por actividad su salón de belleza muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma Ciudad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 40 años y no tiene hijos. Irma viene dedicándose al negocio hace 15 años, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día se siente una mujer realizada. Nos cuenta que tiene clientela ya fidelizada que acuden diariamente a su salón de belleza. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará productos para surtir su salón de belleza cómo: tinte, oxigente, shampoo, cremas, gorros térmicos, tijera, navajas, ganchos, entre otros y así brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Irma, supo salir adelante gracias su espíritu emprendedor que siempre lo caracterizo. Esta muy agradecida y feliz con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que lo desean.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará insumos para su salón de belleza.

loans.name: Omuralieva Jypargul`s Group

texts.ru:
Гулзада, 40, замужем. Ее супруг работает строителем в Москве. У нее 3 детей. Старшему 16, а младшему 12 лет. Все дети учаться в школе. Она занимается разведением и откормом скота. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 3 баранов, которые будут отправлены на пастбище. 

Жыпаргул молодая женщина, которой 27 лет. Она работает в школе учителем английского языка. Ее супруг работает таксистом, у нее 2 детей:дочь и сын. В школе клиент работает вот уже 3 год с момента окончания ВУЗа. Кредит будет использован для закупа пылесоса и стиральной машины для улучшения бытовых условий. 

Зарине 25 лет. Ее супруг также находится на заработках в России. Вместе с родителям супруга она занимается животноводством. Ежемесячная прибыль примерно равна 125 долларам, кроме этого ее супруг постоянно высылает деньги с России. Кредит нужен для закупа личных принадлежностей. 

Нурбек,39, женат. У него 3 детей. Его супруга работает в местной школе учительницей. Нурбек занимается растениеводством, выращиванием риса. Кредит нужен для оплаты весенних полевых работ, а именно для закупа семян риса. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulzada is 40 years old and married. Her husband works as construction worker in Moscow. She has 3 children. The oldest is 16, and the youngest is 12 years old. All of the children attend school. Gulzada is involved in breeding and fattening livestock. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of 3 sheep that will be sent off to a pasture. Jypargul is a young woman, who is 27 years old. She works as an English language teacher at a school. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and they have 2 children: a daughter and a son. Jypargul has been working at the school for three years, from the moment she finished a university. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of a vacuum cleaner and washing machine in order to improve household conditions. Zarina is 25 years old. Her husband also works in Russia. Zarina and her parents are involved in animal husbandry. The monthly profit equals to about 125 dollars, and besides, her husband always sends money home from Russia. She needs the loan for the purchase of personal goods. Nurbek is 39 years old and married. He has 3 children. His wife works as a teacher at a local school. Nurbek is involved in agriculture and grows rice. He needs the loan to pay for spring field work and specifically, for the purchase of rice seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 3 sheep

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
Es el crédito numero dos obtenido en CEPRODEL, con un historial crediticio limpio.
Es un pequeño productor pequeño de la zona de Potosí, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, la mano de obra es familiar (hijos),  este crédito lo utilizara para la siembra de sandia.
texts.en:
Es el crédito numero dos obtenido en CEPRODEL, con un historial crediticio limpio. Es un pequeño productor pequeño de la zona de Potosí, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, la mano de obra es familiar (hijos), este crédito lo utilizara para la siembra de sandia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: siembra de sandias

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
To earn a living, Mrs. Sieng P., 41, sells palm sugar in the market. She gets palm juice from her husband and boils it down to sugar for sale. She is married with six children, all of whom are unmarried and almost all are employed in the garment industry. Her husband is a palm climber who taps palm juice for her to boil. 

Sieng P. finds it hard traveling because she has no a vehicle. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to add to her small savings in order to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Enriqueta Juana

texts.es:
Enriqueta es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Enriqueta es soltera, tiene 45 años y 1 hijo, Enriqueta tiene una bodega llamada Multiservicios Keta, en donde vende abarrotes en general, licores, actividad que realizara todos los días, Enriqueta tiene proyectado viajar a distintos lugares en donde venderá mercería.
Enriqueta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas y mercería.
Enriqueta sueña con tener un negocio surtido.
texts.en:
Enriqueta, 45, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She's single and has a son. She has a store called "Multiservicios Keta" where she sells general groceries and liquor every day. She is planning to travel to various locations to sell merchandise. Enriqueta needs a 3000 sol loan to buy telephone service cards and general merchandise. Enriqueta dreams with having a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy telephone service cards and general merchandise.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Mrs. Tan N. is 31 years old. She earns about US$ 2 a day from raising pigs. Tan N. lives with two children who are enrolled school, in the commune of Kompong Tom, a province of Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Song, 34 years old, is a construction foreman. Tan N. requests a loan to be used as capital to begin investing in a fish-selling business. She hopes this will provide her with additional income.

loans.use: To start up a fish-selling business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina L. is from the village of Kiara, Don Carlos Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Marina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.
