Marina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Marina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Honestidad, Progreso Y Lealtad Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LUCY CONSUELO, HACE CINCO AÑOS ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO "HONESTIDAD, PROGRESO Y LEALTAD" FORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES TODOS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE COLLIQUE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
LA SRA. LUCY CONSUELO TIENE 49 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS, ES UNA FAMILIA EN LA CUAL TODOS SE APOYAN, SU ESPOSO LE BRINDA SU APOYO TANTO ECONÓMICO COMO MORAL EN TODOS LOS PROYECTOS QUE ELLA EMPRENDE.
HACE DOCE AÑOS ELLA APERTURÓ SU SALÓN DE BELLEZA DE NOMBRE "ESTÉTICA UNISEX LUCY`S", EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN SU DOMICILIO Y QUE LE FUÉ DE MUCHA AYUDA YA QUE TRABAJANDO EN SU CASA PUDO HACERSE CARGO PERSONALMENTE DE SUS HIJOS.
AHORA ADEMÁS DE SALÓN DE BELLEZA HA IMPLEMENTADO SU NEGOCIO CON UNA LIBRERÍA BAZAR EN EL CUAL TIENE A UNA PERSONA QUE LE APOYA EN LAS VENTAS.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO HA CONSEGUIDO ADQUIRIR 03 CARROS USADOS PARA TRABAJARLOS HACIENDO SERVICIO DE TAXI, HA CONSTRUIDO SU CASA Y HA PODIDO PAGAR LOS ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES DE SUS HIJOS LOGRANDO QUE SEAN PROFESIONALES. 
SU PRÓXIMA META ES POSER ADQUIRIR UN LOCAL PARA QUE SU ESPOSO PONGA SU TALLER DE MECÁNICA.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN PRODUCTOS COSMÉTICOS PARA LA ATENCIÓN DE SUS CLIENTES EN SU SALON DE BELLEZA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucy Consuelo has been a member of the Honesty, Progress and Loyalty Group for the past 5 years. The group is made up of 10 members, all residents of the Collique Zone in the Comas District. Mrs. Lucy Consuelo is 49 years old, married with 2 children. Hers is a family where everybody supports one another. Her husband supports all her projects both economically and emotionally. Two years ago, she opened her beauty salon called “Estetica Unisex Lucy’s”. It is located in her home which has helped her enormously as by working out of her home, she has been able to be raise her children herself. Now, in addition to the beauty salon, she has begun a bookstore business. She has hired somebody to help with sales. With this work, she has acquired three used cars which she uses in a taxi service. She has built her house and has been able to pay for the higher studies of her children in the hopes that they will have professional careers. Her next goal is to be able to acquire a location for her husband to have his mechanic shop. The loan that she is soliciting will be used to buy cosmetics for the purchase by the customers in her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for the purchase by the customers in her beauty salon

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa E. sells oranges, groundnuts, doughnuts and bananas at Elmina.  She has received a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She helps her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fruit for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Rose has a business of a restaurant, which she has had for two years. To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a fridge to sell cold drinks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and to educate her young sister. In the future, Rose hopes to own a house and to have a good life. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, giving Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy a fridge (for cold drinks)

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben C., 54, is married and lives with five of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband are silk weavers typically making about US$2 each day and are supported by one child working in the garment factory.

This family spends about US$35 on food, US$2 on utilities, US$15 on their children’s education, US$10 on transportation and US$20 on other expense. Ben C. would like to take a loan of US$800 to purchase more silk for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase more silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan P., 49, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jose P., an executive secretary, and is the mother of five children, one of whom is already working while one is currently enrolled in college; one is in high school and two are enrolled in the local elementary school. By the grace of God, Susan has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Susan, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

Susan is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Susan dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business.

Susan faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan C. is from the village of Malasin, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Susan is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Susan runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Susan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina M. is from the village of Natappian West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 55 years old, married and has 5 adult children. Marcelina owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marcelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tawopaneh II” group from Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesspeople seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu F., pictured on the left. Kadiatu is age 50 and was born in the village of Matobie. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. One of the children is in primary school and two are in secondary school. 

Kadiatu sells dried fish and has been doing this business for 25 years now. With this loan, Kadiatu is going to expand her fish business by buying baskets of dried fish to add to her current ones.

loans.use: To buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current ones

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a married man with two children aged 11 and 3.  He operates a retail shop for a living.  Addionally, he runs a cafeteria.  

Enock has been running his business for two years and he hopes to expand his business premise and introduce other products such as cosmetics and stationery.  As a result, he has requested a loan for 60,000 KES.  

He hopes to improve his living standards in the future.  In five years, he sees himself growing his business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy new products to expand retail business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is currently in the business of selling secondhand clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Mary is 30 years old and married; her husband is a driver. She has 3 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jorge Emilio

texts.es:
Jorge Emilio U. O. tiene 43 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y darles mejor nivel de vida a los hijos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Emilio U. O. is 43 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and four children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The V.R.C. EL BATAN co-op is 90 minutes away from the Chillanes Offices which belong to the Chillanes canton. The co-op is comprised of 21 members who has been actively involved for many years in short cycle crop farming of cocoa, yucca and corn.

Jorge has been growing cocoa, yucca and corn crops for a long time. He buys products in the Bucay canton and sells them at the Chillanes tradefair and in the canton.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural products and fertilizers for his cocoa crop. The loan will help finance the purchase of needed supplies to combat insect plagues, crop illness and weather variation. He dreams of contuining his work and improving his childrens' quality of life.

He enjoys taking walks with his family.

loans.use: Agricultural products and fertilizer for growing cocoa

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie D. J. is from the town of Banga. He is 35 years old. Jessie is single. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jessie also tills farm land where he plants and harvests rice crops. Jessie wishes to have his own family someday.

Jessie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy feeds, vitamins and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy feeds, vitamins and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Sao Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA. group of twenty people lives I. Snuol Khpos village, Takeo province. Mrs. Touch S. L. is the group's president, selected by the other members all of whom will use their portion of the loA. for a different purpose to improve their famiL.'s standard of living. 

Mrs. Touch S. L. is a weaver at her home and able to earn some money, while her husband, Mr. Phanna Buon, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice and sell to support his famiL.. Now her business is going well, so she wants to expand. For this purpose, she is seeking a loA. to buy more silk. She is a mother of two children who are students I. the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Aura

texts.es: Aura tiene 58 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años y medio vende  carne de cerdo frita a la que le llaman chicharrón, este plato  típico de su zona es uno de los más consumidos por los lugareños, quienes acuden a comprar una porción de ese platillo. Su negocio permanece toda la tarde hasta altas horas de la noche y al día siguiente, desde muy temprano nuevamente a comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus platillos. Durante estos largos de experiencia, ha logrado ganar experiencia y establecer su negocio y eso la anima a continuar adelante en la venta de sus comidas e implementar mejor su negocio. Es el crédito número 18 con MFP, se siente seguro de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá compra nuevas sillas y también algunos ingredientes, perecibles y no perecibles.
texts.en:
Aura is 58 years old and is a widow.  She owns her own house and lives with her two children.  For the past 20 years she has been selling a fried pork dish called chicharrón.  This is a traditional dish from her region and one of the most popular among the locals.  Her business is open every afternoon until late into the night.  Early the next day she goes out to buy the necessary ingredients to prepare her dishes.  She has gained a lot of experience during this long period of time and has established her business.  This inspires her to continue selling her food and improve her business.  

This is her 18th loan with MFP and she feels safe knowing that she has financial support.  She has always been responsible with her payments and is pleased to be a part of her communal bank as all the members are responsible and very unified.  She is grateful to all the people who will be involved in making this loan possible since it will be very useful in advancing her business.  With the loan she is requesting, she will be able to buy new chairs as well as perishable and nonperishable ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase perishable and nonperishable ingredients as well as new chairs for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Bonifacia

texts.es: Rosa Bonifacia tiene 60 años. Su actividad es la venta de recargas telefónicas, venta de cuajada y alquiler de sillas. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta mucho su trabajo. Ella dio inicio a su negocio porque tenía la necesidad de ofrecerles a sus hijos alimento y vestimenta ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo y conversar con nuevas personas, y al final de día termina agotada. Rosa solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos variados ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar frijoles, cuajada, leña, hielo entre otras cosas. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos puedan conseguir un trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa Bonifacia is 60 years old.  Her activity is telephone recharging card sales, cuajada (a custard-like sweet) sales and chair rentals.  She has been in this business for over 8 years.  She is a very enterprising woman who enjoys her work very much.

She started the business because she needed to provide food and clothing for her children.  She enjoys her work and chatting with new people.  At the end of the day she is exhausted.

Rosa is asking for this loan as working capital to buy various products that most of her customers are always looking for: beans, cuajada, firewood and ice, among others.  Her wish is to expand her business and that her children are able to find jobs.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en:
Enebish is 43 years old, married and has three children, ages 13 to 23. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver in the countryside. Her youngest daughter attends secondary school and her son attends college. Her oldest daughter works as a furniture store saleswoman. 

Enebish supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

She first began her business in 2000 and now she has 1,600,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital and 800,000 MNT in sewing equipment. She sells clothes imported from Ereen and her handmade clothes. She usually sews clothing with regular help from her family. She is planning to purchase clothing materials and sew many coats for spring during Mongolian Lunar New Year’s holidays because she has vacation for 15 days. She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase the clothing material.

Her business goal is to expand her business with this loan and be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To purchase material to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Amabo

texts.en: Amabo J. N. was born in 1942 and is married to Ngum Helen. They are blessed with eight children. Two of their children are below the age of 15. He occupies 7 rooms with his 8 children in the Ntagem quarter of Nkwen Bamenda, Cameroon. J. has faced a lot of problems in his life ranging from the death of his pigs and piglets, the inability to raise capital to start a business, and seizure of land by some kingmakers (local officials), just to name a few. Motivated by another member of GHAPE, he became a member in April 2003 and has successfully borrowed and repaid loans 5 times. Having been given another loan, he plans to purchase piglets and feed, firewood and fruit for retail. His business is going to help the people of his community by supplying them constantly and on a daily basis with pork meat. The local availability of firewood and fruit all the time will reduce the distance to the market by the people of his community. He is convinced that his business is going to be successful because he has experience in doing this business and the demand for firewood and pork meat is very high in his community. His business is located by the road side. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets, firewood, fruit, and pig feed

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian de 22 años de edad, soltero, docente, se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, trabajador, se dedica a impartir clases de educacion primaria a los niños de la comunidad donde él habita llamada paraiso en Nueva Guinea, ademas aprovecha su tiempo los fines de semana ayudando a sus padres a realizar actividades agricolas en la parcela que ellos tienen; actualmente su relacion sentimental no ha funcionado por lo que se encuentra solo, habita con sus padres a quienes les ayuda economicamente en lo que pueda, pero asume siempre sus gastos personales, es bien dedicado, es una persona admirable apesar de ser joven asume con gran responsabilidad sus compromisos de pago.  

Este joven ha sido beneficiado con Fondo Kiva con lo que pudo construir una habitacion en casa de sus padres, el cual agradece a Kiva  y a la vez solicita nuevamente el apoyo con otro financiemiento, pues pretende comprar un solar para construir su propia vivienda.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es construir su propia vivienda y seguir estudiendo.
texts.en:
Adrian is 22, single, and is a teacher.  He is characterized as a responsible and hardworking person who teaches elementary school in the community where he lives, which is called Paraiso, in Nueva Guinea.  In addition, he uses his time on the weekends to help his parents with their farming activities on a plot of land that they have.  Now, due to a relationship that didn't work out, he is single and is living with his parents, who he helps financially when he can.  He always covers their personal expenses; he is very dedicated, and is an admirable person.  In spite of his youth, he is a person who makes his payment commitments with great responsibility.

This young man has benefited a lot from his association with the Fondo and with Kiva, because he was able to build a room in his parent's house.  He is grateful to Kiva, and now he is requesting new support with another financing.  He plans to buy a solar of land (about half an acre) so that he can build his own house.

His main dream in life is to build his own home, and to continue his education.

loans.use: to buy land where he can build his own house

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
El negocio D. L. señora Maria Esmeralda D. L. R. es D. venta D. ropa nueva y usada, tiene ya mas D. ocho años dedicándose a este negocio.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa D. verano ya que sus clientes le están  pidiendo que tenga variada D. temporada. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte D. las ganancias del negocio, ya que es L. fuente D. ingresos que tiene para su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene tres hijo bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Esmeralda D. L. R.’s business is selling new and used clothing; she’s been in this business for over 8 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy summer clothes because her customers are asking her to have a varied selection of seasonal items available.

She’ll use part of the profits from the business to repay the loan since it’s the family’s source of income because she’s a single mother of three children in her care.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
Sự Trương Thị (20203050050) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 3 adult children. Sự owns & operates a food production and sales business, primarily selling pork products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, Sự joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sự has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.840.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase  some kitchen equipment to make her business more qualified to attract more customers to come. She is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to make improvements to her house.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sự Trương Thị (20203050050) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Sự Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Sự thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sự kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, Sự đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sự đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Sự dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  tu bổ nhà cửa của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase  some kitchen equipment

loans.name: El Tanque Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el tanque, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre puesto que así se llama su colonia, ya que ahí se encuentra un tanque de agua, es por eso que decidieron nombrar de esta manera a su grupo, esta historia es acerca de la señora Maricela Hernández S., ella cuenta con 27 años de edad, es casada, su esposo se lama Juan Carlos Bibiano quien es albañil, tienen 4 hijos, Juan Carlos, Alexander, Betzy y Jacqueline, de los cuales solo tres estudian, el mayor está cursando el quinto año de primaria, otro más en primer año también de primaria y el menor en segundo año de preescolar, ya que la más pequeña apenas tiene un año de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de donas y empanadas desde hace 5 años.
Doña Maricela se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para darles una muy buena educación de sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que hay ocasiones en que no tiene trabajo, ella invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas insumos como son: harina, azúcar, aceite, maicena, leche, huevos y leña, para así continuar con la elaboración de sus antojitos. 
El sueño que tiene doña Maricela es el de construir un horno ahí mismo en su casa para continuar con sus ventas, ya que tiene que ir a casa de su tía para preparar sus donas y empanadas, también quiere más adelante empezar a construir un local para poner una panadería, para así tenerla mucho mas surtida, y obtener más y mejores ingresos y con eso poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que tengan una muy buena carrera profesional.
Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho y su vida y la de su familia también cambiaran.
Las integrantes del grupo el tanque y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Ruth-venta de perfumes, María Elena-venta de ropa, maricela-venta de donas y empanadas, rogelia-venta de tamales, María Ruth-venta de ropa, Josefa-mercería, Marilú-venta de refrescos, rogaciana-fruteria, María Juana-venta de elotes y Guadalupe-venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
This group is called 'El Tanque' (The Tank).  The members of the group decided to give it this name because it is the name of the district where they live.  Their district has this name because there is a water tank there.

This story is about Maricela Hernández S. who is 27 years old and married.  Her husband is called Juan Carlos Bibiano and he is a construction worker.  They have four children: Juan Carlos, Alexander, Betzy and Jacqueline.  Only three of their children are in school.  Their eldest (son) is in his fifth year of elementary school, their second (son) is in his first year of elementary school and their youngest son is in his second year of pre-school.  Their youngest child (a daughter) is only one year old.

Maricela has been selling donuts and empanadas for 5 years.  She decided to start this business because she says that she was looking for a way to improve her own quality of life and that of her family.  She also wanted to provide her children with a very good education and support her husband with their household expenses since there are occasions when he doesn't have work.

Maricela invested her loan in buying more supplies such as flour, sugar, oil, cornstarch, milk, eggs and firewood so that she could continue making her snacks.  Maricela's dream is to build an oven in her home so that she can continue with her sales since she currently has to go to her aunt's home to make her donuts and empanadas.  She would also like, in the future, to build premises to set up a bakery so that she can have her business much better stocked and make more income and better income.  With this income she will be able to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can have a very good professional career.

Maricela is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the support of this loan that they have offered her since, thanks to the loan, her business will start to improve a lot and her own life, and that of her family, will also change.

The members of the El Tanque group and their businesses are as follows:
Ruth - selling perfume; María Elena - selling clothes; Maricela - selling donuts and empanadas; Rogelia - selling tamales; María Ruth - selling clothes; Josefa - selling sewing supplies; Marilú - selling soft drinks; Rogaciana - selling fruit; María Juana - selling corn on the cob and Guadalupe - selling snacks.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, oil, cornstarch, milk, eggs and firewood

loans.name: Carolina Yanira

texts.es:
Carolina, se dedica a la venta de meriendas, tortillas, empanadas, tiene ocho meses de dedicarse al negocio, su madre le ayudo para que tomara la decisión, ella vive con sus hijos quienes dependen de sus ingresos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para preparar las meriendas como: carnes, condimentos, verduras y lácteos, también comprar maíz, leña y utensilios de cocina. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su producción generando más ganancias.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, aumentando siempre su producción y el mejor servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Carolina sells snacks, tortillas, and breads. She has been in business for 8 months. Her mothers’ help her to make the decision. She lives with her children, all of whom depend on her income. 

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare snacks, such as: meats, condiments, vegetables, and dairy products. She will also purchase corn, firewood, and kitchen utensils. This investment will help her improve her production and to generate more income. 

Her objective is to maintain her business and to increase production to improve the level of services to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare snacks, such as: meats, condiments, vegetables, and dairy products.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He is an animal seller by profession .He will use the loan money to buy goats to raise and sell to butchers. He has been doing this business for the past five years and Perveen is very confident that her husband will be able to  increase his profits successfully after the loan investment.
 
Perveen herself is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. She has given birth to a seven-year-old daughter. She hasn’t started her education yet and stays with her mother at home. Perveen wants to send her to school after increasing her household income.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal-sales business

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya, who is 54 years old, is a humble villager living in Reussey Kao commune of Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Ya is married and blessed with six children, while her husband is a chief of construction who has a few laborers to assist him in the construction service. Mrs. Ya works with her husband in the same business. Recently, Mrs. Ya's husband has been very busy at his business due to there being many clients who need him to build houses for them. However, he is still lacking materials for construction. That is why Mrs. Ya has requested a loan as capital to buy extra construction materials.

loans.use: to buy extra construction materials.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is 55 years old, single, and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Antonia had not been blessed to marry. Antonia has been engaged in selling fish for 11 years now. She carries a pail of fish to sell in the street and house to house every morning, which is the only means of her subsistence. She earns PHP 4,800 per month in this business. Antonia requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from GDMPC to buy fish to sell. Antonia has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Antonia hopes to have a stall in the market to sell fish.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora Nilda. Ella se motivo en la idea D. producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando una visión D. que a través del comité estarían alcanzando un  nuevo progreso. Cada una
encantada aceptó conformar el comité al que denominaron KUÑA GUAPA.
El comité cuenta con 15 miembros, donD. todas ellas trabajan D. forma solidaria y responsable. Saben que por medio D. su esfuerzo podrán llegar muy lejos. Todas tienen la esperanza D. seguir luchando para salir adelante, buscando el progreso D. cada una D. ellas y la D. su comunidad.
La Sra. Maria C. es modista ya hace un buen tiempo, tiene una buena cantidad D. clientes. Por medio D. este oficio ella pueD. mantenerse y mantener su casa. Ella esta orgullosa D. lo que hace, y comenta que todo su sacrificio es por un futuro digno para ella y su familia.
Solicita el credito para la compra D. telas y kits D. agujas ademas D. hilos, los cuales utilizara en su labor.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Nilda. She got the idea to do something good for her partners, giving them a vision that through this committee they will reach a new level of progress. Each one accepted happily and maD. a group they called KUÑA GUAPA.

The group is maD. up of 15 members, all of whom work together and are responsible. They know that through their efforts they will be able to go far. They all have the hope of continuing to move forward, seeking progress for each one of them and their community. 

Maria has been a seamstress for some time and she has a good customer base. Through this work she is able to take care of herself and her home. She is proud of what she does and says that everything she sacrifices is for a worthy future for herself and her family.

She asks for a loan to buy fabric and needle kits, as wells as thread that she will use for her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a focused and ambitious 29-year-old business woman. She is married and does not have any children. For the last two years, she has been running a beauty salon in order to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to open several more locations. Her dream is to open up a beauty training school.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a blow dryer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has now become financially literate.

loans.use: to buy a blow dryer

loans.name: Will Alfredo

texts.es: Will Alfredo tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene cuatro hijos varones, dos de los cuales viven en Estados Unidos y tambien tiene una hija mujer que vive en su casa y se dedica a estudiar. Desde hace 13 años atras Don Will se dedica a la venta de repuestos y reparacion de motocicletas, aprendió este oficio gracias a un primo de él que tenia un taller y le permitió trabajar alli. Gracias a esa oportunidad, don Will aprendió muchas cosas y luego de un tiempo decidió aventurarse e instaló su propio taller, aunque no le fue nada facil ya que no contaba con ciertas herramientas y tenia que andar quitando prestado y a veces se las prestaban y otras veces no. Pero con la ayuda de Dios y el apoyo de su familia ha podido salir adelante y ha comprado las herramientas mas necesarias para desempeñar su trabajo. Actualmente uno de las dificultades que esta atravesando es que no todos los dias tiene trabajo. El prestamo que solicita don Will lo necesita para comprar repuestos como ser llantas, parrillas, aceite, grasa, cables, fricciones, etc. Espero que con el apoyo de este prestamo pueda surtir su negocio y asi ofrecer al cliente lo que el necesita. Su meta es mantenerse saludable porque mientras Dios le de vida y salud, él podrá seguir trabajando para sostener a su familia. Para él su familia es lo mas importante y mientras esten juntos cualquier obstaculos que se les presente podran vencerlo. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera poder con su compromiso de pago de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Will Alfredo, 43, is married and his wife devotes herself to the household. He has four male children, two of whom live in the United States, and also a daughter who lives at home and devotes herself to her studies. For 13 years Don Will has earned a living selling spare parts and repairing motorcycles. He learned this line of business thanks to a cousin of his who had a workshop and allowed him to work there. Thanks to that opportunity, Don Will learned many things, and after a time decided to make a go of it for himself and set up his own shop. It was not at all easy since he didn't have certain tools and had to go around asking to borrow them, and sometimes they would loan them out and sometimes they wouldn't. But with God's help and the support of his family he has been able to get ahead, and has bought the tools most necessary for carrying out his work. Currently one of the difficulties he is going through is that he doesn't have work every day. 

Don Will needs the loan he is seeking for buying spare parts such as tires, grills, oil, grease, cables, brake pads, etc. He hopes that the loan will help him stock his business so he can sell his customers what they need. His goal is to stay healthy because as long as God gives him life and health, he will be able to keep working to support his family. For him, his family is the most important thing, and as long as they are together, any obstacle that presents itself may be overcome. This is his first cycle with FAMA and he expects to comply with his commitment to make payments in a punctual way.

loans.use: to purchase parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson wants a loan to buy produce and to prepare land for cultivation. He is a Ugandan man, aged 53 years, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Jackson has six children and a wife. He has been operating a maize mill for 20 years and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Eduardo

texts.es:
Oscar de 44 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Oscar desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cabras y cerdos), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales de otras especies y alimento balanceado, para tenerlos bien alimentados y con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Oscar es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante y brindarle mejores oportunidades académicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
44-year-old Oscar lives with his wife and children in his own home which does not have basic services and is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

For some years, Oscar has been raising and selling farmyard animals (goats and pigs).  His pens are located behind his home and are suitable.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and natural fodder so that they achieve optimal growth.  This enables him to sell them in the different markets in his area and make good profits with which to cover his family expenses.

Oscar has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy different species of animals as well as balanced feed for them so that he can keep them well fed.  He will be able to use the profits he makes from selling his animals to repay his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  Oscar is a person who, through effort and hard work, has known how to get ahead and provide his children with better academic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy different species of animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 35 years old, married, and has six children. 

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Mary Joy has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from her business of buying and reselling used materials. 

Mary Joy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Nelida Neyda

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelida Neyda vive en la comunidad conocida como Esquilan Chico en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Nelida es soltera y no tiene ningún dependiente a su cargo. Nelida se dedica a la producción de leche cruda aproximadamente 30 litros diarios, esta producción la entrega a la Pil mediante el numero de socio de su hermana.
El siguiente crédito que solicita es para la compra de un tanque de leche enfriamiento (el tanque de enfriamiento es un deposito de leche cruda que se mantiene en buen estado, es de este tanque de donde recoge la Empresa Pil la leche todas las mañanas y todas las tardes) el cual en primer lugar tiene un costo aproximado de 16.000$us, es por esta razón que la compra la están haciendo conjunta con otras 15 personas de la misma comunidad poniendo 1000$us cada uno. Nelida desea que al tener el tanque de enfriamiento cerca de su casa pueda comprar en un futuro una acción de la Empresa Pil Andina y poder entregar leche cruda a su nombre y no al de su hermana.
texts.en:
Señora Nelida Neyda lives in the community known as Esquilan Chico in the city of Cochabamba.  Nelida is unmarried, and has no children.  Nelida works  producing raw milk, approximately 30 liters daily.  She delivers this production to the Pil Company, under her sister's membership.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a tank for cooling milk (the cooling tank is a place to keep raw milk in good state, and is how the Pil Company receives the milk every morning and evening).  This tank costs approximately $16,000, so for this reason she is making the purchase together with 15 other people in her community, who are putting in $1,000 each.

Nelida wants to able to have a cooling tank near her home, so that in the future she can buy a deed with the Pil Andina Company, and be able to deliver raw milk in her own name rather than that of her sister.

loans.use: to buy a cooling tank for raw milk together with other people.

loans.name: Joseliza

texts.en:
To make a living, Joseliza has been engaged in corn production for eight years. She is also engaged in a business selling different kinds of street food based in her home. She is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family from poor living. 

Joseliza is married to a farmer and has two school-aged children. According to her, through the income generated from her business, she had been able to give daily allowances to her children in school. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production

loans.name: Serah Wambui

texts.en:
Sarah has practiced farming in Nduyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 40 years old, married to Stephen Karanja, and they have four children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fifth loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In future, Sarah hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Milenka Yamile

texts.es: La señora Milenka es también socia integrante del banco de emprendimiento se dedica a la confección de overoles térmicos (panocas), buzos y chamarras deportivas, fundas para living y también cortinas, la actividad lo desarrolla en  el mismo domicilio vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  ella vive en la casa de sus papas, su esposo trabaja un una microempresa  como confeccionista de ropa  el crédito esta destinado a la compra de una maquina bordadora y compra de rollos de tela para la confección de  deportivos, panocas y fundas de living. Vive en la zona de Achachicala con su esposo y sus hijos,  mas adelante tienen planificado realizar la construcción de la casa de su Mamá en departamentos para tener mas espacio y así poder comprar mas maquinas de costura y otros para ampliar la variedad de confección de todo tipo de prendas.
texts.en: Señora Milenka is also an integral member of the communal bank. She makes thermal overalls (overcoats), sweat shirts and sports jackets, covers for living rooms and also curtains. She carries out this work in her own home where she lives with her husband and 2 children. She lives in her parents house. Her husband works in a small business making clothes. The loan will be used to buy an embroidering machine and bolts of fabric to make sports jackets, overcoats and living room covers. She lives in the Achachicala area with her husband and children. In the future they plan to build onto her mother's house in stages so as to have more room and thus buy more sewing machines and other types of machine to expand the range of clothes manufactured to include all types of garments.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Tichakunda Group

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Elizabeth from Harare. She is part of Tichakunda Group. She is married with six children. She also cares for two dependents who help her to run an agriculture business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge faced is that chicks are badly affected in poor weather. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of $400 to buy chicken feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family. In the future, she plans to increase the stock level of chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Njete Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njete SHG Group in Western Kenya! Janemary is the facilitator of the Njete SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janemary takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janemary had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janemary was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janemary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Janemary will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Njete SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Janemary and some of her members appear in the photograph but one member is absent.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 50 years old, married and has 13 children.

Nora owns & operates a business, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years experience in this business. Nora needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Nora joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Nora's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 32 years old and is single. She owns a canteen which she has run for three years. She would like a loan to buy fresh dairy, sugar, flasks, tables, and chairs in order to upgrade her canteen. Delphine will use any profits to start building a house. She would like to own a farm some day in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fresh dairy, sugar and flasks to sell.

loans.name: Naom

texts.en: Naom is 21 years old and single. She describes herself as a determined and focused woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a fast-growing place. She faces the challenge of insufficient funds. She will use the requested KES 10,000 loan to purchase more tomatoes. Her business goal is to run several tomato stores within the next 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes.

loans.name: Hemara

texts.en:
Hemara is forty-two years old and is married with three children.

Hemara owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Hemara needs a loan of WST 1,000 to invest in renovating the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Hemara joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Hemara's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business.

loans.name: Aljun

texts.en: Aljun is 26 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been with his business for over 3 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He has been with GDMPC since 2013 and is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to repair and purchase spare parts. He dreams to settle down and continue helping his parents.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor repair.

loans.name: Aleida

texts.en:
Aleida has a restaurant that is very popular in the local community. Prior to opening her business she held jobs in the city as an assistant for a dentist and at department stores. After she and her husband divorced, she decided to stay near her children and open a business from her home. She started off by just selling chicken wings, but as time passed she has been able to open a full fledged restaurant. The person who owns the home where she rents offered to rent her the home right next to it for her business. This has been great for Aleida who is raising two kids on her own. She runs the restaurant with the help of her mother, who always dreamed of having a business with her daughter. She is requesting the loan in order paint the place and invest utensils.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Paint her restaurant and invest in utensils and dishes

texts.en: S. is a 46 year-old mother of four children. She sells some snacks and beverages and she plans to use the loan to buy kerosene to sell. She could earn more income if many fisherman go to the sea. She hopes that she can earn more income for her childrens' education.

loans.use: Buy kerosene to expand her business

loans.name: Leonora Imojong

texts.en:
Leonora is a mother of eight children, some in primary and others in secondary school. She started her business in 2003 in order to supplement her husband’s income. Apart from fish, Leonora also sells maize and green vegetables. These she gets from the local farmers wholesale and sells them retail. She has gained quite a bit of experience in the business and she hopes to open a store in future.

Through her business, Leonora has been able to support her husband in educating their children and developing their farm, and she has brought services near to the community. With a loan from PEMCI, she plans to increase her fish and maize stocks and also be able to stock beans for sale.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods for sale

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu L. is fifty years old and the mother of six children. Although two of her children are now married, she works hard to see that the other four children go to school. Isatu’s husband works as a driver but his income cannot meet all the family expenses. Her business income supplements her husband’s salary and both are interested in seeing their children acquire a better education.  Marie is requesting a loan of $175 to expand her stock of utensils.

loans.use: Isatu would like to increase her business inventory for her utensil and kitchenware stand.

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya owns a little grocery kiosk in the busy central market in Nikopol, Ukraine. Lidiya started her business about ten years ago. She decided to sell groceries because it is a profitable area to be in. In a typical month, Lidiya makes around $600-$800 in profit. Her business has been characterized by stability and growth.

Lidiya has requested a loan to help her purchase additional inventory and make some needed repairs to her sales kiosk. Increasing her sales activity should lead to increased profits for Lidiya. She has an optimistic spirit as she looks to the future and works hard to do the best she can with her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and repair kiosk

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Mrs. Hang S., 27, is a mother of two little kids and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She works selling fruits at an open-air market, earning on average about $2 per day of profit, while her husband earns only meagre money from working as a solider. Mrs. Hang S. has recently requested a loan of $700 to build the rest of her house which is not completely done. She and her family are honestly appreciative of your trust and support.

loans.use: To build the rest of her house which is not completely done

loans.name: Yanet De

texts.es:
Yanet is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in her mother's house. She works as a secretary in the María Magdalena Postel school and also sells cosmetics, perfumes, and other items. She has quite a bit of experience in both of these occupations due to the time that she devotes to them. Her excellent attention to her clientele makes them loyal and consistent, which minimizes the risk of competition, of which there is a lot. Yanet needs this credit to supply her merchandise for the end of the year. Her credit record is good, and she doesn't have any current debts with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yanet es una señora de 34 años de edad, actualmente vive con su esposo y su hija en la casa de su madre. Ella trabaja como secretaria en el colegio Maria Magdalena Postel y paralelamente también vende cosméticos, perfumes y otros. Yanet tiene bastante experiencia en ambos rubros debido al tiempo al que le dedica a ambas actividades, su excelente atención a su clientela hace que los mismos sean leales y consecuentes, esto minimiza el riesgo de la competencia que es elevada. Yanet necesita el presente crédito para surtir su mercadería para fin de año. Sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos, actualmente no tiene deudas con otras instituciones financieras.

loans.use: Purchase of capital

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: Doña Leoncia is dedicated to selling fruit, which she does in many areas and in the local market in her city, where she has been able to get a small space. She sells fruit from the central jungle region.  She has always worked in a dedicated and hard way, however despite her efforts, she has not been able to attain her higher goal of buying a small house where she could live safely and calmly.  She is asking for assistance in order to grow her business and increase the quantity of products offered to the public, in order to eventually get enough savings to buy a house.  Don't forget that you can do a lot to help this woman!

loans.use: Increased capital to be able to increase the quantity of fruit offered and therefore increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of a fish sales business

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda A. M. raises and sells chickens in the town of Picota, San Martin. She started the business three years ago, because she wanted to help her family and her sick husband. Despite having no previous business experience, she worked hard, asked a lot of questions, and was able to develop a successful business. Now she sells hundreds of chickens every month.

Lucinda is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children. She says that she has never felt better and that her self-esteem is at an all time high. She is proud of her business and happy that she can save money for her children’s education.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Los Claveles, Lucinda is requesting a loan of s/ 1500.00 to be repaid over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken feed

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: S. Bayram is a 36 year old who keeps sheep on his farm in the region of Imishli. He breeds sheep to sell for meat. As mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people, Bayram believes this business will one day provide him with a good income. He is married and has three children. He tries very hard and spends most of his day looking for his herd. Now he has applied for a loan which he will use to purchase 20 sheep for an estimated cost of USD60 each.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Homid

texts.ru:
Homid Halmahmadovich B. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 25 and is married with one child. For over 3 years, Homid has been involved in animal husbandry. Homid purchases young bull calves, fattens them for 45 days and then resells them at the local market for a higher price. This business is the only source of income for his family. Currently Homid has plans to purchase 3 bull calves. After fattening them Homid would be able to sell the young bulls for a profit. He needs money to purchase the bull calves. That is why he has applied for a loan. He plans to pay the loan back in 5 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Бобокалонов Хомид Холмахмадович проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 25 лет, женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Хомид более 3 лет занимается животноводством. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Клиент покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков,откармливает их 45 дней и перепродает их на том же рынке по более выгодной цене. В данный момент клиент хочет купить 3 бычков и отправить их на пастбище. После чего он может их продать по высокой цене. Поэтому ему нужны деньги и он решил взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 5 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase bull calves

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lupita is married and is the mother of five children: two daughters who are 20 and 17 years of age and three sons who are 19, 18, and 10. She began her business selling fruit and vegetables 12 years ago in her home. Upon seeing that her business was growing, she decided to rent a shop dedicated exclusively to selling produce. In this manner, she has increased sales and now she wants to begin selling groceries which her customers have been requesting.

Now, she needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, so that she may purchase products and expand her business.With your help, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Lupita es casada y madre de 5 hijos 2 mujeres de 20 y 17 años y 3 varones de 19, 18 y 10. Empezó con su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 12 años en su casa, al ver que su negocio crecía cada vez mas, decidió rentar un local para dedicarlo exclusivamente a su frutería, es así como ha ido incrementando sus ventas y ahora quiere empezar a vender abarrotes ya que sus mismos clientes se lo han pedido.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprra abarrotes y expandir su negocio. con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Her children are currently in school. To support her husband, she sells cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. Janet considers this business to be very lucrative and therefore  needs a loan to expand her inventory and thus increase her sales and income. Janet is a member of the group called Isaiah whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 45 years old. She is married with four children, between the ages of 17 and 23. She has been a banana seller since 2004. Everyday, she works from 8 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Salome now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas to sell in her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina runs a small enterprise in a local market of Shidnitsya, Western Ukraine. She sells sportswear and underwear. Galina has been actively involved in this business for the past two and a half years. Currently, she has over $5000 in gross income.

Galina has an enterprising spirit. She is a thorough planner, very punctual and active. One of her long-term plans is to open another vending stand in the market. Galina believes a current increase of assorted merchandise will help her develop her trade consistently and move her one step further in her business progress. Galina is now requesting a 3000 Grivna loan.

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana Maria comenzó su negocio hace mas de 13 años al ver la crisis economica por la cual pasaba su familia, decidio iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidad ya que conociendo muy bien el negocio y la demanda de las comidas, sabia que tendria éxito si ofrecia un buen servicio y asi fue al lo largo del tiempo ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar articulos de cocina, con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Juana Maria started her business more than 13 years ago because of the economic crisis her family was going through. She decided to start her own business of selling food since she knows this business and the demand for food very well. She knew that she would be successful if she offered a good service, and through time, she has managed to get ahead with her business.

She needs a loan of $300, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase items for her kitchen. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for her kitchen

loans.name: Srey Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Yem T. is a villager in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. She is a tailor. She is requesting a loan so she can replace her old, wornout, sewing machine. This new equipment will enable her to accomplish more work in a shorter period of time and increase her earnings and living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Sim Sao, is a physician soldier. Mrs. Srey Yem is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailor business

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito- Puno, vive en el Jr. Asunción Nº 108, Tiene 37 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos que dependen de ella, culmino sus estudios superiores y tiene  una bodega  en la Plaza de Armas de Juli, donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, etc.
Ella empezó a trabajar haciendo todo tipo de negocios desde los 27 años, al inicio con el préstamo de S/. 300.00  nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro mas mercadería para su tienda.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles el que pagara en 4 meses, comprara: azúcar, arroz, leche, panteones, galletas, etc.

Marleny manifiesta que:” los créditos que brinda Manuela Ramos ayudan mucho y dan oportunidad para seguir trabajando”.

Su gran deseo es tener una pequeña empresa y abrir otras tiendas.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the Community Bank "Inmaculada Concepcion" (meaning, Immaculate Conception) located in the district of Juli, within the province of Chucuito-Puno. She lives in Jr. Asuncion No.108. She is 37 years old, is married and has two children that are still dependents. She completed her schooling and runs a convience store in La Plaza de Armas de Juli, where she sells groceries, softdrinks etc. She started working by taking on all kinds of businesses from the age of 27. At first she started out with a loan of S/.300 nuevos soles, increasing her capital and purchasing more merchandise for her store.

With this loan of S/.3000 neuvos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase: sugar, rice, milk, decorations, cookies, etc.

Marleny says that "the loans provided by Manuela Ramos [Kiva Field Partner] help a great deal and grant her the opportunity to keep on working."

Her greatest dreamis to have a small company and open more stores.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, pasta, decorations etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Nan Thoang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 18 people, is located in O’Kandol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Nan T. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is 44 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Nan T. sells pots in the local village. She is also a farmer who owns 0.5 hectare where she cultivates rice. She can earn only a little revenue from rice because her plot of land is small. In order to expand her rice revenue, Mrs. Nan T. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy another piece of land on which to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Kem Samart, is a fisherman who catches fish to support the family. 

All the members in this village bank loan will receive end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% overall, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy another piece of land on which to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Bisola

texts.en: Bisola is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). Bisola sells provisions, drinks, and bottled water. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell at her shop

loans.name: Loc

texts.vi:
Chị Đỗ Thị Lọc năm nay 38 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con đều đang tuổi đến trường. Chị tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn tại nhà còn chồng chị làm nghề say sát lúa. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho  gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Thi Loc is 38 yrs old. Her family has 2 children of school age. She joined TYM fund in 2004. Currently she raises pigs at home while her husband works in the rice-making business. These are the main sources of income for her family averaging 117 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to purchase additional pigs and feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Blanca Lilia

texts.es: La señora Blanca Lilia M. y su esposo  Antonio Ramirez quieren comprar una combi ya que la que tiene ya esta muy deteriorada y desean sustituirla por una mejor. Ellos se dedican al transporte escolar ellos transfieren a niños y jovenes de la casa a la escuela y viseversa tienen  varias escuelas que perciben de su servicio. Pero ahora quieren un prestamo para enganchar esa combi para ya que sin ella no podran trabajar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Lilia M. and her husband, Antonio Ramirez, want to purchase a van because the one tat they currently own is too run down, so they want to replace it with a better one. They are in the school transportation business, transporting students from their homes to school and vice versa. They provide these services ath several schools. However, they now need a loan so that they can give a down payment for another van because they will not be able to work without it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Down payment for a van

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Фируз житель города Яван. Возраст 23 года ,совсем недавно женился , поэтому детей не имеет и живет с родителями. Нигде не работает , а занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить породистого бычка , для получения потомства. Погасить кердит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Firuz A. lives in Yavan. He is 23 years, recently married, has no children and lives with his parents. He is unemployed, but is involved in animal husbandry. He raises cattle. Firuz plans to obtain this loan in order to buy a purebred bull to get offspring. He can repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a purebred bull

loans.name: Jane Kizito ‘S Group

texts.en: Jane is 42 years of age, married, and has 8 children between the ages of 8 and 22 years. Five of her children have finished school. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with nine people. She doesn’t have to take care of any additional family members. She has access to electricity but has no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day. Jane sells firewood near her home in Lugala, one of the city suburbs This is how she earns a living. She buys from delivery trucks at her place of work and doesn’t incur any additional transport costs. Jane receives about 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis.  She works seven days a week and rent for her business premises is ~US$10 per month. She has operated this business for seven years. She is now faced with the challenge of high transport costs and also the rainy season as she works from an open place. When it rains she doesn’t receive any customers.
