This is her 9th loan since joining MCDT. Jane has been with MCDT for 3 years, working with the same group mates. Jane wants to use this loan to buy more firewood. She aspires to start a poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy a truckload of firewood

loans.name: Nachaat

texts.en:
Nachaat is a 34-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Nachaat has been working as a car repairer for ten years. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools and car spare parts for his garage. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work. Nachaat is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started to work, he didn’t face any difficulty. Nachaat decided on doing this work because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and car spare parts for his garage.

loans.name: Sairanbi

texts.en:
Sairanbi is the widowed mother of two children. Her women’s shoes sales have been a valuable source of income for her family over the past four years since she’s been in business. In a typical month, Sairanbi makes about $400 in profit. Sairanbi is a hardworking, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has a good attitude and loves being able to help women with their shoe needs. Sairanbi has requested a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue to develop her business and provide a good income for her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new women's shoes for the summer season.

loans.name: Enier Oniel

texts.es: Enier Oniel es casado, de 24 años de edad, agente vendedor de Tienda El Verdugo, trabaja sin horario, pues tiene que visitar toda la region incluyendo San Carlos, Rio San Juan.  Su esposa Hellen Hernandez de 23 años trabaja en la Procuraduria de Derechos Humanos y lo apoya con los gastos del hogar, tiene un horario de Lunes a Viernes de 8 a 5 de la tarde, no tienen hijos, en su casa les apoya una tia.   Desea utilizar el credito para comprar materiales de construccion para una tapia y compra de protectores de puertas y ventanas para de esta manera dar un poco de seguridad a la vivienda y a la familia.  Ellos son una pareja de jovenes esforzados, pues quieren tener condiciones en el hogar para luego traer a los hijos.
texts.en:
Enier Oniel is married, 24 years old, and works as a salesman for the store El Verdugo. He does not have set hours and works throughout the region of San Carlos, Rio San Juan. His wife, Hellen Hernandez, is 23 years old and works in the Human Rights Attorney's Office and helps with the household expenses. She works Monday to Friday from 8 to 5 in the afternoon. They do not have children and take care of an aunt in their house. They would like to use the loan to purchase construction materials to build a wall and purchase protective covers for their windows and doors to provide extra security for their dwelling. They are a dedicated young couple who would like to have a safe dwelling to raise children in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a wall

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, aged from 8 to 14 years old. Monica is in the business of selling tomatoes – she buys the tomatoes in bulk and sells them at 'Oile', an outdoor market in Kisumu. Some of her customers operate hotels, which are like local restaurants.

Monica will use this loan to purchase more stock and to expand her business. She will use the money she makes to pay her children’s school fees for next term. Her hope for the future is to become a wholesaler, so that other people would buy products in bulk from her.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es:
el grupo Mujeres en Marcha tiene 3 integrantes de las cuales todas son mujeres, ellas son muy unidas y tienen vario tiempo de conocerse, las actividades que ellas realizan son las siguientes:

la sra. ROSA ELENA R. G. tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de nacatameles y hamburguesas, actividad que lleva a cabo los días jueves, viernes y sabados. las ventas en su 
mayoria las hace de manera ambulante, y otro parte en su casa de habitación.
Doña Rosa, es casada y madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos dependen a un 100% del matrimonio, su esposo trabaja para un aserradero donde se desempeña como soldador eléctrico,  alli mismo doña Rosa por medio de su esposo a logrado obtener la venta de su producto dentro de la empresa en donde el trabaja y muchos empleados que laboran en dicha empresa compran su producto.\

La Sra. Rosa R., opto por dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, ya que la situación economica para ellos no es favorable y los ingresos que obtenia su esposo no heran lo suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de hogar, ahora su condición de vida ha mejorado y con los ingresos que le genera su negocio ella aporta a su esposo a cubrir con ciertos gastos del hogar.

la sra. EDA VENTURA C. Z.  se dedica al comercio, tiene 1/2 año de haber iniciado con el negocio de pulpería misma que opera bojo el nombre de pulpería "KENSY" tiene su necogio en el lugar donde ellos reciden y a la vez donde esta ubicado su negocio es rentado ya que no poseen vivienda propia.- ella es casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañileria; ellos optaron por iniciar con este negocio ya que las personas que rentaban anteriormente en esa casa tenian el negocio de pulpería y ellos aprovecharon de inicar con el mismo ya que la clientela estaba formada, ellos tienen la visión de que con los ingresos que ambos generan para el hogar es construir su propia casa ya que 
por lo momentos solo poseen un terreno.

la sra. BLANCA LIDIA GONZALEZ tiene de estar trabajando en la sastreria 17 años en un momento nos pudo comentar que empezo vendiendo ropa americana  y cuando en el fardo le salia ropa muy grande (XXL en adelante) , ella se encargaba de arreglarla para poder venderla y así no perder en la compra del fardo de ropa. Doña, Blanca, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cameras de edredon y tela dacron.
ella compra la materia prima para la elaboración de las mismas, y en la colonia donde recide se le caracteriza por ser una persona, trabajadora, honesta y honrrada y de principios cristianos, tiene 19 años de residir en la Colonia.
las ventas  las realiza de manera ambulante y en varias ocaciones por encargos que le hacen sus clientes, mismos que son los empleados de una fabrica de tabacos lugar donde trabaja una de sus hijas y su hija se ha encargado de apoyarla buscandole clientes para la venta de las cameras.
Doña Blanca, es viuda y a ella sola le toco luchar para poder educar a sus hijos, mismo que ahora ya todos trabajan, y con los ingresos que a ella le genera su negocio cubre a un 100% sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres en Marcha” (Women on the Move) group has 3 members, all of which are women. They are very close and have known each other for a while. They work in the following: Eda Ventura Cáceres Z. works in grocery sales. A half a year ago she started a small grocery store, which operates under the name “Kensy”. She has her business in the house where they live, and at the same time the store is a rented location because they do not own their own house. She is married and her husband works as a mason. They decided to start this business because the people who previously rented the house had a small grocery store and they took advantage of that fact to start the same type of business since the client base was already there. They have the goal that with the income that they both generate they will build their own house. At this time they only have a piece of land. Rosa Elena R. G. has been working for 12 years making and selling tamales and hamburgers, which she does on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays. She sells most of them in the street, and the rest from her house. Rosa is married and the mother of three children who depend 100% on the couple. Her husband works at a sawmill where he does welding work. Through her husband, Rosa has managed to sell her product inside the business where he works, and many of the employees that work there buy her product. Rosa decided to do this type of work because their economic situation is not good and her husband’s income wasn’t enough to cover all of the household expenses. Their living conditions have improved with the income that her business generates. She gives money to her husband to cover some of the household expenses. Blanca Lidia Gonzalez has been working as a seamstress for 17 years. She started out by selling used American clothing and when a bale came with very large clothing (XXL and larger), she would fix the items so that she could sell them and not lose out on the bale of clothing. Blanca now makes and sells thick blankets made of Dacron fabric. She buys the materials for making them. In the neighborhood where she lives, people say she is hardworking, honest and honorable, and of Christian principles. She has lived in the neighborhood for 19 years. She makes her sales as a street vendor and sometimes by request from her customers. Her customers work in a tobacco factory where one of her daughters works. Her daughter has taken it upon herself to support her by finding customers to buy the blankets. Blanca is a widow and she was on her own to get her children educated. They are now all working. With the income that she generates from her business she covers 100% of her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread for hamburgers, ground beef, lettuce, tomatoes, corn, salsa, mayonnaise, banana leaves, sugar, shortening, rice, coffee, eggs, chicken, spaghetti, soft drinks, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells foodstuff at Atabadi near Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Mary has received no formal education.  She has been selling foodstuff since 2006. She is responsible for buying food for her home. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuff to increase sales and expand the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Cheyla Luz

texts.es:
La microempresaria Cheyla Luz Pérez Montalbán tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos mayores de edad, tiene desde hace 3 años una pulpería la cual esta ubicada en el barrio San Pedro de esta ciudad, anteriormente ayudaba a su mama quien también tiene una pulpería, pero desde hace 3 años decidió independizarse económicamente administrando su propio negocio.

La microempresaria Cheyla conoció a través de su mama Norma Amador (Quien a sido beneficiada con dos crédito de Kiva) que se realizan estos prestamos los cuales a ella le han ayudado, por tal razón es que Cheyla Pérez esta solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos:

3 Quintales de Arroz americano el cual compra  US 45 cada quintal, 3 quintales de azúcar el cual compra  US 35 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite que compra a US 29 cada bidón, 80 libras de pollo la compra a US 1.70 cada libra, 80 libras de Carne de res la compra a US 1.80 cada libra, 3 cajillas de Huevos compra a US 5 cada cajilla, 30 sacos de carbón a US 3 cada saco y 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a US 8.50 cada bolsón.
texts.en:
Small-business owner Cheyla Luz Pérez Montalbán is 51 years old and is a single mother with 3 grown children. For 3 years she has had a small grocery store located in the San Pedro neighborhood of this city. Prior to that, she helped her mother, who also has a small grocery store. Three years ago she decided to become financially independent by running her own business. Cheyla learned through her mother, Norma Amador (who has received two loans through Kiva), that these loans exist and they have been helpful to her mother. So, Cheyla Pérez is requesting a loan to buy the following products: Three 100-pound sacks of American rice, which cost $45.00 each; three 100-pound sacks of sugar, which she can buy for $35.00 per sack; 2 drums of cooking oil, which cost $29.00 each; 80 pounds of chicken, which costs $1.70 per pound; 80 pounds of beef, which she buys at $1.80 per pound; 3 crates of eggs at $5.00 per crate; 30 sacks of charcoal, which cost $3.00 per sack; and 2 large bags of toilet paper at $8.50 per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, beef, eggs, charcoal, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama T., a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Leusoalii, is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Miriama owns and operates a general store whose main source of income comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in this business for over five years, she earns approximately 450 WST a month.

In 2008, Miriama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Miriama is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from SPBD, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mnyanzi

texts.en:
Mnyanzi D. is married and is aged 25 years. She lives in Bamburi, Mombasa with her husband Salim Alfhan who works in a hotel in the area. Mnyanzi runs a grocery store and has been in the business for a year now. 

This is her first loan for her business from any lending organization. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET, Mnyanzi plans to buy more groceries in order to satisfy the needs of her customers.

She hopes to establish a permanent structure of her own and to be a major supplier of groceries to households in Bamburi. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke “

loans.use: To purchase groceries and to expand her enterprise.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is married and has five dependants. She has received junior high school education.  Margaret sells maize, at Elmina near Ankanfu, which she has doing since 1993. Her husband is a driver and she was out of stock when she was visited. These are some of the sacks she used in selling her maize. Margaret uses her income to support the husband in the paying of bills and school fees.  Margaret will use the loan to purchase more maize for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to save to build her own house.

loans.use: Margaret will use the loan to purchase more maize for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 32-year-old married mother of two daughters. She has run a boutique selling new clothes for five years. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to purchase a new stock of clothing. In the future, she hopes to increase her family’s living standards and purchase a plot of land on which to build a home and a permanent business place. She describes herself as hardworking and says that since became a member of Faulu she has learned better savings skills.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Chhoeun S., 28, is a widow and resides with her young child and her mother in Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker who is able to make about US$3 per day, while her mother is a weaver and makes US$4 per day. Chin Sokoeun would like to take out a loan of US$500 to raise cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Ayapaw

texts.en: Ayapaw A. is currently in the business of selling rice and sugar in the market and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of sugar and rice to sell. Ayapaw is 35 years old and is married. She has 6 children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a supermarket. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar and rice

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years old and married with three children, who are all attending school. Her husband is in the armed forces and she runs a green grocer in the Embakasi area of Nairobi. She's been in business for two years and has one employee. She also earns some income from tailoring. She describes herself as hardworking and requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 to buy children's clothing to sell.

In the future, she hopes to be able to employ others and provide a quality education for her children through university. In her business she would like to expand into wholesale supply.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: M. Louise est née en 1984 et vit depuis 25 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DANSOU Jean, un pêcheur, Louise est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Louise a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Louise vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. C’est principalement le mari de Louise qui assure les charges de la famille. Cependant, Louise utilise les revenus supplémentaires issus de son activité pour venir en aide à son mari. Louise n’a pas été à l’école. Il y a environs 10 ans que Louise vend de « Akpan » (bouillie locale faite à base d’amidon de maïs) à son domicile. A côté de cette activité, Louise vend également du charbon de bois en détail, qu'elle attache dans des sachets. Louise est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les trois premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenus de ALIDé. Louise sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
M. Louise was born in 1984 and for the past 25 years she lived in Fiégnon à Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Dansou Jean, a fisherman. Louise is the mother of 3 children, all of whom attend school. Louise also has another child in her care, in addition to her own children. Louise lives with her children and her husband. It is principally Louise's husband who takes care of the needs of the family. Nevertheless, Louise uses the additional income earned from her business in order to help her husband support their family. Louise did not attend school. For about ten years, Louise has sold "Akpan" (a local porridge made from corn starch) from her home. In addition to this business, Louise sells charcoal at retail prices and sells them in bags. Louise is an old customer of ALIDé, and she has fully repaid the 3 loans she has obtained from ALIDé. Louise is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, in order to increase her stock of products and better handle the requests of her clientele.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and charcoal

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok R. is 47 years old and resides in Kampong Chhnang province. She was not available for the photo, so her husband is shown instead.

Hok R. owns and operates a small handicraft business in which the main activity is making traditional clay stoves. She buys clay from people who live near the mountain and turns them into many sets of stoves at her home.

Hok R. also relies on the income from her husband who works in construction. The couple was married years ago and is blessed with three children: one is married and has ready started a new home while other two are single.

Hok R. has been building a new home for a few months but the construction is suspended due to the lack of equipment. In order to continue building her house, she requested a loan to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To buy articles required for housebuilding

loans.name: Sokhna Amy

texts.en:
Ms. Sokhna Amy S. is a young entrepreneur from the Cité Senghor neighborhood of Thies, a city located about 70 km from the bustling city of Dakar.  

She reports she has been a commercante (trader) for about five years, selling guedia (dried fish), yett (a small shell-fish) and tir (palm oil).  She also purchases fabrics for her husband to embroider which she then sells to her customers.  She runs her business out of her home and enjoys working with her husband.  She will use her loan to purchase both seafood and fabrics.

The couple has three children aged four months, four and eight.  Ms. S. and her husband also take care of their nephew who lives with them.  This is the first loan for Ms. S..

loans.use: Purchase seafood and fabrics

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda A. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Merlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store selling ready to wear items like shirts , shoes, and pants in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fatullo

texts.en:
Fatullo is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is married and has three children. 

Fatullo works in the central city market selling blankets, towels and tablecloths. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for fifteen years. Fatullo likes working for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. 

Today Fatullo would like to ask for a loan of $1500 to purchase new goods for selling. We believe his drive for success will help him succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Fatullo’s business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase blankets, towels and tablecloths for selling.

loans.name: Josefina De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Señora Josefina de los Ángeles J. R. es cliente del mercado central, ubicado su negocio a una cuadra aledaña del mercadòn su puesto es venta de electrodomésticos para el hogar, relojes.
La señora J. R. tiene tres hijos en edad escolar por los cuales ella lucha para sacarlos adelante su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 15,000.00 aporte de su esposo tiene de estar en el mercado 15 años.
La señora J. R. tiene cuatro años de trabajar con nuestra institución y según ella se siente bien agradecida ya que su negocio ha incrementado y sus condiciones de vida han mejorado. Su esposo le ayuda a administrar su negocio y sus hijas también le ayudan a vender a veces la señora J. tiene que salir a vender a los ingenios y sus hijas quedan al mando de su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina de los Ángeles J. R. is a client who works in the central market. Her business is located in the section of the market that sells home appliances and watches. Sra. J. R. has three school age children for whom she strives to get ahead. She started her business with capital worth 15,000 NIO. Sra. J. R. has the support of her husband and has been working in the market for 15 years.

She has been working four years with our Institution. According to her, she feels grateful that her business has increased and her living conditions have improved. Her husband helps with managing her business and her children also help occasionally with making sales. Whenever Sra. J. R. leaves to make deliveries, her daughters are in charge of looking after her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her home appliance business

loans.name: Félix Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Félix Antonio O. N., tiene la edad de 42 años, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa es comerciante, y se apoyan económicamente para los gastos del hogar, tienen 4 hijos pequeños, él se dedica a la albañilería.

Dentro de las metas para la familia está la culminación de la construcción de su hogar, es por esta razón que el solicita de un préstamo para envergar el frente de su casa y brindarle una mayor seguridad a toda su familia, debido aquí ellos viven en un barrio en donde los índices de delincuencia son altos y amenazan a la población  que ahí habita, espera se le brinde un apoyo económico, tal y como lo han hecho en los años anteriores.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Antonio O. N. is 42 years old and lives in Barrio Laureles Sur. He is married, his wife is a merchant and they support each other economically with the family expenses. They have 4 young children. He is a construction worker.

One of the family's goals is finish building their home, for that reason he requests a loan to put up a wall in front of his house for more security for the entire family as they live in a neighborhood with high crime rate and the people living there are threatened. He hopes to receive economical support as in previous years.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Ecelia

texts.en:
Ecelia P. runs a small piggery. Aside from pigs, she also maintains a small rice field in Banga, South Cotabato. She has applied for a loan to be able to support the needs of her business such as piglets, feed and labor.

Ecelia has three children and her eldest child is 22. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. which she will use to buy farm supplies and piglets.

Ecelia chose CEVI because it has micro-insurance coverage on her as a client and on her family members.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is unmarried. He is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Alexander sells lamps and batteries wholesale. He works in one of the largest city markets called "Angolenko". Some of the biggest attractions of his small venture are competitive prices and the variety of products in his storage depots. Alexander has been in this trade for 1.5 years. 

Currently, Alexander has about 50,000-60,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. One of his plans is to expand his business and reach out to clientele in the whole Zaporozhye region.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Kyenda Abavubuka Group, Mubende

texts.en:
M. Ssula, a pharmacist, aged 34 years, is hardworking and determined to transform his business and his status as long as he still lives. The married father of two children, with other dependents from his late brother, has been running a clinic and a drug shop of human medicine from Kyenda Trading Centre in Mubende District for close to eight years. From this he has been able to educate his children who are still undergoing tuition at different institutions of learning.

With this loan, Ssula is very optimistic about restocking his business with more drugs and looking forward to turning it into a big pharmacy. This will enable him to earn more revenue and also be able to sustain his family’s requirements.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for his clinic

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is a married woman who lives in the Kanggapas zone of barangay Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fish vending and sugarcane field businesses. Her husband Wilfredo S. Sr., who is 59 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have 10 children who are all between 14 and 34 years old. 

Evangeline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evangeline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000 - uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use to buy fishing gear and stocks for the general store so that she can continue to save up for their future and do home repairs. Evangeline S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Yafar

texts.es:
El señor Yafar, Abogado de profesión, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Yafar es administrador de un restaurante de los cuales obtiene sus ingresos.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción del techo del restaurante para mejorar  su calidad de trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Yafar is a lawyer by profession. He is single and lives with his parent in the Alto Obrajes area of La Paz. Yafar manages a restaurant, which earns him income. The solicited loan is for the refurbishment of the restaurant's roof. It will improve the quality of his work and allow increased revenue. This is the second time Yafar is asking for a loan. He was graded favorably by a socioeconomic analysis done graded him favorably, which gives him access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof refurbishment

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
En Yaguarón, se reunieron unas mujeres con el objetivo de  aumentar su capital de trabajo y para emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinaron la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, a quienes les pareció interesante por ser una  oportunidad crediticia muy buena.
El comité lleva por nombre Tajy Poty actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, integrada por 18  luchadoras señoras, quienes se esmeran días tras días para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son muy trabajadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de ellas es la integrantes es la señora Juana quien tiene como actividad para generar ingresos un negocio donde vende artículos generales para la casa.
Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad por la antigüedad de su negocio y mediante una buena administración va creciendo y actualmente tiene gran cantidad de cliente.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra enlatados, artículos de limpieza, ferretería, librería, farmacia.
texts.en:
In Yaguarón some women got together with the goal of increasing their working capital and undertaking business activities. They went on to plan a meeting in order to learn more about the loan program, as it seemed interesting and a good opportunity for obtaining credit. The committee is called Tajy Poty and is currently in its second cycle. Its members comprise 18 dedicated women who outdo themselves day after day to increase their earnings and thus offer the best to their respective families. All the members are very hardworking and have invested their loan monies in their respective businesses. One of the members is Juana who has as her business the sale of general items for the home. She has a lot of experience due to the length of time she has had the business. Through her good management her business is growing and she now has a large customer base. The loan is requested for purchasing canned goods, cleaning supplies, hardware items, books and pharmaceuticals.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, cleaning supplies, hardware items, books, pharmaceuticals, fresh produce and flour for retail sale

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia M. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Anesia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anesia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies like banana and sweet potato cues in the local community. Anesia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anesia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anesia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Anesia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients needed & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anesia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients needed & provide working capital

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala A. is 43 and married with 7 children.  She owns a business venture planting, harvesting and selling taamu.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  

In 2009, Kalala joined SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Kalala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  She has had 1 previous loan with this organization, and is asking for a new loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en:
Buenafe M. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old and married. To make a living, Buenafe owns and operates a  sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Buenafe has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Buenafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buenafe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her shop. This loan will be the first taken out by Buenafe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her shop

loans.name: Mrs. Prum Phal Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum P., 48, is the village bank president selected by 13 people who make up this village bank located in Thnal Bat village in Takeo province. They will use their loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Prum P. and her husband, Mr. Touch Long, are farmers who own a 0.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice for their family's use. She is also a Khmer cake maker, while her husband sells coffee in their village. She has a problem because she does not have enough Khmer cake supplies to use. So, to improve this situation, Mrs. Prum P. is applying for a loan to buy more Khmer cake supplies to use. She is the mother of two children who are both security guards at a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cake supplies to use

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar N. is a 39 year old single man who lives with his mother, father and brother in Tuv province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His parents are both retired, while his brother works in the folksong and dance ensemble of Military as a singer. 

Enhbaatar uses a large van, or micro bus, to transport people within Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. He started driving in 1992. Since 2003, he has been transporting people by his micro-bus. He has found success with his business and has gained much experience as a driver over the years. His earnings have enabled him not only to improve his family's standard of living but also to purchase a new small car for his father. 

Enhbaatar is a very honest and hardworking person. For the future he hopes to continue to provide a quality and efficient transportation service. He is planning to purchase a new, good quality micro bus after selling his previous mini bus. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to upgrade his current mini bus.

loans.use: To upgrade his current mini bus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase drinks and ingredients.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a married father with a five-year-old child. Yuryi makes and sells ceremonial items in his home town. He has been in this business for six years. His turnover capital is about 30,000 Grivnas and his net profit exceeds 5,000 Grivnas a month. One of the specific characteristics of his business is a high turnaround of inventory.

Yuryi is very focused and determined. He is grateful for the loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”, which have helped the expansion of his business. This time, Yuryi is requesting a loan of 11,000 Grivnas to purchase additional raw materials to manufacture funeral wreaths, e.g. fake flowers, wire and ribbons. The loan will be beneficial for Yuryi’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth so it will continue to provide necessary income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for funeral wreaths

loans.name: Sveta's Group

texts.en:
Sveta N. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok. Sveta by herself has raised two daughters. Both daughters are married and live separately with their families.

Sveta makes money running her own business selling potatoes. Five years ago together with her friends, this businesslike woman decided to increase her welfare, and out of her profits she has managed to obtain an apartment. Further she intends to purchase a container and to make house repairs. In order to maintain and multiply her income, Sveta wants to increase the turnover of her business and for this purpose she hopes to obtain a loan.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Estrellas Del Carmen Group

texts.es: El  grupo se llama ESTRELLAS DEL CARMEN se encuentra ubicado en El carmen en el Estado de México. Está conformado por 12 integrantes entre ellas está la Sra Ana T. B., ella tiene 41 años de edad, lleva  25 años de casada y tiene 9 hijos 5 mujeres y 4 hombres ya todos se casaron. Ella se dedica a vender artículos de limpieza desde hace 8 años, comenta que decidió iniciar su negocio porque los ingresos de su esposo muchas veces no le alcanzaban para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos.Aunque sus hijos no dependen economicamente de ella lo que ella pretende es ahorrar para su vejez y asi poder contratar una persona que se haga cargo del negocio y asi poder descansar y poder tener una vejez tranquila Con los prestamos ella puede comprar por mayoreo y asi obtiene mejores precios y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Estrellas del Carmen' (Stars of El Carmen) and is located in El Carmen, in the State of Mexico.  The group has 12 members.  One of the members is Mrs Ana T. B. who is 41 years old.  She has been married for 25 years and has 9 children; 5 daughters and 4 sons, all of whom are now married.

Ana has been selling cleaning products for 8 years.  She comments that she decided to set up her business because her husband's income often didn't cover their family's needs.  Although her children are no longer financially dependent on her she would like to save for her old age and be able to hire somebody who will take care of her business so that she can relax and enjoy a quiet old age.  She will use her loan to buy her products wholesale so that she can get a better price and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products to help her business grow

loans.name: Ndakisa Plus Group

texts.en:
“Ndakisa Plus” is a group of 12 owners of small businesses chaired by Thérèse. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Thérèse sells rice in détail. She started her business in 1984. She is a hard working woman that has demonstrated some capabilities in business, such as organisation and good management. Thérèse is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. Thérèse is planning with the next loan to increase the stock of her goods by buying some sacks of rice in order to meet the high demand of her customers in her community. She is confident with her business. She knows how to attract her customers by offering what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks with her clients. Thérèse’s medium term plan is to buy a freezer in order to diversify her business and start selling soft drinks. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of seven children between the ages of 12 and 25 years old, two of whom attend school.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for resale

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yuon H. (in the photo) is 50 years old. Her husband, Mr. Ko San, is 52 years old. They have been married since 1986 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One is a garment-factory worker, another one is a construction worker and the other two are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Yuon sells steamed potatoes in Prek Pnao market. Her husband assists his wife in the business. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to connect with her motorbike to carry steamed potatoes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to connect with her motorbike to carry steamed potatoes for sale

loans.name: Jaime Humberto

texts.es:
Aunque Jaime Humberto R. Z. trabaja como mayordomo en una finca, este emprendedor no deja de soñar con su propio negocio de cría de vacas para lechería, pues actualmente en el lugar donde trabaja le permiten tener 2, de las cuales saca la leche para venderla a la empresa recolectora y así aumentar sus ingresos. 

Con el fin de continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, conformada por su esposa y su hija de 4 años, Jaime necesita de un préstamo para la compra de 2 vacas, las cuales se convertirán en productoras de leche y serán fuente de sustento para este emprendedor.
texts.en:
Even though he works as a groundskeeper on a farm, Jaime Humberto R. Z. is an entrepreneur who keeps dreaming about his own business raising dairy cows. He currently has his own place that allows him to work twice as hard. His business produces milk that he sells to a collection company so that he can increase his income.

In order to continue his business and improve the quality of life of his family (which consists of his wife and four year old daughter), Jaime needs a loan to buy two cows. These animals will be used to produce milk and become a source of income for this entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es:
Doña Silvia, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, tiene 45 años D. edad, y vive con su esposo, hijos y nietos, se dedica a la venta D. merienda y tortillas, este oficio lo desempeña desD. hace 13 años, cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijas, ya que este negocio les ha dado por años lo necesario para el hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales para preparar las meriendas y maíz para preparar las tortillas, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener disponible productos que le permitan preparar alimentos para los clientes, atendiéndoles D. una manera eficiente.
Sueña con tener un negocio amplio, capaz D. agradar y mantener a la clientela por un largo tiempo, además D. generar ingresos para subsistir con su familia que son su apoyo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia is 45 years old and lives with her husband, children and grandchildren in Jiquilisco, Department of Usulutan. She sells foods and tortillas and has been doing it for 13 years. Her daughters help her and this work has given them the means needed to cover their home expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare the foods and corn for the tortillas. This loan would allow her to have the ingredients necessary to serve the costumers in a more efficient way. She dreams with having a larger business that would satisfy her costumers for a long time and generate enough income to proviD. for her family who helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare meals and tortillas

loans.name: Bambang
loans.use: To buy new spare parts

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony T. is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old. Leony is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $63 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Leony joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yisell

texts.es:
Yisell  Elena A. P. es una joven mujer que vive con su cónyuge en la ciudad de Barranquilla y reconoce el impacto  de su trabajo en la proyección  personal y profesional, pues cada día se hace mas necesario resaltar su imagen, para funcionar en los diferentes campos sociales; ella es estilista y tiene una sala de belleza donde ofrece servicios de masajes, arreglo de cabello,  tintes , manicure y pedicure, oficio que aprendió cuando después de haber trabajado como supervisora, decidió generar ingresos independientes, para atender también mientras genera ingresos, su condición de cónyuge y madre de dos hijos,  hoy en las edades de 3 y 5 años. 
Yisell inició su actividad de manicurista y gradualmente ha desarrollado su experiencia en todas las líneas de trabajo aprendidas cuando estudió el arte de hacer belleza,  oficio que aun sigue ejerciendo y actualizándose permanentemente en todo lo que impone la modernidad.  Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará un secador, una plancha, champoo, masajes, aliceres, tintes y esmaltes, ella proyecta que sea esta una inversión exitosa, por que logrará fortalecer su capital de trabajo, ya que ha promocionado sus servicios y cada día hay mas personas que acceden a sus paquetes de ofertas, por lo cual debe estar lista para servirles como solo ella siente que sabe hacerlo.
texts.en:
Yisell Elena A. P. is a young woman who lives with her partner in the city of Barranquilla and recognizes the impact of her job on her personal and professional image.  Every day it becomes more necessary to revamp her image, in order to work in different social circles.  She is a stylist and has a beauty salon where she offers services of massage, hair styling, hair dyes, manicure and pedicure.  She learned the trade when, after working as a supervisor, she decided to earn her own income.  While earning money, she also wanted to be able to fulfill her role as a partner and mother of two children, who are currently 3 and 5 years old.

Yisell began as a manicurist and has gradually developed experience in all of the lines of work, which she learned while studying the art of beautification.  She continues in this role as student, always keeping herself current with the latest modernizations.   This is her second loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy a dryer, an iron, shampoo, massages, straighteners, dyes and nail polish.   She believes that this will be a successful investment with which she will be able to strengthen her business capital, since she has already been promoting her services. Every day she has more clients taking advantage of her package offers, so she must be ready to serve them in the way that she feels only she can do.

loans.use: to buy a dryer, an iron, shampoo, massages, straighteners, dyes and nail polish

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
José de 51 años, un hombre trabajador que empezó su negocio desde ya hace 30 años con una mesa vendiendo  bebidas con 30 sucres de inversión con el tiempo iba aumentando su producción. Está casado con Juana Zapata y tienen dos hijos.

En la actualidad trabaja de miércoles a domingos  vendiendo batidos y mariscos su esposa lo ayuda en las ventas desde las 8h00am a 6:00pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas, implementos para el negocio. El señor desea tener un negocio más grande y con muchos clientes, formalizar mas su negocio de marisco en cuanto al hogar quiere seguir construyendo su vivienda para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
José, 51 years old, is a hardworking man who started his business 30 years ago now, investing 30 sucres in setting up a table to sell drinks to people. Over the years, he's increased his production. He and his wife, Juana Zapata, have two children.

He works from Wednesday to Sunday selling smoothies and shellfish. His wife helps him in the business from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. He intends to use the loan to purchase fruit and other supplies for his stand. He'd like to expand his business and client base, and set up his shellfish business more formally. He'd also like to keep working on building his home so he can provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and other supplies for his business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 55 years old.  She is married and has 3 children who are in school.  Catalina is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She has a bamboo trading business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  

Catalina has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell.  In the future, she would like to renovate her family home and save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college..

loans.use: purchase more bamboo to sell

loans.name: 09077 Group

texts.es:
Las Positivas es un grupo conformado por siete integrantes, personas muy empeñosas cada uno en sus propios negocio, día a día salen a delante con el fin de tener y darles a los suyos una mejor vida.
Celestina es una mujer que ha trabajado desde hace mucho tiempo, comenzó vendiendo menú en una carreta que lo traslada desde su casa (parte alta de un cerro hasta un mercado céntrico ofreciendo ambulatoriamente su comida); sus hijos aún pequeños le apoyaban en este pequeño negocio. Como toda madre Celestina lo hacía por darles lo mejor a sus hijos especialmente apoyarlos en su educación escolar; así compartía los gastos con su pareja quien trabajaba y ganaba lo necesario. Tuvo que dejar con el tiempo el negocio de comida porque se enfermó y ya no podía hacer demasiado esfuerzo. Posteriormente plantó otro esta vez diferente cerca de su casa y a un colegio; la venta de golosinas en un kiosco. A pesar de la competencia cercana no se queja obtiene ingresos son regulares necesario para la alimentación y sobretodo que le ayudó culminar los estudios a sus hijos. Celestina además presta servicio de lavado de ropa y deshierba las chacras cuando se presenta la oportunidad. Celestina necesita seguir invirtiendo en piqueos, gaseosas, chicles y galletas. Terminar de construir su viviendo es uno de sus metas.
texts.en:
“Las Positivas” (The Positives) is a communal bank composed of 7 members, each very motivated in their own businesses. Day after day, they head out, with the goal of obtaining and giving  their dependents what they need for a better life.

Celestina is woman who has worked for a long time. She began selling food from a little cart that she transported from her house (on top of a hill) to the central market, offering food on wheels. Her children are still young but they help her in this little business.

Like all mothers, Celestina does what she can to provide the best for her children, especially to help them with their education. In this she joins her husband who works and earns all he can. Celestina had to abandon her business for a while because she fell ill and could not work so hard.

Later, she moved her business to a different spot near her house and a school, selling sweets in a kiosk. Despite nearby competition, she managed regularly to obtain sufficient earnings to provide food and, above all, to help her children finish their educations.

Celestina also offers laundry service and weeds fields when the opportunity presents itself. She needs to continue buying snacks, soft drinks, chewing gum and cookies to sell. One of her goals is to finish constructing her house.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, chewing gum, and cookies to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, de 49 años, convive desde hace 26 años con Daria, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Huandunga, Palca. Hace más de 28 años, se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, arveja y habas, sobre sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que posee. Asimismo menciona que gracias al auto que tiene, realiza el servicio de  trasporte público cubriendo las rutas de Palca a Tarma, puede obtener un ingreso extra para la economía de su familia. Desde entonces le va muy bien,  tanto que hace algún tiempo tenía 2 autos, con los que trabajaba, sin embargo tuvo perdidas en la siembra de arveja que tuvo que vede un carro. “No dejaré de sembrar, es mi vida”, afirma, pues le gusta mucho esta actividad, en el que desea intensificarse para aumentar su productividad. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente satisfecho por el apoyo. Pues cambiará su calidad de vida. El techo de la casa de Samuel, se encuentra con orificios donde ingresa agua. Por ello con el crédito invertirá en el techado de su casa, asimismo colocará puertas y ventanas de los cuartos que tiene 20 años de antigüedad.
texts.en:
Samuel, 49, has lived with Daria for the last 26 years.  They have four children but only two of them live with him in his own house located in Huandunga, Palca.  For over 28 years he’s farmed potatoes, peas, corn and broad beans on his 3 hectares of farmland.  He also mentions that thanks to owning a car he provides taxi services along the Talca-Palca route to earn extra income for his family.  He’s done very well since then so much so that not long ago he had two cars that he worked with but, unfortunately, he had some losses with his pea crops and had to sell one of the cars.

“I’ll never stop farming; it’s my life,” he affirms, because he enjoys this activity very much.  He wants to intensify it in order to increase production.

This is his first loan with MFP where he feels very satisfied with the support because it will change his quality of life.  

The roof on Samuel’s house has holes in it that let water in.  Because of this he’ll use the loan to reroof his house as well as install doors and windows on the rooms which are 20 years old.

loans.use: to roof his house and replace doors and windows.

loans.name: Gloria Concepción

texts.es:
Gloria  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene educación superior.
La señora cuenta que tiene un cafetín en un colegio muy conocido de su localidad, su préstamo anterior de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió íntegramente en su negocio.
Gloria solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de galletas, caramelos, chocolates, etc.,  también productos como arroz, azúcar, papa, carne y pollos, etc., para la preparación de alimentos que luego venderá en su cafetín.  La señora trabaja con un ayudante en el negocio ya que su esposo es músico y viaja a diferentes lugares de la ciudad.
Su sueño es tener un restaurant y un negocio de servicio de internet.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the "3 de Mayo" community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She has a high school level of education.

Gloria tells us that she has a café in a very well-known high school in her town.  Her previous loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested all of that money in her business.

Gloria is requesting a new loan for 3,000 soles to invest in buying cookies, candies, chocolates, etc.  She will also buy products such as rice, sugar, potatoes, meat, chicken, etc. to prepare the food that she will then sell in her café.  She works in her business with an assistant since her husband is a musician and travels to different parts of the city.

Gloria's dream is to own a restaurant and an Internet café.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans and what she earns on the internal account.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candies, chocolates and also supplies for making food

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Josephine requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothes to sell.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Estefany

texts.es: Gloria es una joven de 20 años muy dinámica y emprendedora que se dedica a la actividad comercial, vendiendo artesanias y otras mercanicas que trae de Sn Pues un Municipio del departamento de Sucre, y distribuye entre sus clientes, entre los que se cuentan vecinos, famliares, amigos, empleados, trabajadores independientes de los barrios Los Almendros, El campito, La Alboraya El santuario en Barranquilla y recientemente abrio una plaza en el municipio de Galapa a 15 minutos de la ciudad mencionada. En el negocio trabaja con su madre a quien le debe mucho de su experincia y tambien su novio.  Gloria vende sus productos a crédito en mayor volumen y con abonos semanales y quincenales, aunque en algunas plazas cobra diariamente. En la actualidad parte de sus compras la hace a proveedores de contado y alguna de ellas a créditos. El desplazamiento al municipio de Sanpues lo realiza en transporte público, viajando dos veces por mes.  El negocio de Gloria presenta buenos indices de liquidez,  rotaciòn de sus cuentas por cobrar cada 18 días y muy rápidamente sus inventarios. Asi mismo presenta niveles de rentabilidad que demuestran la eficiencia  y solvencia del negocio para compromisos futuros y su mayor desafio es la distancia que tiene que recorrer para acceder a los productos que requiere y tambien los costos del mismo que no se mantienen estables. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprarà candelabros, lámparas manufacturadas, esquineras y mecedores, para complacer a sus principales clientes que le han solicitado estos productos.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 20, is a dynamic and enterprising young woman who works in the retail sector. She sells handicrafts and other types of merchandise that are brought in from Sampués, a town in the Department of Sucre. Gloria distributes her goods to her customers who include neighbors, relatives, friends, employees, and independent workers in the neighborhoods of Los Almendros, El Campito, La Alboraya, and El Santuario in Barranquilla. She recently opened a shop in the town plaza of Galapa, which is 15 minutes away from Barranquilla. Gloria manages her business with her mother, who has plenty of experience, and her boyfriend. She sells her products on credit and in large volumes and then collects payment either weekly or every 15 days. In some places, she collects payment on a daily basis. At the moment, she must pay cash for the merchandise she acquires from her distributors, but there are some who will extend credit to her. Gloria’s trips to the town of Sampués occur twice per month and she utilizes public transportation. Her business shows good indication of its liquidity. Her accounts receivable period averages 18 days and the product turnover within her inventory moves very rapidly. In addition, her profitability levels indicate that her business is efficient and solvent enough to cover her future commitments. However, her greatest challenge is taking into account the distance she must travel to acquire her products. Gloria must also consider her travel costs since those factors are not stable.

This Kiva loan is her first form of financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy chandeliers, manufactured lamps, cupboards, and rocking chairs so that she can satisfy her main customers who have requested these products.

loans.use: to purchase chandeliers, manufactured lamps, cupboards, and rocking chairs.

loans.name: Dilma Maria

texts.es:
Dilma trabaja para desde hace 11 años como  medico general. Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de mejorar las paredes de su vivienda que estan en mal estado y brindarle a su familia mayor seguridad. Cabe mencionar que con los creditos anteriores ha realizado mejoras en su casa, sin embargo hasta ahora espera hacerlo con el apoyo de kiva. 

Sueña con poder seguir mejorado su casa y  las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dilma has been working as a doctor (GP) for 11 years.  She is requesting her sixth loan with the aim of improving the walls in her home, which are in a bad state of repair, and providing her family with better safety.  She used her previous loans to make improvements to her home.  However, from now on, she hopes to do it with Kiva's support.  

Dilma dreams of being able to continue improving her home and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her walls

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a committed 23-year-old business lady. She is a single mother to a four-year-old child who attends school. To make a living for the last four years, she has been operating a grocery shop. She wants in the next five years, to have expanded her business and employed several people so she can become a manager. Her dream is to be a prosperous business lady.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy kale, tomatoes and onions. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has now become open-minded about business.

loans.use: to buy kale, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de zaña que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Luis Alberto se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos  naturales, una vez que lleguen a su peso  y tamaño ideal lo ofrece a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales de diferentes especies, para seguir comercializandolos en los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un buen precio por ellos y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Luis Alberto  es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere en especialmente sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 33, lives with his wife and children in his own house that has running water and electricity and is located in Zaña District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  This is a zone that’s noted for farming, animal husbandry and tourism.

Luis Alberto has been raising sheep to sell for several years.  His corral is in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses.  When they reach ideal size and weight he sells them to his customers and uses income obtained to cover household expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more animals of different species to continue selling them in various markets in his area with the end in mind of getting good prices for them so that his income will increase and he will have better quality of life.

Luis Alberto is a hardworking, very responsible person; the only thing he wants is that his family, especially his children, get ahead.

loans.use: to buy animals of other species to continue selling them.

loans.name: Goibboy

texts.ru:
Гоиббой честный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и любящий отец 1 ребёнка. Его жена домохозяйка. Гоиббой занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить своё жилищное условие, а также обучит свою дочь в хороших университетах. С прибылью, который он планирует, он хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Гоиббой хотел бы получить займ в размере 2600$ США для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Goibboy is an honest and hardworking man. He is married and a loving father to one child. His wife is a homemaker. Goibboy practices animal husbandry and raising crops. He wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions, as well as allow his daughter to study at a good university. Using the profit he has planned, he wants to renovate his home. Goibboy is requesting a loan of $2600 to purchase livestock, with the intent of growing his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rosa
