texts.es: Rosa e socia del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, se dedica la Confitería (fabrica cancha de maíz y fideos), este préstamo lo invertirá para poder comprar mas maíz e insumos para hacer las canchas, ella tiene una fabrica para hacer las canchas, su esposo aprendió a hacer las canchas en Lima, y se vinieron a Ayacucho, empezaron con dos máquinas y ahora ya tiene 6 máquinas, da gracias a Finca porque le apoyaron mucho, aprende muchas cosa que le ayudan a poder practicarlo en su trabajo, y en su familia. La meta que tiene es poder ampliar su negocio, y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Yanapanakusun”. She is 36 years old and has three children. Rosa makes food products such as “cancha de maíz” (an Andean roasted corn snack similar to corn nuts) and noodles. This loan will be invested in the purchase of corn and supplies for making “canchas”. She has a factory where these snacks are made. Her husband learned how to make “canchas” in Lima before coming to Ayacucho. He started out with two machines and now has six of them.

Thanks to FINCA Peru and the tremendous amount of support they have received, Rosa and her husband have learned many things that they practice in their work and in their family. Her goal is to expand her business and to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy corn and supplies for making "canchas".

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 24 years old and still single.She is currently residing in the village of Rizal Santiago. She is hardworking and business-minded person.

Jasmin owns a warehouse wherein she stores the grains she buys from her suppliers. She has been engaged in a "buy and sell" grain business for six years. She's thankful because she is able to maintain her business. Jasmin's goal is to save and continue improving her business. For this reason, she is looking for ways to improve the service she provides to her customers.

To fulfill her goal, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P40,000 to be use in buying more grains, most especially this crop season. Many customers will sell their grain to her because of the rainy season and typhoons they experience nowadays. She is hoping that she can attain her goal for her business.

loans.use: to be used in her business buying and selling grain.

loans.name: Enma Lorena

texts.es:
Enma tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, reside en el Barrio San Jose en el Departamento de El Paraiso. 

Enma es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora de la vida. Hace unos años su esposo la abandonó a ella y a sus dos hijos y para sacar a su pequeña familia tuvo que mudarse a la casa de sus padres y empezó a dedicarse a una actividad economica y a otra pero en ninguna le iba bien asi que decidió buscar un empleo, el cual consiguió. Luego de unos años de haber conseguido el trabajo decidió ponerse a vender cosmeticos por catalogos para tener una fuente extra de ingresos y le ha ido muy bien. La mayoria de sus ventas las realiza con sus compañeros de trabajo, los fines de semana sale a vender en la comunidad y tambien en su casa tiene unos cuantos productos para la venta. 

El prestamo que Enma solicita lo necesita para surtir de mas y variados productos como barniz de uñas, listick, sombras de ojos, delinear de ojos y labios, cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo Enma podra ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes y espera que sus ventas mejoren, y obtener una buena ganancia que le permita llevar el sustento a su casa.

Su meta es instalar una tienda de variedades en su casa y dedicarle mas tiempo a la crianza de sus dos hijos. Este es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el compromiso de sus cuotas de manera puntual como lo hizo en el prestamo anterior.
texts.en:
Enma is 43 years old and a single mother of two children. She lives in the neighborhood of San Jose located in the El Paraiso department.

Enma is a hard working person and a fighter in life. A few years ago, her husband abandoned her and her two children. In order to keep her small family going, she had to move to her parents’ house. She began making a living in one endeavor after the other, but none of them went well, so she decided to look for employment and she found it. After a few years of working, she decided to begin selling catalogue cosmetics as an extra source of income. It has gone very well for her. She makes most of her sales through her work mates. On the weekends she goes out to the community to make her sales in addition to the few products she has for sale at her home.  

Enma needs the loan she is requesting to increase and diversify her supply of products such as nail polish, lipstick, eye shadows, eyeliner and lip liner, creams, deodorants and perfumes among other things. With the help of this loan, Enma will be able to offer a larger quantity of products to her customers. She hopes that her sales will improve and that she will make a better profit that allows her to support her home.

Her goal is to start a variety shop in her house and spend more time raising her two children. This is her second loan with FAMA and she hopes to make good on her repayment commitment as punctually as she did on her last loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline has been engaged in corn production for 28 years. She also has a business raising hogs, primarily for breeding. Evangeline is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family from poverty.

Evangeline is married and has four children. She says that she has been able to supplement her family's daily needs through the income generated from her business. 

Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production. She hopes that she can get the amount she requests to further develop her business

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат молодой предприниматель, заботливый сын и хороший семьянин. Источником его дохода является предоставление услуги такси населению. Он в семье является единственным кормильцем. Его жена домохозяйка, а родители на пенсии и он помогает им. Недавно у Фурката родился сын и он решил продать свой старый автомобиль и купить новую и таким образом улучшить условие своего бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу поддержку в получении кредита и заранее благодарить вас всех за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Furkat is a young entrepreneur, a caring son and a good family man.  Providing a taxi service to residents is his source of income.  Furkat is the sole provider for his family.  His wife is a homemaker, and parents are retired, and he helps them.  Furkat recently had a son, and he decided to sell his old car and buy a new one and, thus, improve his business conditions.  He hopes to receive your support in obtaining this loan and thanks all of you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 35-year-old married woman living in the western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone, near the town of Aberdeen. She has one child, aged 17 years old. The child is currently attending school.

Fatmata has been running her business for five years now and sells drinks, cream, provisions and bike spare parts. Her primary income source is from the business of commercial bike, while she also sells assorted drinks on occasion. She says that the main challenges to her business are inflation and transportation problems.

 She has now requested this loan to through BRAC in order to buy more assorted drinks, provision and bikes spare parts. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living.

Fatmata has plans for expansion in the next 5-10 years, and her main goal is to open branches of the same business. She says this will enable her to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted drinks, provisions, cream and bike spare parts.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en: Madeline is 68 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Madeline has a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines. Madeline requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell in her store. Madeline has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Madeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам начал заниматься бизнесом 12 лет назад. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Он выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. На 2 гектарах земли он выращивает картошку и на 6 гектарах пшеницу. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль для содержания своих детей. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки 6 голов скота  и корма для них, с целью расширения бизнеса. На полученный ежегодный доход расширяет свое хозяйство, а часть дохода расходует на благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Uktam launched his business 12 years ago. He is married and has four children. He grows agricultural produce. He grows potatoes on two hectares of land and wheat on six hectares of land. He would like to expand his business and obtain good revenues in order to support his children. He would like to obtain a loan in order to buy six heads of cattle as well as animal feed for them, so as to expand his business. He keeps expanding his business with the annual revenues he gets, and uses part of the revenue to improve his family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle and animal feed

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is a 55-year-old single lady from Suna Ragana in the outskirts of Migori county, Western Kenya.

Greta has been operating a fish selling business for the past twenty two years. She makes a good monthly income of KES.15,000 and is now taking her third loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy stock of fish for sale. Her profits will be channeled back into the business.

Her dream is to see her business expand so that she is able to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Kuseyo

texts.en:
Kuseyo is 43 years old and married with six children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 16 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his first loan and he has plans to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals with the loan and also buy animals like cows and goats for raising. He intends to use the returns from the loan to reinvest into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a well-known farmer in the area and provide higher level of education to his kids. He is a hard-working man who struggles to achieve his goals and says he only needs funding to attain more goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Leotele

texts.en:
Leotele is thirty eight years old and is married with four children. Leotele owns and operates a business venture selling specialty handwoven products to tourists and local community members. She has two years of experience in this business. Leotele needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase raw materials to make mats and mattresses. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Leotele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Leotele's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make mats and mattresses.

loans.name: Glocita

texts.en:
Glocita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Glocita dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Mr. Roland M. was born on September 15, 1980 in Lomé. Having styled his brothers, sisters and friends early with much attention and finesse, his parents pushed him towards this career. He began an apprenticeship and never stopped wowing people with his great work. Very dynamic and an entrepreneur, he was able to open his own salon just after his apprenticeship ended, thanks to a loan of $150 that he obtained and regularly paid back. The efficacity and quality of his work makes him an excellent hair stylist in his community. Facing clients that are more and more demanding, Mr. M. now feels the need to update his equipment in order to be line with their requests. IN order to do this, he is asking for a $1200 credir to improve his salon and his equipment. This credit will alow him to buy electric razors, hair dryers, wash basins and cosmetic beauty products. Financing this young man to improve his salon will be a great encouragement for others in the community to follow in his footsteps and take charge of their own destinies and not fall into juvenile deliquency.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur M. Roland est né le 15 septembre 1980 à Lomé. Ayant commencé très tôt à coiffer ses frères, ses sœurs et ses amis à la maison avec beaucoup de soin et de finesse, ses parents ont jugé bon de l’orienter vers ce métier. Il entra en apprentissage et ne cessa de séduire tout le monde par son travail bien fait. Très dynamique et entreprenant, il réussit à ouvrir un salon de coiffure juste après sa formation, ceci grâce à un crédit de $150 qu’il a obtenu et régulièrement emboursé. L’efficacité et la qualité de son travail font de lui un excellent coiffeur dans son quartier. Face à une clientèle de plus en plus abondante et exigeante, M. M. se trouve dans l’obligation de perfectionner son équipement en vue d’être à la hauteur de la demande. Mais il ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour le faire. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour aménager et renforcer son salon en équipement. Ce crédit servira à l’achat des tondeuses électriques, des séchoirs, des lave-tête, des produits de beauté et cosmétiques. Financer ce jeune garçon à améliorer son salon de coiffure fera tache d’huile dans la quartier et encouragera d’autres jeunes à emboîter ses pas pour leur auto prie en charge afin d’éviter la délinquance juvénile.

loans.use: Update the look and equipment for his hair salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Armstrong.

texts.en:
Born in 1966, Armstrong is married and has seven children. His greatest ambition in life is to see all his children become responsible citizens. To make this dream come true, he needs to give his children a good education. Motivated by his ambitions and other GHAPE members in his locality, he joined the program in 2006 and was able to successfully establish and managed a small pig-farm. His community appreciates him for  the fresh vegetables he cultivates with unsold manure and for the manure he sells.

Given a loan of $300, Armstrong plans to maintain his activity by buying 2-piglets and sticks to repair  the fence. His objective is to build sound skills in piggery while providing his community with food and manure. He plans to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Restructuring of pigsty and buying of piglets

loans.name: "nini" Aurora

texts.en:
"Nini" has been working at her general food store for over 2 years. She explains how she started working here: “my party [meaning political] lost power and I lost my job.” She had a job as an employee in the “Food Price Stabilization Institute,” which was given to her as a political favor.

With four kids to feed, and no husband in her life, she has to sell what she can at her store, including fish, meat, etc. “I sell a lot of beer too! As well as chicken, coffee and cigarettes,” she explains. When I was visiting her, suddenly a strong smell of Codfish engulfed me. I asked what it was and she replied, "That's the best!" Nini would like the loan to stock her general store.

loans.use: Stocking Food Store

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en: Lamrana is thirty-eight years old and a widow with four children.  She lost her husband four years ago, and is solely responsible for her family.  Lamrana has had four loans from SMT and  these loans have given her hope for a better future for her children and enabled her to diversify her business. She sells beans, locally produced rice, sugar and millet in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Lamrana is requesting a loan of $250 so she can buy stock from the villages and stores and resell them in the off season  to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale goods for selling during the off season for greater profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food and drink inventory.

loans.name: Irma Lucia

texts.es:
Señora Irma Lucía is 34 years old, she completed primary school and has a son who is still dependent on her. She lives in the district of Carabamba, province of Julcan, department of La Libertad.

Currently, Irma busies herself raising cattle, which having fattened-up she sells for meat: she also buys cheese to sell in Trujillo and buys barley and wheat wholesale to sell in different zones of Trujillo town.

Irma began this business with her first loan of 300 Soles which she received from the communal “Alpha and Omega” bank, with which she bought a sack of wheat and barley and little by little she has been able to do this in larger quantities. Later, with subsequent loans, she established a grocery store, but she had to close this because there was too much competition. With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy concentrated feed for her animals and some sacks of wheat and barley.

Currently, Irma is part of a club of mothers called “Miraculous Medal”, and she feels very happy to offer her services in this club to help needy people in her community.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Irma Lucía tiene 34 años de edad, estudió primaria completa y tiene un hijo que aún depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libertad.

Actualmente la señora Irma se dedica a la crianza de carneros, vacas para que después de engordarlos venda su carne, también compra quesillos para vender en la ciudad de Trujillo y compra cebada y trigo al por mayor para vender en diferentes zonas de la ciudad de Trujillo.

La señora Irma inició un negocio con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió en el Banco Comunal “Alfa y Omega”, con lo cual compró un saco de trigo y cebada y poco a poco fue haciéndolo en mayor cantidad. Posteriormente con sus siguientes préstamos puso una bodega, pero la tuvo que cerrar porque hay mucha competencia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará alimento concentrado para sus animales y algunos sacos de trigo y cebada.

Actualmente la señora Irma forma parte del club de madres “Medalla Milagrosa” y se siente muy contenta de brindar sus servicios en este club para beneficiar a gente necesitada de su comunidad.

loans.use: Purcahse of concentrated animal feed and some sacks of wheat and barley

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a very hard-working woman and in spite of being both mother and father to her three children, the solitude she feels from not having the companionship of a husband has not stopped her from having a good sense of humor that keeps her moving forward. Five years ago she decided to dedicate herself to raising and selling hamsters to be able to provide for her family. She feels very satisfied because she has accomplished what she set out to do from the start, becoming the biggest provider of hamsters in the community. She did this thanks to the training she received through the local government, which she did with a lot of attention and has followed through on all their recommendations. Among her biggest dreams is expanding her business into the biggest one of its kind in the country. With this goal in mind, she also had been making food in the afternoons for them but could not continue because it was risky during pregnancy. She is now asking for help from your noble hearts so she can purchase the right kind of feed for her hamsters in large quantities to help her continue satisfying the needs of her household through this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa, es una mujer muy trabajadora y a pesar de que sola asume el papel de padre y de madre para sus tres hijos, la soledad que siente por no gozar de la compañía de su esposo no deja de tener un buen sentido del humor que la anima a seguir progresando.Hace cinco años decidió dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes para sostener a su familia, se siente muy satisfecha porque ha logrado lo que se había trazado en un inicio, hacer que su criadero de cuyes sea el más grande de su comunidad y lo ha logrado gracias a las capacitaciones que recibió a través del municipio de su localidad a la cual ha tomado mucha atención y ha aplicado cada una de las recomendaciones. Entre sus grandes sueños está la meta de alcanzar la expansión de sus criaderos para convertirse en la más grande proveedora de cuyes de su país.Con este fin en mente estuvo también preparando alimentos para ofrecerlos por las tardes sin embargo tuvo que abandonar este oficio debido a que se encuentra en un una etapa muy riesgosa de su embarazo; por este motivo solicita la ayuda de vuestro noble corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para adqurir mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado para sus cuyes con el objetivo de seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de su hogar a través de esta su principal actividad económica.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of hamster feed.

loans.name: Buzika East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Naume M.. She is currently in the business of hardware shop and is requesting a loan to add in business. Naume is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver.She has 6 children ranging from age 3 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Naume makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a commercial motorcycle Naume has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add in hardware business and the loan was paid back on time.

Naume is joined in her small group by Nuuru N., Margret S., Hadijah K., and Teklah Nabuuso. Nuuru N. has a business in brick lying and wants to boost business. Margret S. is currently operating a business in bakery and wants a loan to expand business. Hadijah K. operates a business of grocery store and wants to increase stock. Teklah Nabuuso is currently in the business of stationary shop and is requesting a loan to add in more capital.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware equipment for sale

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela works diligently caring for small animals at a facility in her home, animals which she then sells at various fairs in the area. She shows the same dedication to the small creatures that she shows to her small children, and, in a short amount of time, they have provided her with excellent earnings. She is eager to increase the capacity of her animal care facilities to accommodate a greater number of animals. With your strong support, she will be able to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spansish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

DANIELA, se desempeña en las instalaciones de su hogar diligentemente en la crianza de animales pequeños que comercializa en las diferentes ferias de su localidad, los pequeños animalitos a los cuales les presta la misma dedicación que a sus pequeños hijos le han otorgado en poco tiempo excelentes ganancias y está deseosa de incrementar la capacidad de sus instalaciones para poder albergar mayor cantidad de ejemplares. Con tu importante apoyo podrá lograr lo que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: To improve animal care facilities.

loans.name: Mwantumu's Uwenacho Group

texts.en:
Mwantumu is 38 years old and is married woman with 5 children, ages 5-25 years old. Mwantumu is a utensils product seller, she started in 1992. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more utensils product for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwandaima, who has business dealing in Fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more utensils product for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a widow and the mother of three children. Two of the children are in school. She has been selling grocery products like evaporated milk, tinned fish, candies, margarine, tinned tomatoes, etc. for two years. There is now a high rise in the price of grocery products and Ama wants to use her loan to buy products to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes. Ama wants to start savings to help her children to complete their education. She is a member of the group called Work and Happiness. Members guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Right after finishing high school, Juan decided to leave his village, Atuncolla, in search of a better future. Since then he has been living in the city of Juliaca. As he has not been able to find work, he decided to rent a moto-taxi (motorcycle-taxi) and work as a chauffeur. With the savings from this endeavor he was finally able to purchase his own moto-taxi. Now he is required to join a company so that he can insure his vehicle. As joining the company is very expensive, Juan is asking for a loan to help him bear the initial cost.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Apenas concluyó sus estudios secundarios Juan decidió salir de su pueblo natal Atuncolla en busca de un mejor porvenir, desde entonces radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, al ver que no lograba conseguir trabajo decidió alquilarse un mototaxi y prestar servicios de movilidad, con los ahorros que fue reuniendo durante el tiempo que trabajaba pudo finalmente adquirir su propia movilidad.Ahora le exigen que se asocie a una empresa, para que los servicios que preste sean seguros y formales y todo ese trámite le demanda un gasto económico sustancial, Juan espera recibir tu colaboración para llevar a cabo este propósito.

loans.use: Help defray the initial cost of joining a transportation company.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronilla is 63 years old, she couldn’t study, is married and has 3 sons, and a daughter, they all work independently, she lives in Queñuan village in the district of Yunyugo. She has her husband’s support.

She works selling pigs, cows and sheep, in the Chacachaca fair, in Yunyugo, she has been working since she was very young. Currently she is a member of the community bank “Vista Alegre” where she started with a credit of S/. 300.00 new soles that she used to buy 5 sheep.

With the new credit of S/. 500.00 new soles, that will be cancelled in 4 months, she will buy a veal to rise and then sell.

She will keep on working because the loan helps her and it will increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Petronila tiene 63 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y tiene hijos varones y una hija mujer , quienes trabajan independientemente, vive en villa Queñuani del Distrito de Yunguyo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Se dedica a la venta de chanchos, vacas y ovejas, en las ferias de Chacachaca, Yunguyo, se dedico al negocio desde muy joven. Actualmente ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre” donde en un inicio tuvo un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra 5 ovejas. Con este crédito de S/. 500.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará una ternera la cual criará y luego pondrá en venta. Ella seguirá trabajando, por que el préstamo le ayuda bastante y de esa manera incrementa sus ingresos.

loans.use: To buy cattle (a veal) / Compra de ganado (ternera)

loans.name: Fatina's Tausi Group

texts.en:
Fatina is 40 years old. She is a married with three children, between the ages of 14 and 18. She has owned and run a small grocery store since 2003. Everyday, she works from 2 p.m. to 11 p.m. at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatina now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Janeth, who has business selling rice.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nassirou

texts.fr: Nassirou O. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Revendeur d’huile à moteur et de pétrole lampant depuis plus de 3 ans, Nassirou habite à Kpalimé, une ville située à 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il aimerait par ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des bidons de carburant afin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
At 39 years old, Nassirou O. is married and the father of three (3) children who all attend school. He has been a retailer of motor oil and kerosene for the last three (3) years. Nassirou lives in Kpalime, a town located approximately 120 Kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. This is his third loan from FECECAV and with it he would like to increase the size of his business, buying drums of fuel to meet his customer demands. He is expecting with this opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motor oil and kerosene for resale

loans.name: The Suns Group

texts.es:
Maria Isabel es la coodinadora del Grupo Los Soles, que esta integrado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras con ganas de salir adelante.

Ana inicio el negocio para sacar a su hija adelante, ya que estaba pequña y no tenia quien se la cuidara, por lo que empezó vendiendo zapatos con vecinas y después fue a las empresas para venderle a los empleados y fue asi como logro salir adelante.

Isabel inicio el negocio para salir adelante y darle a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida, comenzo vendiendo ropa en un pequeño puesto instalado afuera de su casa hasta que con la ganancia compro una estructura y empezó a vender en los mercados.

Martha inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo ya que recibia un sueldo muy bajo, empezó vendiendo joyeria entre sus vecinos y mas adelante su esposo se la llevo a su trabajo para vender a sus compañeros.

Ellas requieren un prestamo por US $900 que pagaran en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con sus negocios. Con tu ayuda ellas saldran adelante.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is the coordinator of The Suns group, which is composed of three women entrepreneurs eager to get ahead. Ana started her business in order to take her daughter with her to work when she was little, as she had no one with whom to leave the girl. For this reason, Ana began selling shoes to neighbors, and later went to places of business to sell to the employees. Doing so, she was able to come out ahead. Isabel went into business with success in mind and to give her children a better quality of life. She began by selling clothes from a small stall outside her home. With her earnings, she purchased an enclosure and began selling in marketplaces. Martha began her business in order to assist her husband whose salary was quite low. She started by selling jewelry to neighbors, and later accompanied her husband to work to sell to his colleagues. In order to purchase merchandise to continue doing business, the ladies are requesting a loan of $900, which they will repay within five months. With your assistance, they will find success.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi, a hardworking 42-year-old widow who cares for her five children alone, sells cooked Nigerian foods such as fufu, amala, and egusi, plus drinks, in her shop.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. Ngozi says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and food stuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Rorn S., a 40-year-old resident of Chrolorng Commune in Kopong Tom Province, raises ducks in order to sell their eggs, often collecting over 100 eggs per day. This mother of three school-aged children is married to Mr. Khoun Som, 44, who breeds cows for a living.

Rorn is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more food for her ducks. The increased revenue resulting from this loan will help her to meet her family's expenses and pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more food for her ducks.

loans.name: Mrs. Sophos Khon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who all live in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province form this village bank. They will use the loan for a variety of purposes.

Mrs. Sophos K. owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Khoem Sarin, is a motorbike repairer who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sophos K. is 39 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting partly of end-of-term (EoT) loans. Three members have EoT loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Such loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. EoT allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Alijandra

texts.en: Alijandra C., is 51 years old and a resident of Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is a single parent who has been separated for 19 years, and she has devoted her life to her 2 kids and her business. She sells candy and sliced unripe mangoes. Her loyal customers are bystanders of the city plaza. One day, she decided to start selling charcoal to food stalls around the area and she was impressed with the return. Her goal is to be able to support her children. She plans to expand her business by adding additional capital to her charcoal retailing. Alijandra hopes that one day she'll have a permanent location for her store.

loans.use: additional capital for her ventured charcoal retailing

loans.name: Tunlaye

texts.en:
Tunlaye is 40 years old and married with three children. She sells medicine and provisions.

Tunlaye plans to increase her sales by increasing her stocks. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 naira to purchase more medicine and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mohammad has been working as a car repairer since 2000. He is a car mechanic and he sells spare parts. Mohammad requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and merchandise for his garage. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan.

Mohammad is trustworthy and he does good work. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because he took his father’s business, and his father already had built a network of clients. Mohammad decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his family's income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and finish purchasing all the required equipment for his garage.

loans.use: To purchase tools and merchandise for his garage

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
El Sr Concepciòn es  oriundo de la  ciudad de Roque Gonzalez. Tiene 58 años, es soltero  y  no tiene  hijos. Ahora vive en compañía de su  hermano  y  juntos  llevan adelante una  pequeña  despensa en su casa.  Viven  en casa  propia que lograron construir con  mucho ezfuerzo.

Desde muy joven Concepciòn fue  independiente, ya que  fue  huerfano de padre de niño y tuvo  que pasar  por  muchas  necesidades  para  poder ayudar a  su madre para salir adelante. El no  tuvo  la suerte de tener  hijos  pero  vive con su hermano menor y su madre y juntos forman  una   familia.

Con el  ingreso que le genera  su actividad logra mantener a su madre ya que es anciana  y vive con èl.
Con el crèdito obtenido comprarà azucar y maiz.
texts.en:
Concepciòn is from the city of Roque Gonzalez. He is 58 years old and single, and has no children. Now he lives with his brother, and together they run a small store in their home. Concepciòn owns his house, which he and his brother built together. Since he was very young, Concepciòn has been independent. He never knew his father, and had to forgo many basic necessities in order to help his mother get ahead. He was not lucky enough to have children, but he lives with his younger brother and their mother, and together they are a family. Concepciòn's income allows him to support his mother, who is now elderly. With this loan he'll buy sugar and corn.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, corn, and other supplies for his store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est constitué de quatre femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments alimentaires, de boissons et de poisson frais.  
Après avoir correctement remboursés les deux premiers prêts, elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles l’ont sollicité afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 cartons de poisson frais, 10 casiers de boissons et un important stock des condiments alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent  en gros au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et à Mopti (la venise malienne, 5ème région administrative du Mali)  Les marchandises sont vendues en détail au grand marché de Sikasso ville  et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi ambitionnent d’agrandir leurs activités.
texts.en:
This Benkadi group is made up of four married women with an average age of 40 and 5 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They have various businesses, among others selling condiments, drinks and fresh fish. After having correctly reimbursed their first two loans, they are on their third solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They requested the loan so as to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele. With this loan they intend to buy 20 cartons of fresh fish, 10 crates of drinks, and a large stock of condiments. They get their supplies wholesale in the big open-air market of Sikasso and in Mopti (the "Venice of Mali", 5th administrative region of Mali).

Their merchandise is sold retail at the big market of the town of Sikasso and often door-to-door to a clientele composed of women and men, mostly for cash. They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 15,000 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest reinvested into their businesses.

The ambition of the women of this Benkadi group is to enlarge their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments, drinks, and fresh fish for re-sale
